revision.comment: I added more details of the first expedition to the South Magnetic Pole.
revision.text:
{{Redirect|Magnetic south||Magnetic South (disambiguation)}} {{for|additional general information about the Earth's magnetic poles|North Magnetic Pole}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}}
[[Image:Magnetic South Pole locations.png|thumb|350px|Locations of South Magnetic Pole from direct observation and model prediction.<ref name=NGDC>{{cite web |title=Wandering of the Geomagnetic Poles |url=http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/GeomagneticPoles.shtml |author=NOAA National Geophysical Data Center |accessdate=October 10, 2011}}</ref>]] The '''South Magnetic Pole''' is the wandering point on the [[Earth]]'s [[Southern Hemisphere]] where the [[Earth's magnetic field|geomagnetic field]] lines are directed vertically upwards. It should not be confused with the '''South Geomagnetic Pole''' described later.
For historical reasons, the "end" of a freely hanging magnet that points (roughly) north is itself called the "north pole" of the magnet, and the other end, pointing south, is called the magnet's "south pole". Because opposite poles attract, the Earth's South Magnetic Pole is physically actually a magnetic ''north'' pole (see also {{format link|North Magnetic Pole#Polarity}}).
The South Magnetic Pole is constantly shifting due to changes in the Earth's magnetic field. As of 2005 it was calculated to lie at {{Coord|64|31|48|S|137|51|36|E|region:AQ_type:landmark}},<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/faqgeom.shtml|title=Geomagnetism Frequently Asked Questions |publisher=[[NGDC]]|accessdate=11 January 2009}}</ref> placing it off the coast of Antarctica, between [[Adélie Land]] and [[Wilkes Land]]. In 2015 it lay at {{Coord|64.28|S|136.59|E|region:AQ_type:landmark}} (est).<ref name=BritishGeological>[http://www.geomag.bgs.ac.uk/education/poles.html British Geological Survey - Magnetic Poles]</ref> That point lies outside the [[Antarctic Circle]]. Due to [[polar drift]], the pole is moving northwest by about {{Convert|10|to|15|km|0}} per year. Its current distance from the actual [[South Pole|Geographic South Pole]] is approximately {{Convert|2860|km||abbr=on}}.<ref name="NGDC" /> The nearest permanent science station is [[Dumont d'Urville Station]]. Wilkes Land contains a large gravitational [[Wilkes Land crater#Wilkes Land mass concentration|mass concentration]].
{| class="wikitable" |- |North Magnetic Pole<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gsc.nrcan.gc.ca/geomag/nmp/northpole_e.php |title=Geomagnetism, North Magnetic Pole |work=Geological Survey of Canada |publisher=Natural Resources Canada |accessdate=11 January 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100326235810/http://gsc.nrcan.gc.ca/geomag/nmp/northpole_e.php |archivedate=26 March 2010 |df= }}</ref>||(2001) {{coord|81.3|N|160.06|W|}}||(2004 est) {{coord|82.3|N|113.4|W|}} || (2007) {{coord|83.95|N|120.72|W|}} || (2015) {{Coord|86.29|N|160.06|W|}}<ref name=BritishGeological/><ref name="WDCG-Kyoto">{{cite web|url=http://wdc.kugi.kyoto-u.ac.jp/poles/polesexp.html|title=Magnetic North, Geomagnetic and Magnetic Poles|author=World Data Center for Geomagnetism, Kyoto|accessdate=2012-07-03}}</ref> |- |South Magnetic Pole||(1998) {{coord|64.6|S|138.5|E|}}||(2004 est) {{coord|63.5|S|138.0|E|}} || (2007) {{coord|64.497|S|137.684|E|}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.antarctica.gov.au/about-antarctica/fact-files/geography/poles-and-directions|title=Poles and Directions|publisher=Australian Antarctic Division|year=2011|accessdate=October 11, 2011}}</ref>|| (2015) {{Coord|64.28|S|136.59|E|}}<ref name=BritishGeological/> |}
==Expeditions== Early unsuccessful attempts to reach the magnetic south pole included those of French explorer [[Dumont d'Urville]] (1837–40), American [[Charles Wilkes]] (expedition of 1838–42) and Briton [[James Clark Ross]] ([[Ross expedition|expedition of 1839 to 1843]]).<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=gNxjxfm4cSgC&pg=PA90 ''Antarctic Treaty System: an Assessment'', p. 90], [[US National Research Council]], 1986</ref>
The first calculation of the magnetic inclination to locate the magnetic South Pole was made on January 23, 1838 by the hydrographer {{Interlanguage link multi|Clément Adrien Vincendon-Dumoulin|fr}}, a member of the Dumont d'Urville expedition in Antarctica and [[Oceania]] on the [[corvette]]s "L'Astrolabe" and "Zélée" in 1837-1840, which discovered [[Adelie Land]].
On 16 January 1909 three men ([[Douglas Mawson]], [[Edgeworth David]], and [[Alistair Mackay]]) from [[Sir Ernest Shackleton]]'s [[Nimrod Expedition]] claimed to have found the South Magnetic Pole,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.antarctica.ac.uk/About_Antarctica/FAQs/faq_05.html |title=FAQs from primary schools - British Antarctic Survey |publisher=Antarctica.ac.uk |date=2011-03-11 |accessdate=2012-11-09}}</ref> which was at that time located on land. <ref>{{Cite book|title=Antarctica: Great Stories from the Frozen Continent|last=|first=|publisher=Reader's Digest|year=1985|isbn=0949819646|location=|pages=178-179}}</ref>They planted a flagpole at the spot and claimed it for the British Empire. The three men began the expedition to the South Magnetic Pole in a motor car specially adapted for the cold conditions, but abandoned it when it proved useless on soft surfaces. They then walked a total of 1260 miles to reach the South Magnetic Pole while pulling sledges and supplies that weighed approximately 670 lbs. Walking on foot across the coldest place on earth was perilous, and the men faced many dangers such as falling in concealed snow [[Crevasse|crevasses]] and acquiring [[frostbite]] and [[Photokeratitis|snow-blindness]]. Fearing starvation, they strictly rationed their biscuits down to the crumbs, and hunted seals and [[Penguin|penguins]]. However, there is now some doubt as to whether their location was correct.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deeptow.whoi.edu/southpole.html |title=The Magnetic South Pole | work=Ocean Bottom Magnetology Laboratory |publisher=[[Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute]] |accessdate=October 11, 2011}}</ref> The approximate position of the pole on 16 January 1909 was {{Coord|72.25|S|155.15|E|region:AQ_type:landmark}}.<ref>Shackleton, Roland Huntford</ref>
==Fits to global data sets==
The South Magnetic Pole has also been estimated by fits to global sets of data such as the [[World Magnetic Model]] (WMM) and the [[International Geomagnetic Reference Model]] (IGRF).<ref name=NGDC/> For earlier years back to about 1600, the model GUFM1 is used, based on a compilation of data from ship logs.<ref>{{cite journal |first1=Andrew |last1=Jackson |first2=Art R. T. |last2=Jonkers |first3=Matthew R. |last3=Walker |title=Four centuries of geomagnetic secular variation from historical records |journal=[[Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society A]] |volume=358 |number=1768 |pages=957–990 |year=2000 |doi=10.1098/rsta.2000.0569}}</ref>
==South Geomagnetic Pole== {{Main|Geomagnetic pole}} The Earth's geomagnetic field can be approximated by a tilted dipole (like a bar magnet) placed at the center of the Earth. The South Geomagnetic Pole is the point where the axis of this best-fitting tilted dipole intersects the Earth's surface in the southern hemisphere. As of 2005 it was calculated to be located at {{Coord|79.74|S|108.22|E|region:AQ_type:landmark}},<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/faqgeom.shtml |title=Geomagnetism Frequently Asked Questions |publisher=Ngdc.noaa.gov |date= |accessdate=2012-11-09}}</ref> near the [[Vostok Station]]. Because the field is not an exact dipole, the South Geomagnetic Pole does not coincide with the South Magnetic Pole. Furthermore, the South Geomagnetic Pole is wandering for the same reason its northern magnetic counterpart wanders.
== See also == {{Wikipedia books|Geomagnetism}} * [[North Magnetic Pole]] * [[Polar alignment]]
== References == {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{Refbegin}} *{{cite journal |title=Survey tracks current position of South Magnetic Pole |first1=Charles |last1=Barton |journal = [[Eos (journal)|EOS]] |volume=83 |number=27 |page=291 |year=2002|doi=10.1029/2002EO000210}} {{Refend}}
== External links == * [http://www.aad.gov.au/default.asp?casid=1843 Australian Antarctic Division]
{{Polar exploration|state=collapsed}}

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.4) ([[User:Artix Kreiger|Artix Kreiger]])
revision.text:
'''Spatial variability''' occurs when a quantity that is measured at different spatial locations exhibits values that differ across the locations. Spatial variability can be assessed using [[spatial descriptive statistics|spatial]] [[descriptive statistics]] such as the [[range (statistics)|range]]. Let us suppose, that the Rev' z(x) is perfectly known at any point x within the field under study. Then the uncertainty about z(x) is reduced to zero, whereas its spatial variability still exists. Uncertainty is closely related to the amount of spatial variability, but it is also strongly dependent upon sampling.<sup>4</sup>
[[Geostatistics|Geostatistical]] analyses have been strictly performed to study the spatial variability of pesticide sorption<sup>5-7</sup> and degradation<sup>8</sup> in the field. Webster and Oliver<sup>9</sup> provided a description of [[Geostatistics|geostatistical techniques]]. Describing uncertainty using [[geostatistics]] is not an activity exempt from uncertainty itself as [[variogram]] uncertainty may be large<sup>10</sup> and spatial interpolation may be undertaken using different techniques.<sup>11</sup> == See also ==
* [[Geostatistics]]
== References == # Isaaks, E.H., Srivastava R.M.: Applied Geostatistics. 1989 # Fortin, Marie-Josee, Dale, Mark.: Spatial Analysis A Guide for Ecologists. 2005. Cambridge University Press, 365 pp. # Kristensen, Terje, Ohlson, Mikael, Bolstad, Paul, Nagy, Zoltan: Spatial variability of organic layer thickness and carbon stocks in mature boreal forest stands. Environmental Monitoring and Assessment 187(8), 1-19. DOI: 10.1007/s10661-015-4741-x # DELHOMME, J.P.: Spatial Variability and Uncertainty in Groundwater Flow Parameters: A Geostatistical Approach # Cambardella CA, Moorman TB, Novak JM, Parkin TB, Karlen DN, Turco RF, Konopka AE. Field-scale variability of soil properties in Central Iowa soils. Soil Sci Soc Am J 1994;58:1501 –1511. # Novak JM, Moorman TB, Cambardella CA. Atrazine sorption at the field scale in relation to soils and landscape position. J Environ Qual 1997;26:1271 –1277. # Jacques D, Mouvet C, Mohanty B, Vereecken H, Feyen J. Spatial variability of atrazine sorption parameters and other soil properties in a podzoluvisol. J Contam Hydrol 1999;36:31 –52 # Price OR, Walker A, Wood M, Oliver MA. Using geostatistics to evaluate spatial variation in pesticideysoil interactions. In: Walker A., (Ed.), Pesticide behaviour in soils and water, BCPC Symposium Proceedings No. 78, Farnham, UK, 2001, pp. 233–238. # Webster R, Oliver MA. Geostatistics for environmental scientistsJohn Wiley and Sons Ltd, 2001. p. 286 # Jansen MJW. Prediction error through modelling concepts and uncertainty from basic data. Nutr Cycl Agroecosys 1998;50:247 –253. # Dubus, I. G.; Brown, C. D.; Beulke, S. Sources of uncertainty in pesticide fate modelling. Sci. Total Environ. 2003, 317, 53−72.
== External links == *https://web.archive.org/web/20061001123614/http://amethyst.epa.gov/revatoolkit/Definitions.jsp *http://gis.esri.com/library/userconf/proc05/papers/pap1184.pdf *https://web.archive.org/web/20100110102738/http://willingtoncropservices.co.uk/case_study_GPS-soil-sampling-nutrient-mapping.htm Willington Crop Services shows spatial variability in action with Case Study on GPS soil sampling, GPS nutrient mapping and nutrient management.
[[Category:Global Positioning System]] [[Category:Spatial data analysis]]

revision.comment: [[WP:CHECKWIKI]] error fix for #03. Missing Reflist. Do [[Wikipedia:GENFIXES|general fixes]] if a problem exists. -
/* February */[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: 25th year anniversary → 25th anniversary
revision.text:
{{Crisis in Bolivarian Venezuela}}
The '''[[2014 Venezuelan protests]]''' began in February 2014 when hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans protested due to high levels of criminal violence, inflation, and chronic scarcity of basic goods because of policies created the [[Venezuelan government]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Lopez|first=Linette|title=Why The United States Has Done Nothing About Venezuela|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/why-the-us-wont-touch-venezuela-2014-4|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=Business Insider|date=11 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protesters in Venezuela Press Government|url=https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304834704579401612202743396|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|date=23 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuelans protest en masse in rival rallies|url=http://www.theborneopost.com/2014/02/24/venezuelans-protest-en-masse-in-rival-rallies/|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=Borneo Post|date=24 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| title= Venezuela's Maduro says 2013 annual inflation was 56.2 pct|url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/30/venezuela-inflation-annual-idUSL2N0K90V020131230 |accessdate= 19 January 2014|newspaper= Reuters|date= 30 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title = Venezuela Inflation Hits 16-Year High as Shortages Rise|url= https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-11-07/venezuela-inflation-hits-16-year-high-as-shortages-rise.html |accessdate=16 February 2014|newspaper= Bloomberg|date= 7 November 2013}}</ref> The protests have lasted for several months and events are listed below according to the month they had happened.
==January== * '''6 January''' – [[Miss Venezuela 2004]] [[Monica Spear]] and her ex-husband [[Thomas Henry Berry]] are killed just outside [[Valencia, Venezuela]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Monica Spear Dead: Former Miss Venezuela Killed In Attempted Robbery|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/01/07/monica-spears-dead_n_4554456.html|accessdate=9 March 2014|newspaper=Huffington Post|date=7 January 2014}}</ref> * '''8 January''' – Protests begin after the killing of Monica Spear in the capital city of [[Caracas, Venezuela]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Former Miss Venezuela Monica Spear is slain|url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/former-miss-venezuela-monica-spear-is-slain/2014/01/08/6c314d52-788d-11e3-af7f-13bf0e9965f6_gallery.html#item11 |accessdate=2 March 2014|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=8 January 2014}}</ref> * '''9 January''' - Seven suspects are arrested in the death of Monica Spear.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/venezuela/article1959093.html |title=Venezuela says farewell to slain beauty queen}}</ref> * '''23 January''' - Opposition leaders Leopoldo López and [[María Corina Machado]] launch a campaign to remove Maduro from office, named ''La Salida'' (The Exit), with an intent to have President Maduro resign through protests with Machado publicly stating "We must create chaos in the streets through responsible civic struggle".<ref name=Carasik>{{cite web|last=Carasik|first=Laura|title=OBAMA CONTINUES BUSH'S POLICIES IN VENEZUELA|url=http://america.aljazeera.com/opinions/2014/4/nicolas-maduro-onobamaandbushspoliciesinvenezuela.html|publisher=Al Jazeera America|accessdate=8 April 2014}}</ref><ref name=PressTV>{{cite web|title=USAID subversion in Latin America not limited to Cuba |url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/04/08/357669/us-unlimited-subversion-in-latin-america/ |work=PressTV.ir |accessdate=8 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140409011723/http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/04/08/357669/us-unlimited-subversion-in-latin-america/ |archivedate=April 9, 2014 }}</ref><!-- Video of the press conference found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OVdel510hRk&feature=youtu.be -->
==February== [[File:2014 Venezuelan Protests (12F).jpg|230px|thumbnail|right|Peaceful demonstrations in [[Caracas]], Venezuela on 12 February 2014.]] [[File:Demostration 12F in Venezuela 2014 6.jpg|250px|thumbnail|Anti-government demonstration on [[Margarita Island]].]] [[File:Cadena humana de protesta en Valencia, Venezuela 2.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Human chain of protesters in [[Valencia, Venezuela]].]] [[File:Marcha en Maracaibo - Venezuela 9.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protesters at Plaza de La República in [[Maracaibo, Venezuela]] on 16 February.]] [[File:Protester with Peace Sign.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protester holding a sign saying "Peace" and a Venezuelan flag.]] [[File:No signal sign..jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protester with a sign against internet censorship.]] [[File:Marcha hacia el Palacio de Justicia de Maracaibo - Venezuela 06.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Thousands of opposition protestors outside of Palacio de Justicia in [[Maracaibo|Maracaibo, Venezuela]]]] * '''1 February''' – [[Leopoldo Lopez]] called upon students to protest peacefully against the scarcity, insecurity, and shortages.<ref name="elmundo.es">{{cite news | language = Spanish| title = Leopoldo López llama a la calle y se mide con Henrique Capriles | trans-title = Leopoldo López calls the street & sizes himself against Henrique Capriles | place = [[Spain|ES]] | url = http://www.elmundo.es/internacional/2014/02/01/52ed17d7268e3ece4f8b4576.html|accessdate=23 February 2014 | newspaper =El Mundo|date=1 February 2014}}</ref> * '''2 February''' – Opposition leaders call for a march on 12 February for National Youth Day.<ref name="eluniversal.com">{{cite news|title=Sector de la oposición convoca a marcha para el 12 de febrero|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140202/sector-de-la-oposicion-convoca-a-marcha-para-el-12-de-febrero|accessdate=10 March 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=2 February 2014}}</ref> * '''4 February''' – Protests at the [[University of the Andes (Venezuela)|University of the Andes]] occurred due to insecurity and an attempted sexual assault of a student.<ref name=5claves>{{cite news|title=5 claves para entender las protestas estudiantiles en Venezuela|url=http://prodavinci.com/2014/02/10/actualidad/5-claves-para-entender-las-protestas-estudiantiles-en-venezuela/|accessdate=10 March 2014|newspaper=Pro da Vinci|date=10 February 2014}}</ref> * '''5 February''' – Student protests at the [[Universidad Alejandro de Humboldt]], where the principal avenues of Caracas were blocked alleging insecurity of the students during the night shift<ref>{{cite web|url=http://prodavinci.com/2014/02/10/actualidad/5-claves-para-entender-las-protestas-estudiantiles-en-venezuela/ |title=5 claves para entender las protestas estudiantiles en Venezuela " Prodavinci |publisher=Prodavinci.com |date=}}</ref> * '''6 February''' – Students at the Catholic University of Táchira protested and were accused of attacking a residence.<ref>{{cite news|language=Spanish |title=Protesta del 12 de febrero en 12 sucesos claves |trans-title=12 February protests in 12 key events |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/protesta-del-12-de-febrero-en-12-sucesos-claves.aspx |accessdate=23 February 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=13 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222230236/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/protesta-del-12-de-febrero-en-12-sucesos-claves.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> * '''7 February''' – Medical students in Tachira continue to protest peacefully.<ref>{{cite web|title=Estudiantes continúan protestando en Táchira este Viernes 7 de Febrero.|url=http://ijustsaidit.com/estudiantes-continuan-protestando-en-tachira-este-viernes-7-de-febrero/|publisher=I Just Said It|accessdate=10 March 2014}}</ref> * '''8 February''' – Students from the [[University of the Andes (Venezuela)|University of the Andes]] protested outside the headquarters of [[SEBIN]] where students were being held arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan protesta estudiantil en Táchira y Mérida: FOTOS |url=http://m.panorama.com.ve/not.php?id=98984 |accessdate=10 March 2014 |newspaper=Panorama |date=8 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221152439/http://m.panorama.com.ve/not.php?id=98984 |archivedate=February 21, 2014 }}</ref> * '''9 February''' – Women dressed in black to protest against the arrests that happened in [[Tachira]].<ref>{{cite news| title = Protesta de gran magnitud en Táchira 09.02.14| trans-title = Táchira huge protest 2014 Feb 9| language = Spanish| url = http://www.el-nacional.com/reporteya/EurybiaH-Protesta-gran-magnitud-Tachira_0_352764760.html| accessdate = 23 February 2014| newspaper = El Nacional| date = 9 February 2014| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140222221225/http://www.el-nacional.com/reporteya/EurybiaH-Protesta-gran-magnitud-Tachira_0_352764760.html| archivedate = 22 February 2014| df = }}</ref> * '''11 February''' – Students in [[Táchira]], [[Zulia]], Caracas and [[Coro region|Coro]] protested for the release of fellow students.<ref>{{cite news|last= Oliva|first= Beatriz|language= Spanish|title= Protestas en Táchira, Zulia, Caracas y Coro: Estudiantes exigen liberación de compañeros de otros estados|trans-title= Protests in Táchira, Zulia, Caracas & Coro: Students demand liberation of colleagues from other States|url= http://www.el-carabobeno.com/impreso/articulo/93773/-estudiantes-exigen-liberacin-de-compaeros-de-otros-estados|accessdate= 23 February 2014|newspaper= El Carabobeno|date= 11 February 2014|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140222151646/http://www.el-carabobeno.com/impreso/articulo/93773/-estudiantes-exigen-liberacin-de-compaeros-de-otros-estados|archivedate= 22 February 2014|df= }}</ref> * '''12 February''' – Major opposition protests began with student marches led by opposition leaders in 38 cities across Venezuela simultaneous with the national celebrations for the bicentennial year anniversary of Youth Day and the Battle of La Victoria.<ref>{{cite web|language=Spanish |title=Estos son los puntos de concentración de la marcha 12F de los estudiantes |trans-title=These are the concentration points of 12 Feb Student march |year=2014 |publisher=Su Noticiero |url=http://sunoticiero.com/index.php/nacionales-not/40172-estos-son-los-puntos-de-concentracion-de-la-marcha-12f-de-los-estudiantes |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303182115/http://sunoticiero.com/index.php/nacionales-not/40172-estos-son-los-puntos-de-concentracion-de-la-marcha-12f-de-los-estudiantes |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Así marchó la oposición en Venezuela | format = photograms | trans-title = Thus marched the opposition in Venezuela | language = Spanish| year=2014 | publisher =La Patilla |url= http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/02/12/asi-marcho-la-oposicion-en-venezuela-fotos/}}</ref> After the protests, smaller groups remained and threw stones at government forces.<ref>{{cite news|title=At least two killed by gunfire at Venezuela protests|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/02/12/us-venezuela-protests-idUSBREA1B1K220140212|accessdate=13 March 2014|newspaper=Reuters|date=12 February 2014}}</ref> The protests turned more violent after government security forces and "colectivos" allegedly used excessive force on protesters and supposedly shot at groups of unarmed people.<ref>{{cite news|last=Brown|first=Eric|title=11 Photos From Venezuela's Anti-Government Protests|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/11-photos-venezuelas-anti-government-protests-1555055|accessdate=13 March 2014|newspaper=International Business Times|date=12 February 2014}}</ref><ref name=HumanRightsWatch12F>{{cite web |title= Venezuela: Violence Against Protesters, Journalists |url= https://www.hrw.org/news/2014/02/21/venezuela-violence-against-protesters-journalists |publisher= Human Rights Watch |accessdate= 13 March 2014}}</ref> [[Bassil Da Costa]] was the first protestor to die after getting a bullet to the head. Later that day, another protestor, Robert Reddman, and a pro-government activist were also killed in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Death toll rises in Venezuela as protesters, soldiers clash|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/venezuela-rivals-march-a-month-after-first-deaths/article17465229/|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140313044929/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/venezuela-rivals-march-a-month-after-first-deaths/article17465229/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=13 March 2014|accessdate=13 March 2014|newspaper=The Globe And Mail}}</ref> President Maduro blamed "fascist" groups for the deaths caused that day, including opposition leader Leopoldo López, during his closing address in the Youth Day parade that evening in La Victoria, Aragua state.<ref>{{cite news|title=Two dead after fierce anti-government protests in Venezuela|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/dead-fierce-anti-government-protests-venezuela-article-1.1612313|accessdate=13 March 2014|newspaper=NY Daily News|date=12 February 2014}}</ref> The Colombian news channel [[NTN24]] was taken off the air by CONATEL (the Venezuelan government agency appointed for the regulation, supervision and control over telecommunications) for "promoting violence and unacknowledging authorities".<ref name="ReferenceB">{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/arte-y-entretenimiento/140213/senal-del-canal-ntn24-fue-sacada-de-la-parrilla-de-cable |title=Senal Del Canal Ntn24 Fue Sacada De La Parrilla De Cable – Arte Y Entretenimiento |language=es |publisher=El Universal |date=}}</ref> * '''13 February''' – Following the death of a colectivo member Juan "Juancho" Montoya, members of colectivos "went on television to call for calm and called for the arrest of opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez.<ref name="reuters colectivo">{{cite news|last=Wallis|first=Daniel|title=Venezuela violence puts focus on militant 'colectivo' groups | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/02/13/venezuela-protests-colectivos-idUSL2N0LI14W20140213 | accessdate = 22 February 2014|newspaper= Reuters|date= 13 February 2014}}</ref> Judge Ralenys Tovar Guillén accepts the Public Ministry's petition to detain Leopoldo López in connection with the unrest that resulted in the death of the colectivo leader and two students.<ref>{{cite news|last=Cawthorne|first=Andrew|title= Venezuela seeks protest leader's arrest after unrest kills three | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/02/13/us-venezuela-protests-idUSBREA1B1K220140213| accessdate= 21 March 2014|newspaper= Reuters|date= 13 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140213/ordenan-al-sebin-capturar-a-leopoldo-lopez |title=Ordenan Al Sebin Capturar A Leopoldo Lopez – Nacional Y Politica |language=es |publisher=El Universal |date=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.2001.com.ve/con-la-gente/esta-es-la-orden-de-captura-emitida-contra-leopoldo-lopez.html |title=Esta es la orden de captura emitida contra Leopoldo López | Con la gente |publisher=2001.com.ve |date=16 February 2014}}</ref> President Maduro organized pro-government demonstrations to counter the opposition and announced that violent anti-government protests are prohibited.<ref name = "permiso">{{Citation | url = http://www.infobae.com/2014/02/13/1543394-violencia-venezuela-maduro-anuncio-que-los-que-se-movilicen-sin-permiso-seran-detenidos | title = Violencia en Venezuela: Maduro anunció que los que se movilicen "sin permiso" serán detenidos | trans-title = Violence in Venezuela: Maduro announced those who mobilise "without permission" will be arrested | date = 13 February 2014 | newspaper = Infobae}}</ref> Government supporters gathered outside the headquarters of the Public Ministry a day after it was attacked.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fotos exclusivas: así fue el espaldarazo que el pueblo le dio en el MP a la fiscal Luisa Ortega Díaz |trans-title=Exclusive photograms: thus was the booing the people gave in the PM to the fiscal Luisa Ortega Diaz |language=Spanish |url=http://www.laiguana.tv/noticias/2014/02/13/12244/FOTOS-EXCLUSIVAS-ASI-FUE-EL-ESPALDARAZO-QUE-EL-PUEBLO-LE-DIO-EN-EL-MP-A-LA-FISCAL-LUISA-ORTEGA-DIAZ.html |accessdate=23 February 2014 |newspaper=La Iguana |date=13 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222175310/http://www.laiguana.tv/noticias/2014/02/13/12244/FOTOS-EXCLUSIVAS-ASI-FUE-EL-ESPALDARAZO-QUE-EL-PUEBLO-LE-DIO-EN-EL-MP-A-LA-FISCAL-LUISA-ORTEGA-DIAZ.html |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Seven universities in Venezuela cancelled Youth Day programs due to the large involvement of student protesters.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.el-nacional.com/sociedad/universidades-autonomas-suspenden-clases-lunes_0_355164596.html |title= Cinco universidades autónomas suspenden clases hasta el lunes |date= 13 February 2014 |newspaper= El Nacional |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140409230200/http://www.el-nacional.com/sociedad/universidades-autonomas-suspenden-clases-lunes_0_355164596.html |archivedate= 9 April 2014 |df= }}</ref> The governor of the [[Aragua state]], [[Tarek El Aissami]], denounced that opposition groups attempted to burn the governorate, attacked the [[Girardot Municipality, Aragua|Girardot Municipality]] town hall, burned a vehicle and wounded ten police officers the previous day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/el-aissami-acusa-a-opositores-de-intentar-quemar-l.aspx |title=El Aissami acusa a opositores de intentar quemar la gobernación de Aragua |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222230055/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/el-aissami-acusa-a-opositores-de-intentar-quemar-l.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Likewise, The [[Ministry of Ground Transport|Minister of Ground Transport]], Haiman El Troudi, denounced that the ministry headquarters were attacked during the night of the protests.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/denuncian-nuevos-danos-contra-sede-del-ministerio-de-transporte-terrestre-en-chacao |title=Denuncian nuevos daños a infraestructura del Ministerio de Transporte Terrestre en Chacao |publisher=Globovision |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140323051148/http://globovision.com/articulo/denuncian-nuevos-danos-contra-sede-del-ministerio-de-transporte-terrestre-en-chacao |archivedate=March 23, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sibci.gob.ve/2014/02/grupos-violentos-de-la-derecha-causaron-danos-a-sede-del-ministerio-para-transporte-terrestre/ |title=Grupos violentos de la derecha causaron daños a sede del Ministerio para Transporte Terrestre | SIBCI – Sistema Bolivariano de Comunicación e Información |publisher=Sibci.gob.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221102531/http://www.sibci.gob.ve/2014/02/grupos-violentos-de-la-derecha-causaron-danos-a-sede-del-ministerio-para-transporte-terrestre/ |archivedate=February 21, 2014 }}</ref> According to Vielma Mora, there was an attempt to take over the electric substation Santa Teresa and destroy a sport school, and the front and a bus of the [[Bolivarian University of Venezuela]] were attacked in Táchira.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.noticias24.com/venezuela/noticia/222183/denuncia-un-nuevo-intento-de-tomar-la-subestacion-electrica-de-santa-teresa-esta-planta-alimenta-a-63-000-usuarios/ |title=Vielma Mora denuncia que han intentado tomar la subestación eléctrica Santa Teresa en Táchira |publisher=Noticias24.com |date=}}</ref> In Valencia, protesters were dispersed by the National Guard in El Trigál where four students (three men and one woman) were attacked inside of a car while trying to leave the perimeter;<ref name="notitarde.com">{{cite news| url=http://www.notitarde.com/Valencia/2-vehiculos-incendiados-1-dama-herida-y-11-detenidos-tras-protestas-Fotos/2014/02/14/304498| title=Saldo de las protestas en El Trigal| newspaper=[[Notitarde]]| date=13 February 2014| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140402160110/http://www.notitarde.com/Valencia/2-vehiculos-incendiados-1-dama-herida-y-11-detenidos-tras-protestas-Fotos/2014/02/14/304498| archivedate=2 April 2014| df=}}</ref><ref name="soundcloud.com">{{cite news| url=https://soundcloud.com/andreina-flores-2/entrevista-karla-monagas|title = Entrevista Karla Monagas Estudiante Herida Valencia |author= [[Andreina Flores]] | date = 13 February 2014}}</ref> the three men were imprisoned and one of them was allegedly sodomized by one of the officers with a rifle.<ref name="diariolasamericas.com">[http://www.diariolasamericas.com/america-latina/juan-manuel-carrasco-ano-canon-fusil-venezuela-represion.html|title = Juan Manuel Carrasco relata su arresto| newspaper = [[Diario Las Américas]] | date = 13 February 2014] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304024912/http://www.diariolasamericas.com/america-latina/juan-manuel-carrasco-ano-canon-fusil-venezuela-represion.html%7Ctitle |date=4 March 2016 }}</ref> * '''14 February''' – Students protested outside the Organization of American States in Venezuela asking them for action against the violence.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fotos--estudiantes-llegaron-a-sede-de-la-oea.aspx |title=Estudiantes llegaron a sede de la OEA |newspaper=[[Últimas Noticias]] |date=14 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222231544/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fotos--estudiantes-llegaron-a-sede-de-la-oea.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Opposition protestors blocked the Francisco de Miranda avenue in Caracas asking for the release of students arrested on 12 February.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vea los grupos opositores que obstaculizaron el tránsito en la avenida Francisco de Miranda| trans-title = See the opposition groups that blocked the traffic in the Francisco de Miranda avenue | language = Spanish| url= http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/foto-dia/vea-como-grupos-opositores-obstaculizaron-transito-avenida-francisco-miranda-fotos/ |accessdate=23 February 2014|newspaper=Correo del Orinoco|date=14 February 2014}}</ref> The [[National Guard of Venezuela]] dispersed protesters with [[tear gas]] in [[Altamira (Caracas)|Altamira.]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Con lluvia de lacrimógenas acabaron manifestación |trans-title=Manifestation ended with tear gas rain |language=Spanish |format=photograms |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/en-fotos---con-lluvia-de-lacrimogenas-acabaron-man.aspx |accessdate=23 February 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=14 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222233331/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/en-fotos---con-lluvia-de-lacrimogenas-acabaron-man.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> The Democratic Unity Roundtable and the Venezuelan Episcopal Conference (CEV) asked for the disarmament of the pro-government colectivos and armed groups<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/cev-se-pronunciara-sobre-hechos-violentos-en-rueda-de-prensa |title=CEV pide que grupos violentos sean controlados por las autoridades |publisher=Globovision |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223055736/http://globovision.com/articulo/cev-se-pronunciara-sobre-hechos-violentos-en-rueda-de-prensa |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/seguidores-del-oficialismo-se-concentran-en-plaza-.aspx |accessdate=23 February 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=15 February |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> A [[Globovisión]] reporter and her workmates denounced being attacked with stones in Plaza Venezuela and thanked those who were there that sympathized with her.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/agreden-a-periodista-de-globovision-en-protesta-en-altamira |title=Agredieron a periodista de Globovisión durante protesta en Altamira |archivedate=April 9, 2014 }}</ref> Haiman El Troudi denounced that [[Caracas Metro]] workers were assaulted "with sticks and pipes", and that "damage and destruction" were produced in its facilities during the protests the 12 and 14 February. He also explained that 40 Metrobús units were stoned and now inoperative, and that escalators, train glasses, cameras, signals and fire systems were damaged.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/el-troudi-denuncia-agresiones-a-trabajadores-y-danos-en-el-metro-de-caracas |title=El Troudi denuncia agresiones a trabajadores y daños en el Metro de Caracas |publisher=Globovision |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223060923/http://globovision.com/articulo/el-troudi-denuncia-agresiones-a-trabajadores-y-danos-en-el-metro-de-caracas |archivedate=February 23, 2014 }}</ref> CONATEL's CEO, William Castillo, justified taking NTN24 off the air basing in the article 27 of the ''Law of Social Responsibility in Radio, Television and Electronic Media'', which prohibits incitement of hatred, and expressed that he thinks that an "abuse" of the freedom of speech is exercised. According to him, CONATEL carried out a monitoring where "90% of NTN24's programmation was dedicated to Venezuela where the 80% was biased to one side of the conflict."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/conatel-desmiente-bloqueo-de-twitter-y-justifica-salida-de-la-senal-de-ntn24 |title=Conatel desmiente bloqueo de Twitter y justifica salida de la señal de NTN24 |publisher=Globovision |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223061256/http://globovision.com/articulo/conatel-desmiente-bloqueo-de-twitter-y-justifica-salida-de-la-senal-de-ntn24 |archivedate=February 23, 2014 }}</ref> * '''16 February''' – The Venezuelan Minister for Communication and Information, [[Delcy Rodríguez]] warned that the government will take legal action against international media "[[media manipulation]]".<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela tomará medidas judiciales frente a manipulación mediática (+Audio) |url=http://laradiodelsur.com/?p=246390 |accessdate=10 March 2014 |newspaper=La Radio del Sur |date=16 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222012139/http://laradiodelsur.com/?p=246390 |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Rodriguez claimed that the social networks and national and international media have allegedly reported fake pictures that do not correspond to Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Muestran fotos falsas que han sido divulgadas por las redes sociales|url=http://www.noticias24.com/venezuela/noticia/222492/muestran-fotos-falsas-que-han-sido-divulgadas-por-las-redes-sociales/|accessdate=10 March 2014|newspaper=Noticias 24|date=16 February 2014}}</ref> The Minister of Interior, Justice and Peace, Miguel Rodríguez Torres, assured having evidence that "proves that the protesters in Chacao are outside of the age range of a university student, and that they use very expensive motorcycles with an attire not peculiar of a middle or popular social class student. He accused Ramón Muchacho, the mayor of the [[Chacao, Venezuela|Chacao municipality]], of not assuming his responsibility for the security of the municipality.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/rodriguez-torres-protestantes-no-tienen-edad-de-es.aspx |title=Rodríguez Torres: Protestantes no tienen edad de estudiantes |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222233346/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/rodriguez-torres-protestantes-no-tienen-edad-de-es.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Likewise, he criticized the [[Miranda, Venezuela|Miranda]] state governor, [[Henrique Capriles]], of not taking actions to avoid the aggressions in the sector.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://laiguana.tv/noticias/2014/02/16/12361/ESTO-EVALUA-LA-GUARDIA-NACIONAL-BOLIVARIANA-SOBRE-POLIMIRANDA-Y-ACTOS-VANDALICOS-.html |title=Esto Evalúa La Guardia Nacional Bolivariana Sobre Polimiranda Y Actos Vándalicos |publisher=Laiguana.tv |date=16 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302045154/http://www.laiguana.tv/noticias/2014/02/16/12361/ESTO-EVALUA-LA-GUARDIA-NACIONAL-BOLIVARIANA-SOBRE-POLIMIRANDA-Y-ACTOS-VANDALICOS-.html |archivedate=March 2, 2014 }}</ref> Henrique Capriles criticized the national government, considering them irresponsibles and affirming that "the civilians don't carry out coups", and asking where are the proofs (of this).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/capriles-donde-estan-las-pruebas-del-golpe-de-esta.aspx |title=Capriles: ¿Dónde están las pruebas del golpe de Estado? |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222233642/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/capriles-donde-estan-las-pruebas-del-golpe-de-esta.aspx |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> * '''17 February''' – Armed government intelligence personnel illegally forced their way into the headquarters of Popular Will in Caracas and held individuals that were inside at gunpoint. About 300 opposition protesters gathered outside the headquarters to protest against the infiltration of the facility and are dispersed with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Centro Plaza por allanamiento de sede de Voluntad Popular|trans-title=Protest in Centro square for the elimination of the Popular Will|language=Spanish|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/sociedad/Protestan-Centro-Plaza-Voluntad-Popular_0_357564395.html|accessdate=23 February 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=17 February 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222172648/http://www.el-nacional.com/sociedad/Protestan-Centro-Plaza-Voluntad-Popular_0_357564395.html|archivedate=22 February 2014|df=}}</ref> The mayor of the [[Libertador Bolivarian Municipality]], [[Jorge Rodríguez Gómez]], declared Caracas a "peace zone free of fascism",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/politica/declarada-caracas-como-espacio-libre-para-paz/ |title=Declarada Caracas como zona de Paz y libre de fascismo |publisher=Correo del Orinoco |date=}}</ref> affirmed he hasn't received any request for an opposition march the 18 February and that until there is a request "they can release an opinion". He affirmed that day "the permission for the cultural march to Plaza Venezuela was granted", whose organizers actually delivered a permission request.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/nacionales/alcaldia-caracas-no-autoriza-ninguna-movilizacion-oposicion-para-18f/ |title=Alcaldía de Caracas no autoriza ninguna movilización de la oposición para el 18F (+Fotos) |publisher=Correo del Orinoco |date=}}</ref> * '''18 February''' – Leopoldo López delivered a speech in Plaza Brión where he pointed out that its necessary to build "a pacific exit, inside the constitution but in the streets" and assured that "there isn't free media anymore to express themselves and if the media stays silent they must go to the streets". He declared that "if his imprisonment allows Venezuela to wake up definitely and for the Venezuelans that want a change, his imprisonment will be worth it." He turned himself to the National Guard at 12:24{{nbsp}}pm, Venezuelan time, and said he was turning himself to a "corrupt justice".<ref>{{cite web |author=el nacional web |url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Leopoldo-Lopez-Plaza-Brion-Chacaito_0_358164269.html |title=Si mi encarcelamiento es el despertar de un pueblo, valdrá la pena |publisher=El-nacional.com web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NmhEk4rpGNQ |title=Solicitan allanamiento de la inmunidad parlamentaria de la Diputada María Corina Machado |publisher=YouTube |date=20 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140220/solicitan-ante-la-an-allanamiento-de-la-inmunidad-a-maria-corina-macha |title=Solicitan Ante La An Allanamiento De La Inmunidad A Maria Corina Macha – Nacional Y Politica |language=es |publisher=El Universal |date=20 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=El Nacional Web |url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Solicitan-AN-Maria-Corina-Machado_0_359364138.html |title=Solicitan a la AN allanamiento a la inmunidad parlamentaria a María Corina Machado |publisher=El-nacional.com |date=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/02/20/solicitan-allanamiento-a-la-inmunidad-parlamentaria-a-maria-corina-machado/ |title=Solicitan a la AN allanamiento a la inmunidad parlamentaria a María Corina Machado |publisher=Lapatilla.com |date=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/solicitan-allanamiento-de-inmunidad-parlamentaria-.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=June 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140310053612/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/solicitan-allanamiento-de-inmunidad-parlamentaria-.aspx |archivedate=March 10, 2014 }}</ref> The minister of Electric Energy, [[Jesse Chacón]], denounced vandal acts to the property of the National Electric System in the [[Anzoátegui]], [[Bolívar (state)|Bolívar]] and [[Carabobo]] states.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.noticias24.com/venezuela/noticia/223317/chacon-denuncio-danos-en-el-sistema-electrico-por-actos-vandalicos-con-la-violencia-pierde-venezuela/ |title=Jesse Chacón denunció daños en el SEN por "actos vandálicos" (+fotos y video) |publisher=Noticias24.com |date=}}</ref> The charges of terrorism and homicide of Leopoldo López are suspended.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/eliminan-cargos-de-homicidio-y-terrorismo-a-leopol.aspx |title=Eliminan cargos de homicidio y terrorismo a Leopoldo López |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140227053747/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/eliminan-cargos-de-homicidio-y-terrorismo-a-leopol.aspx |archivedate=February 27, 2014 }}</ref> In response to the death of Miss Tourism Venezuela [[Génesis Carmona]], groups of women planned to defend the family of Génesis and protest her killing on 22 February.<ref>{{cite news|title=Solicitan a la AN allanamiento a la inmunidad parlamentaria a María Corina Machado|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/02/20/solicitan-allanamiento-a-la-inmunidad-parlamentaria-a-maria-corina-machado/|accessdate=20 February 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 February 2014}}</ref> A citizen in the Mérida state dies after sustaining fatal wounds while crossing a barricade with barbed wire in a motorcycle with one of her children.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.noticias24.com/venezuela/noticia/223656/muere-meridena-de-37-anos-que-se-trasladaba-en-moto-a-causa-de-una-alambrada/ |title=Muere merideña de 37 años que se trasladaba en moto a causa de una alambrada |publisher=Noticias24.com |date=}}</ref> * '''21 February''' – Venezuela closed its consulates in Aruba, Curaçao and Bonaire after an alleged attack by a Venezuelan citizen, said Venezuelan Foreign Minister Elias Jaua.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela cierra sus consulados en Aruba, Curazao y Bonaire tras un atentado |url=http://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/view/120577-atentado-aruba-jaua-cerrar-consulado|accessdate=10 March 2014|newspaper=RT|date=21 February 2014}}</ref> A motorcycle rider died after tripping with a guaya (steel cable) placed near a barricade.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/fallece-motorizado-por-guaya-colocada-en-barricada.aspx |title=Fallece motorizado por guaya colocada en barricada |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228055440/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/fallece-motorizado-por-guaya-colocada-en-barricada.aspx |archivedate=February 28, 2014 }}</ref> The government accused the opposition students for the event. * '''22 February''' – A student protestor, Geraldine Moreno, died in the hospital after sustaining wounds in the face caused by shotgun pellets when a member of the National Guard shot her at [[point blank range]] while she was protesting in the Tazajal sector, Carabobo state.<ref>{{cite news|title=Falleció joven que fue herida con perdigones en el ojo|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/sucesos/Fallecio-joven-herida-perdigones-ojo_0_360564009.html|accessdate=22 February 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=22 February 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222203357/http://www.el-nacional.com/sucesos/Fallecio-joven-herida-perdigones-ojo_0_360564009.html|archivedate=22 February 2014|df=}}</ref> [[File:Ángel Vivas' house.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Home of former general [[Ángel Vivas]].]] * '''23 February''' – Tens of thousands of protesters both supporting and opposing the government demonstrated in [[Caracas]] which led to some of the most serious clashes seen throughout the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro gears up for talks to defuse protest threat |url=http://www.brecorder.com/top-news/109-world-top-news/159308-maduro-gears-up-for-talks-to-defuse-protest-threat.html |accessdate=24 February 2014 |newspaper=Business Recorder |date=24 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301171136/http://www.brecorder.com/top-news/109-world-top-news/159308-maduro-gears-up-for-talks-to-defuse-protest-threat.html |archivedate=March 1, 2014 }}</ref> About 30 military units arrived at the residence of retired [[brigadier general]] [[Ángel Vivas]] to arrest him for "training" protestors to place barbed wire over the roads to injure government forces and pro-government protestors, resulting in one fatality in the process and many more wounded.<ref name="Alba Ciudad 96.3 FM">{{cite web| language = Spanish| url = http://albaciudad.org/wp/index.php/2014/02/muere-motorizado-en-av-romulo-gallegos-degollado-por-alambre-colocado-por-manifestantes-opositores/ | title=Muere motorizado en Av. Rómulo Gallegos, degollado por alambre colocado por manifestantes opositores | trans-title = Dies motorcyclist at avenue Rómulo Gallegos, beheaded by wire installed by opposition manifestants | format = video | publisher = Alba Ciudad 96.3 FM | date = Feb 2014 |accessdate = 25 February 2014}}</ref><ref name="teleSUR">{{cite web|url= http://www.telesurtv.net/articulos/2014/02/22/guarimba-de-opositores-venezolanos-ocasiono-la-muerte-de-motorizado-9453.html |title=Muere joven venezolano por guaya colocada por grupos fascistas | publisher = teleSUR | language = Spanish| trans-title = Young Venezuelan dies by wire installed by fascist groups |date=21 February 2014}}</ref> An engineer dies after being wounded two days ago during a protest in Caracas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fallecio-manifestante-herido-en-candelaria.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=June 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150110211251/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fallecio-manifestante-herido-en-candelaria.aspx |archivedate=January 10, 2015 }}</ref> * '''24 February''' – Opposition and government forces clashed in [[San Cristóbal, Táchira]]. Opposition protesters barricaded themselves and threw rocks and firebombs at the National Guard. The National Guard responded with tear gas and shotgun fire. One man was injured by shotgun fire and another was killed after the National Guard shot tear gas at him causing him to fall off a roof.<ref>{{cite news|last=Neuman|first=William|title=In Venezuela, Protest Ranks Grow Broader|url = https://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/25/world/americas/in-venezuela-middle-class-joins-protests.html |accessdate=25 February 2014 |newspaper= The New York Times|date=24 February 2014}}</ref> The governor of Tachira, [[José Vielma Mora]] criticized the government saying, "I got angry because of the military planes overflying Táchira; it was an unacceptable excess" and pointed out to residents, "I am not part of the regime; I was elected by the people of Táchira".<ref>{{cite news|title=Governor terms "unacceptable excess" the militarization of Táchira state |url=http://english.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140224/governor-terms-unacceptable-excess-the-militarization-of-tachira-state |accessdate=25 February 2014 |newspaper=El Universal |date=24 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140304131808/http://english.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140224/governor-terms-unacceptable-excess-the-militarization-of-tachira-state |archivedate=March 4, 2014 }}</ref> * '''25 February''' – Delcy Rodríguez informed that a VTV ([[Venezolana de Televisión|Venezuelan Television Corporation]]) journalist was wounded during the protests in the Táchira state and urged the National Journalist School and the National Press Workers Syndicate to comment about the event. She also denounced that the media, both national and international, ignore the continuous attacks that the government supporters suffer, including journalists and members of the [[National Armed Forces of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela|National Bolivarian Armed Forces]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/politica/ministra-rodriguez-herido-periodista-vtv-por-guarimbas-tachira/ |title=Herido periodista de VTV en manifestaciones violentas en Táchira |publisher=Correo del Orinoco |date=}}</ref> A moto-taxi driver dies after being shot the previous day while attempting to remove debris placed by protesters in [[Maracaibo]], [[Zulia]] state.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://panorama.com.ve/portal/app/push/noticia101545.php |title=Matan a mototaxista que intentó quitar escombros en vÃas de Maracaibo |publisher=Panorama.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527081250/http://panorama.com.ve/portal/app/push/noticia101545.php |archivedate=May 27, 2014 }}</ref> * '''26 February''' – [[Lilian Tintori]], wife of Leopoldo Lopez, led a quiet protest of women students just before a government peace conference.<ref>{{cite news|last=Wilson|first=Peter|title=Women in white protest violence in Venezuela|url = https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2014/02/26/venezuela-protests/5837345/|accessdate=27 February 2014|newspaper = USA Today|date=26 February 2014}}</ref> In Táchira, a group of protesters decapitated a statue of late president Hugo Chávez and posted the pictures on Twitter.<ref>{{citation|title=Opositores venezolanos decapitaron una estátua de Chávez en Venezuela |trans-title=Venezuelan oppositors beheaded a Chávez statue in Venezuela |language=Spanish |url=http://www.infonews.com/2014/02/26/mundo-126668-opositores-venezolanos-decapitaron-una-estatua-de-chavez-venezuela.php |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150110214420/http://www.infonews.com/2014/02/26/mundo-126668-opositores-venezolanos-decapitaron-una-estatua-de-chavez-venezuela.php |archivedate=January 10, 2015 }}</ref> The headquarters of the political party [[Democratic Action]] in San Cristóbal is looted. Its secretary general, Miguel Reyes, accused the governor Vielma Mora of the events and denounced that the police didn't act.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fotos--asi-quedo-casa-de-ad-en-san-cristobal.aspx |title=Fotos| Así quedó casa de AD en San Cristóbal |publisher=Ultimasnoticias.com.ve |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140522194054/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/fotos--asi-quedo-casa-de-ad-en-san-cristobal.aspx |archivedate=May 22, 2014 }}</ref> The Government of Venezuela held a National Peace conference that was not attended by opposition figures because according to the opposition, "any talks must be predicated on an agenda agreed upon in advance and the participation of a third party".<ref>{{cite news|title= Venezuela Peace Conference Begins With Opposition Boycott | url = https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-02-27/venezuela-peace-conference-begins-with-opposition-boycott.html | accessdate = 27 February 2014 | newspaper = Bloomberg|date= 26 February 2014}}</ref> * '''27 February''' – Students led by [[Juan Requesens]] protested against violence, detention and torture of students and the shortages in Venezuela, with Herique Capriles visiting, but not as a spokesperson.<ref>{{cite news|title= Estudiantes anuncian marcha para este domingo | url = http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140227/estudiantes-anuncian-marcha-para-este-domingo |accessdate=27 February 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=27 February 2014}}</ref> The government issued an arrest warrant for [[Carlos Vecchio]], a leader of [[Popular Will]] on various charges.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://diariocontraste.com/es/confirman-orden-de-captura-contra-carlos-vecchio-foto-orden/ |title=Confirman orden de captura contra Carlos Vecchio (foto orden) – Diario Contraste |publisher=Diariocontraste.com |date=27 February 2014}}</ref> Medics in Maracay, Aragua state, protest against the condition of the hospitals in the state.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.unionradio.net/actualidadur/nota/visornota.aspx?id=166635&tpCont=1&idSec=3 |title=Actualidad :: Nota – MÃdicos de Aragua marchan por la paz y la vida |publisher=.unionradio.net |date=27 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303191244/http://www1.unionradio.net/actualidadur/nota/visornota.aspx?id=166635&tpCont=1&idSec=3 |archivedate=March 3, 2014 }}</ref> President Maduro decreed 27 February as "The Day of No Work in Venezuela" in respect for the fallen of the protests (that date was also the 25th anniversary of the historic [[Caracazo]] of 1989).<ref>{{cite news| language = Spanish| title =Decretran el 27 de febrero "Día no Laborable"| trans-title = 27 February decreted "non-working day" | url = http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/02/22/decretran-dia-no-laborable-en-venezuela/ | accessdate =23 February 2014 | newspaper =La Patilla|date=22 February 2014}}</ref> * '''28 February''' – A group of protesters ambushed a National Guard officer and attacked him. A neighbor came to defend the officer, who ran behind the automatic gates. Eventually the protesters broke into the house he was hiding at and stole his helmet and bulletproof vest.<ref>{{Citation | language = Spanish| title = Venezuela: opositores, ataque, policia | trans-title = Venezuela: oppositors, attack, police | url = http://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/view/121170-video-venezuela-opositores-ataque-policia | newspaper = RT}}</ref>
==March== [[File:2014 Venezuela Carnaval Protests.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protesters banging pots in a [[Cacerolazo]] protesting lengthened Carnaval celebrations.]] [[File:Opposition rally 10.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Demonstrators going to [[Central University of Venezuela]] to protest for the Ombudswoman's resignation.]] [[File:Graduates protesting Venezuela 2014.jpg|250px|thumb|thumbnail|right|Graduates with a sign saying: "What use do I have of two careers in a dictatorship?".]] [[File:Protesters in front of police..jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protests in front of police at Altamira Square.]] [[File:Political cartoon Venezuela 2014.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|A sign with a political cartoon. President Nicolás Maduro is shown as a puppet of Fidel Castro, while Fidel lights his cigar with a burning Venezuelan flag.]] [[File:Cuba Out Sign Venezuela 2014.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Opposition protesters holding a sign criticizing the alleged Cuban intervention in Venezuela saying "Cuba Out"]] [[File:ALTAMIRA FLAG.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Opposition protesters with large Venezuelan flag at [[Plaza Francia (Caracas)|Altamira Square]].]] [[File:Opposition rally 20.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|An opposition rally supporting Leopoldo López.]] [[File:David Smolansky 2.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|David Smolansky addressing to a rally supporting Leopoldo López.]] * '''1 March''' – Some cities such as El Tigre, Anaco, Tigrito, Píritu refused to celebrate Carnaval and protesters placed crosses representing those fallen during the protests on beaches popular during Carnaval, which had few visitors due to the protests.<ref>{{cite news| title= En playa Lido Anzoátegui colocan cruces en señal de luto| trans-title = In beach, Lido Anzoátegui puts crosses in mourning | language = Spanish| url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140301/en-playa-lido-anzoategui-colocan-cruces-en-senal-de-luto|accessdate=2 March 2014 | newspaper =El Universal|date=1 March 2014}}</ref> Carnaval celebrations in cities also had few attendees due to the protests with most of those at celebrations being police officers.<ref>{{cite news| language = Spanish| title= Policías custodiando a nadie: Así transcurre el carnaval en Maturín | format = photograms | trans-title = Police guard nothing: thus happens Carnival in Maturín | url= http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/01/policias-custodiando-a-nadie-asi-transcurre-el-carnaval-en-maturin-fotos/ |accessdate=2 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 March 2014}}</ref> The water in a fountain at [[Plaza Francia (Caracas)|Plaza Francia in Caracas]] was dyed red in protest of the deaths caused by violence.<ref>{{cite news| language = Spanish| title=Tiñeron de rojo una fuente de la Plaza Francia en Altamira | trans-title = Fountain in Plaza Francia tinted red | format = photograms |url = http://diariodecaracas.com/que-sucede/tineron-la-fuente-plaza-francia-en-altamira-rojo-fotos |accessdate= 1 March 2014|newspaper=El Diario Caracas|date= 1 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title = La fuente en la plaza Francia de Altamira amaneció teñida de rojo | trans-title = The fountain in Francia square at Altamira dawned red tinted | language = Spanish | url = http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/fuente-plaza-Francia-Altamira-amanecio_0_364763546.html | accessdate = 1 March 2014 | newspaper = El Nacional | date = 1 March 2014 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140301172032/http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/fuente-plaza-Francia-Altamira-amanecio_0_364763546.html | archivedate = 1 March 2014 | df = }}</ref> The Venezuelan Attorney General, [[Luisa Ortega Díaz]], denied the opposition's claims of students being the main target of the Venezuelan government, when in fact they represent 35% of all detainees. She also stated that at least 27 government agents are being investigated for violations against human rights, plus another five accused of killing three people on the first day of protests. Meanwhile, President Maduro announced that a National Guard officer had died and another two had been wounded by sniper fire.<ref>{{Citation | title = Venezuela investiga a 27 agentes por delitos de lesa Humanidade | trans-title = Venezuela investigates 27 agents for crimes against humanity | url = http://www.infonews.com/2014/03/01/mundo-127151-venezuela-investiga-a-27-agentes-por-delitos-de-lesa-humanidad-venezuela.php | newspaper = Info news | date = 1 March 2014}}</ref> * '''2 March''' – Tens of thousands of opposition protesters marched throughout Caracas protesting against censorship, shortages, insecurity and injustice.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela: Tens of thousands march in anti-government protests|url = http://touch.latimes.com/#section/-1/article/p2p-79493888/ |accessdate=3 March 2014|newspaper= The Los Angeles|date= 2 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Chris Arsenault |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/americas/2014/03/large-protests-venezuela-despite-carnival-201432225927873999.html |title=Large protests in Venezuela despite carnival – Americas |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=}}</ref> The National Guard used tear gas on protesters and played loud music to prevent them from being heard.<ref>{{cite news|title=GN lanzó lacrimógenas y puso música llanera en Altamira |trans-title=GN used tear gas and played loud music in Altamira |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/gn-lanzo-lacrimogenas-y-puso-musica-llanera-en-alt.aspx |accessdate=3 March 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=2 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303091654/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/gn-lanzo-lacrimogenas-y-puso-musica-llanera-en-alt.aspx |archivedate=March 3, 2014 }}</ref> * '''3 March''' – Citizens of [[Los Salias]] and [[Los Teques]] marched to Ramo Verde Prison to demand "justice and freedom" from the government.<ref>{{cite news|last=Rivas|first=Dayana|title=Vecinos de los altos mirandinos marcharán a Ramo Verde |url=http://www.elmundo.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/noticias/vecinos-de-los-altos-mirandinos-marcharan-a-ramo-v.aspx|accessdate=3 March 2014|newspaper=El Mundo|date=3 March 2014}}</ref> * '''4 March''' – Thousands of peaceful opposition protesters filled the streets of Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caracas vuelve a congregar miles de personas protestando pacíficamente (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/04/caracas-vuelve-a-congregar-miles-de-personas-protestando-pacificamente-fotos/|accessdate=5 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=4 March 2014}}</ref> The president of [[COPEI]] along with other citizens gathered in front of the United Nations in [[Chacao, Venezuela|Chacao]] asking for the opposition to present their case to the United Nations and claimed that [[Elias Jaua]] is trying to conceal what is really happening in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei solicita a la ONU escuchar a manifestantes en Venezuela |url=http://globovision.com/articulo/copei-solicita-a-la-onu-escuchar-a-manifestantes-en-venezuela |accessdate=5 March 2014 |newspaper=Globovision |date=4 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140305053639/http://globovision.com/articulo/copei-solicita-a-la-onu-escuchar-a-manifestantes-en-venezuela |archivedate=March 5, 2014 }}</ref> * '''5 March''' – Venezuela severed diplomatic relations with Panama as the nation honored President Chavez on the first anniversary of his death. President Maduro, in an address at the Montana Barracks in Caracas, accused Panama of pushing for regional organizations to intervene in Venezuela as it had asked the Organization of American States for an investigation into the protests,<ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2014/03/05/world/americas/venezuela-panama-diplomatic-ties-suspended/ |title=Venezuela cuts ties with Panama, calling country a U.S. 'lackey' - CNN.com |publisher=Edition.cnn.com |date=}}</ref> and assured the OAS it's a "dying organization with sixty years of a bad history of intervention and dictatorship".<ref>[http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140305/gobierno-rompe-relaciones-diplomaticas-y-comerciales-con-panama Gobierno rompe relaciones diplomáticas y comerciales con Panamá - Nacional y Política<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/nacionales/venezuela-rompe-relaciones-politicas-y-economicas-panama-por-injerencia-asuntos-internos/ Venezuela rompe relaciones con Panamá por injerencia en asuntos internos | Correo del Orinoco<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Hours after President Maduro called on the UBCH (Bolivar and Chavez Battle Units), the communal councils, communes, and colectivos during his speech; attacks on an apartment building by some groups who shot at residents and the National Guard who fired tear gas at the building resulted in two deaths in Los Ruices, including a National Guardsman.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ataque en Los Ruices dejó dos muertos|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140307/ataque-en-los-ruices-dejo-dos-muertos|accessdate=9 March 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=7 March 2014}}</ref> Members of the National Guard and "colectivos" both attacked peaceful protesters in Caracas with the mayor of the municipality [[Ramón Muchacho]] confirming this and denouncing the actions of the National Guard that caused damage saying, "We could see how a well-identified tank of the National Guard deliberately rammed a parked car on a street."<ref>{{cite news|last=Custode|first=Francis|title=GNB y PNB arremetió contra manifestantes en distintas urbanizaciones|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/GNB-PNB-arremetio-manifestantes-urbanizaciones_0_367763221.html|accessdate=6 March 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=6 March 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140306074703/http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/GNB-PNB-arremetio-manifestantes-urbanizaciones_0_367763221.html|archivedate=6 March Assembly]] as a deputy, therefore expelling her in accordance with the Assembly rules and in compliance with articles 149 and 191 of the [[Constitution of Venezuela]], which states that "public officials shall not be permitted to accept employment, honors or rewards from foreign governments without authorization from the National Assembly" and that "deputies of the National Assembly shall not be permitted to accept or hold public employment positions without giving up their investiture(…)".<ref>{{cite news|title=Cabello: María Corina no tendrá más acceso a la AN porque "ella dejó de ser diputada"|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/24/diosdado-cabello-ofrece-rueda-de-prensa-3/|accessdate=24 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=24 March 2014}}</ref><ref>[https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_the_Bolivarian_Republic_of_Venezuela/Title_4#48 Constitution of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela/Title 4 - Wikisource, the free online library<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_the_Bolivarian_Republic_of_Venezuela/Title_5#69 Constitution of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela/Title 5 - Wikisource, the free online library<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> María Corina Machado said that she would be deputy as long as the people wanted her to be.<ref>[http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140324/maria-corina-machado-soy-diputada-mientras-el-pueblo-asi-lo-quiera María Corina Machado: Soy diputada mientras el pueblo así lo quiera - Protestas en Venezuela<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * '''25 March''' - President Maduro announced that three [[Venezuelan Air Force]] generals were arrested for allegedly planning a "coup" against the government and supporting the protests, and will be charged accordingly.<ref name="Rojas">{{cite news|last=Rojas|first=Eligio|title=Generales Machillanda, Hernández y Millán involucrados en supuesto golpe|url=http://www.elmundo.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/generales-machillanda--hernandez-y-millan-involucr.aspx|accessdate=26 March 2014|newspaper=El Mundo|date=25 March 2014}}</ref> On the same day, Minister of the Interior, Justice and Peace Miguel Rodríguez Torres accused opposition mayor Daniel Ceballos of being financially backed by Colombia to conspire against Maduro's government and for using it to support the protests.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.infonews.com/2014/03/25/mundo-131237-venezuela-opositor-recibia-dinero-para-conspirar-contra-maduro-venezuela.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=June 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140329021543/http://www.infonews.com/2014/03/25/mundo-131237-venezuela-opositor-recibia-dinero-para-conspirar-contra-maduro-venezuela.php |archivedate=March 29, 2014 }}</ref> * '''26 March''' - The ''New York Times'' published an op-ed by Leopoldo López under the headline "Venezuela's Failing State." where he explained he wrote, "from the Ramo Verde military prison outside Caracas," lamenting that for the past fifteen years, "the definition of 'intolerable' in this country has declined by degrees until, to our dismay, we found ourselves with one of the highest murder rates in the Western Hemisphere, a 57 percent inflation rate and a scarcity of basic goods unprecedented outside wartime."<ref name= NYTlopez>{{cite news| last =Lopez| first =Leopoldo| title =Venezuela's Failing State| work =New York Times| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/26/opinion/venezuelas-failing-state.html?hp&rref=opinion&_r=0 }}</ref> María Corina Machado arrived in Venezuela protected by three representatives of the [[Congress of the Republic of Peru]], [[Martín Belaúnde]], [[Luis Galarreta]] and [[Cecilia Chacón]], with Galarreta saying, "We came to support María Corina Machado by this unusual and unacceptable arbitrariness that you want to do".<ref name=ENHmcm>{{cite news|title=Machado, arropada por seguidores y diputados peruanos a su vuelta |url=http://www.elnuevoherald.com/2014/03/26/1711117/machado-vuelve-a-caracas-en-plena.html |accessdate=27 March 2014 |newspaper=El Nuevo Herald |date=26 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327234413/http://www.elnuevoherald.com/2014/03/26/1711117/machado-vuelve-a-caracas-en-plena.html |archivedate=March 27, 2014 }}</ref><ref name=PERUmcm>{{cite news|title=María Corina Machado llegó a Venezuela con tres congresistas peruanos|url=http://www.larepublica.pe/26-03-2014/tres-congresistas-peruanos-acompanan-a-maria-corina-machado-en-su-retorno-a-venezuela|accessdate=27 March 2014|newspaper=La Republica (Peru)|date=26 March 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140326210311/http://www.larepublica.pe/26-03-2014/tres-congresistas-peruanos-acompanan-a-maria-corina-machado-en-su-retorno-a-venezuela|archivedate=26 March 2014|df=}}</ref> President Maduro said that the United Socialist Party of Venezuela has already chosen candidates to possibly replace arrested officials through an election that he said "we will win".<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro anuncia que ya tienen sus candidatos para municipios San Diego y San Cristóbal|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/26/oficialismo-ya-tiene-sus-candidatos-para-elecciones-en-municipios-san-diego-y-san-cristobal/|accessdate=27 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=26 March 2014}}</ref> * '''27 March''' - In [[Sucre, Venezuela|Sucre]], groups of people protested due to a lack of water in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Filas de Mariche por falta de agua |url=http://globovision.com/articulo/protesta-en-filas-de-mariche-mantiene-cerrado-el-paso-vehicular |accessdate=27 March 2014 |newspaper=Globovision |date=27 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327234451/http://globovision.com/articulo/protesta-en-filas-de-mariche-mantiene-cerrado-el-paso-vehicular |archivedate=March 27, 2014 }}</ref> 225 military officers rejected the allegations against the three air force generals, saying that to bring them before a martial court "would be violating their constitutional rights, as it is essential first to submit a preliminary hearing" and asked the National Guard "to be limited to fulfill its functions under articles 320, 328 and 329 of the Constitution and cease their illegal repressive activities of public order" against the protest actions.<ref name=FIMgenerals>{{cite news|title=Frente Institucional Militar rechaza detención de oficiales|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Frente-Institucional-Militar-detencion-oficiales_0_380362049.html|accessdate=27 March 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=27 March 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140327204302/http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Frente-Institucional-Militar-detencion-oficiales_0_380362049.html|archivedate=27 March 2014|df=}}</ref> Venezuelan Vice President Jorge Arreaza said that a national human rights council was created and "will receive all complaints of alleged assaults".<ref>{{cite news|title=Arreaza: Cancilleres de Unsaur se llevan buena impresión de Conferencia por la Paz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/27/arreaza-anuncia-creacion-de-consejo-nacional-de-ddhh-para-atender-denuncias/|accessdate=27 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=27 March 2014}}</ref> In [[Maracaibo, Venezuela|Maracaibo]], colectivos attempted to rape individuals in an apartment complex without intervention from National Guardsmen stationed in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Colectivos paramilitares irrumpen en hogares y amenazan con violar a los residentes con "permiso" de la GNB|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/27/colectivos-paramilitares-irrumpen-en-hogares-y-amenazan-con-violar-a-los-residentes-con-permiso-de-la-gnb/|accessdate=29 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=27 March 2014}}</ref> * '''28 March''' - Members of the Student Movement gathered at the [[Bello Monte]] morgue to recite [[Lords Prayer|Our Father]] in respect to the fallen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mensajes para los caídos aparecieron hoy en la Morgue de Bello Monte (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/28/mensajes-para-los-caidos-aparecieron-hoy-en-la-morgue-de-bello-monte-fotos/|accessdate=29 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 March 2014}}</ref> Protesters blocked traffic on Francisco de Miranda Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes trancan Av. Francisco de Miranda frente a Centro Lido (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/28/manifestantes-trancan-av-francisco-de-miranda-frente-a-centro-lido-fotos/|accessdate=29 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 March 2014}}</ref> Colectivos attacked the Popular Will headquarters in Maracaibo burning it.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paramilitares atacan sede de Voluntad Popular en Maracaibo|url=https://cloud-1394652165-cache.cdn-cachefront.net/paramilitares-atacan-sede-de-voluntad-popular-en-maracaibo/|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=Ahora Vision|date=28 March 2014}}</ref> * '''29 March''' - Three protests took place in Caracas in the areas of Altamira, Los Cortijos and Las Mercedes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caracas vuelve a marchar este #29M (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/29/caracas-vuelve-a-marchar-este-29m-fotos/|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 March 2014}}</ref> Protesters in [[Carabobo]] blocked Bolívar Avenue while demonstrating against the government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Las mejores fotos del trancazo en la Av Bolívar en Carabobo #29M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/29/las-mejores-fotos-del-trancazo-en-la-av-bolivar-en-carabobo-29m/|accessdate=29 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 March 2014}}</ref> While protesting just outside Valencia in Carabobo, hundreds of protesters were shot at with buckshot and tear gas by police.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestación opositora en Valencia conquistó el sur|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/78352/manifestacin-opositora-en-valencia-conquist-el-sur|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=El Carabobeno|date=29 March 2014}}</ref> Henrique Capriles criticized President Maduro saying that while Venezuelans die, the president "sleeps like a baby while everything happens", mocking a statement President Maduro said to CNN during an interview with [[Christiane Amanpour]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Capriles: Siguen cayendo hermanos venezolanos y Maduro duerme como un bebé|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/29/capriles-siguen-cayendo-hermanos-venezolanos-y-maduro-duerme-como-un-bebe/|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela's protests careen into week 5|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/americas/venezuela/140312/venezuelan-caracas-protests-one-month|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=Global Post|date=29 March 2014}}</ref> * '''30 March''' -
