In San Cristóbal, tear gas engulfed the city where clashes between protesters and police took place since 4{{nbsp}}am.<ref>{{cite news|title=Nueva jornada de terror nocturna en el Táchira: Lacrimógenas, explosiones, balas y represión|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/30/nueva-jornada-de-terror-nocturna-en-el-tachira-lacrimogenas-explosiones-balas-y-represion/|accessdate=30 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=30 March 2014}}</ref> María Corina Machado regretted the attacks from the previous night against residents in Tachira that had their homes allegedly<ref>{{cite news|title=MCM: Táchira sufrió anoche la más brutal represión|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/MCM-Tachira-sufrio-brutal-represion_0_382161793.html|accessdate=31 March 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=30 March 2014}}</ref> attacked with gunfire, stones and tear gas by the National Guard and police. * '''31 March''' - Student protesters placed tents outside the entrance of the UN headquarters in Caracas asking why it has not given the country attention.<ref>{{cite news|title="¿ONU dónde estás?", preguntan jóvenes venezolanos frente a sede en Caracas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/31/onu-donde-estas-preguntan-jovenes-venezolanos-frente-a-sede-en-caracas-fotos/|accessdate=31 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=31 March 2014}}</ref> Students of the Central University of Venezuela blocked the [[Francisco Fajardo Highway]] while protesting.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB intenta retirar protesta de estudiantes en la autopista Francisco Fajardo (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/31/estudiantes-de-la-ucv-trancan-el-paso-en-la-autopista-francisco-fajardo-fotos/|accessdate=31 March 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=31 March 2014}}</ref> Deputies and students called for a gathering the next day to accompany María Corina Machado to a National Assembly meeting.<ref>[http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140331/convocan-concentracion-en-apoyo-a-maria-corina-machado Convocan concentración en apoyo a María Corina Machado - Protestas en Venezuela<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==April== [[File:MCM Brazil 2014.jpg|250px|thumb|right|María Corina Machado speaking with the Brazilian government.]] [[File:Venezuela 2014 Tents 2.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Opposition protesters camping in tents demonstrating against the government.]] [[File:Opposition rally 23.jpg|250px|thumb|right|An opposition rally protesting against the government.]] [[File:Protesters with sign Venezuela 2014.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Opposition protesters holding a sign saying "If the street turns off, Venezuela dies".]] [[File:Altar de oración en la sede de la ONU durante la huelga de hambre.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Prayer altar at the UN headquarters during the hunger strike for a ruling by the UN.]] [[File:Guarimba Wall Painting 2.JPG|250px|thumbnail|right|A wall painting that previously criticized barricades was changed to criticize the "dictatorship".]] [[File:Bandera en Manifestación Pacífica en contra del Gobierno de Nicolas Maduro en Plaza Altamira.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Venezuelan flag that was placed during peaceful protests against the government of Nicolas Maduro at Altamira Square.]] [[File:Maduro Burning Judas 2014.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Effigies of Nicolas Maduro and other government figures that were burnt during a [[Burning of Judas]] gathering on [[Easter]].]] [[File:Opposition sign Venezuela 2014.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|A sign explaining why the opposition protest. "Why do the Venezuelans protest? Insecurity, injustice, shortages, censorship, violence, corruption. Protesting is not a crime. Is a right".]] * '''1 April''' - In a ''[[New York Times]]'' [[op-ed]], President Maduro discusses the ongoing protests. He writes of distortions by the foreign media, claiming the protests primarily represent wealthier segments of society, not "mainstream sentiment," and points to improvements in inequality and poverty and the creation of universal health care and education programs.<ref name= NYTmaduro>Nicolas Maduro. April 1, 2014. [https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/02/opinion/venezuela-a-call-for-peace.html?_r=0 Venezuela: A Call for Peace]. ''The New York Times.'' Retrieved: 3 April 2014.</ref> Citizens of Caracas protested demanding justice and the end of repression.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caraqueños siguen pidiendo justicia por los caídos en protestas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/01/caraquenos-siguen-pidiendo-justicia-por-los-caidos-en-protestas-fotos/|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 April 2014}}</ref> María Corina Machado along with supporters began a march toward downtown Caracas protesting against Machado's expulsion and were surrounded by the National Guard which prevented them from leaving and dispersed with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|last=Buitrago|first=Deisy|title=Venezuela troops block opposition leader from parliament|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/04/01/us-venezuela-protests-idUSBREA301XZ20140401|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=Reuters|date=1 April 2014}}</ref> Protests in front of the UN headquarters began blocking Francisco de Miranda Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta frente a la ONU restringe el paso en la avenida Francisco de Miranda (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/01/protesta-frente-a-la-onu-restringe-el-paso-en-la-avenida-francisco-de-miranda-fotos/|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 April 2014}}</ref> Barricades continued to block traffic in many cities.<ref>{{cite news|title=Barricadas en el Marqués este #1A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/01/barricadas-en-el-marques-este-1a-fotos/|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Chacao amaneció con barricadas este #1A (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/01/chacao-amanecio-con-barricadas-este-1a-foto/|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 April 2014}}</ref> Amnesty International presented a report about "torture, abuse, arbitrary arrests, helplessness and human rights violations against opponents of the government" with the organization saying protesters "do not want to talk for fear of retaliation".<ref name=AItorture>{{cite news|title=Amnistía Internacional denuncia casos de tortura durante las protestas de Venezuela|url=http://internacional.elpais.com/internacional/2014/03/31/actualidad/1396294510_025591.html|accessdate=1 April 2014|newspaper=El Pais|date=1 April 2014}}</ref> * '''2 April''' - Students from the Central University of Venezuela (UCV), Andrés Bello Catholic University (UCAB), Simón Bolívar University (USB), Monte Avila University (AMU) and the Metropolitan University (Unimet) conducted meetings discussing which activities should be performed in the future.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes universitarios realizan asambleas en casas de estudio|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140402/estudiantes-universitarios-realizan-asambleas-en-casas-de-estudio|accessdate=2 April 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=2 April 2014}}</ref> Students of UCV continued to protest and refused to return to classes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la UCV se niegan a regresar a clases y continúan el pupitrazo (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/02/estudiantes-de-la-ucv-se-niegan-a-regresar-a-clases-y-continuan-el-pupitrazo-fotos/|accessdate=2 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=2 April 2014}}</ref> A professor at Simon Bolivar University did not deny that trees have been used in barricades but says that the president's claim of 5,000 trees is a "product of political confrontation" and said that deforestation by companies was more dangerous due to "the lack of environmental monitoring by the Ministry of Environment".<ref>{{cite news|title=Biólogos dudan de la tala de 5 mil árboles|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/vida/140402/biologos-dudan-de-la-tala-de-5-mil-arboles|accessdate=2 April 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=2 April 2014}}</ref> The Bolivarian National Police began using [[stun grenade]]s on protesters in Chacao.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB ahora reprime a manifestantes con explosivos aturdidores (Fotos + Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/02/pnb-ahora-reprime-a-manifestantes-con-explosivos-aturdidores-video/|accessdate=3 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=2 April 2014}}</ref> * '''3 April''' - The ''Colegio de Abogados de Venezuela'' went to the [[Supreme Tribunal of Justice (Venezuela)|Supreme Tribunal of Justice]] and denounced the imprisonment of public officials calling it a "kidnapping".<ref>{{cite news|title=Abogados denuncian secuestro de los Poderes Públicos por el Gobierno|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/03/abogados-denuncian-ocupacion-de-actores-politicos-frente-al-sistema-judicial/|accessdate=3 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=3 April 2014}}</ref> President Maduro signed a decree creating the Human Rights Council, with the aim of "fully enforcing the Venezuelans' human rights". Maduro stated that "If they want to change the government out of desperation, whether at the level of a mayor, a governor, or the President of the Republic, here is your way to do it (the Constitution of Venezuela). Collect the signatures, if you get enough of them, then we're calling a referendum in 2016".<ref>http://www.infonews.com/2014/04/03/mundo-132721-venezuela-oficializan-la-creacion-del-consejo-de-derechos-humanos.php</ref> Colectivos entered into the UCV, and a student was undressed and beaten by these groups.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fDM0YMGFdBM Desnudan a Estudiante el golpeado y desnudado dentro de la UCV - YouTube<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://voces.huffingtonpost.com/2014/03/25/estudiante-venezuela-golpiza-reacciones_n_5030111.html Reacciones a golpiza a estudiante venezolano (VIDEO) (EXPLĂ?CITO)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.mdzol.com/video/525512/ Video: desnudaron y golpearon a estudiantes en Venezuela - MDZ Online<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.reporteconfidencial.info/noticia/3216282/ap-estudiante-opositor-desnudo-golpeado-por-grupo-pro-gobierno-hoy-en-ucv/ #AP Estudiante opositor desnudo golpeado por grupo pro-gobierno hoy en UCV<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://notitweet-sucesos.blogspot.com/2014/04/presuntos-colectivos-golpean.html Sucesos: Presuntos colectivos golpean brutalmente y desnudan a estudiante en la UCV (+FOTOS)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.maduradas.com/impactante-colectivos-armados-golpean-y-desnudan-a-estudiantes-en-la-ucv-fotos-video/ ¡IMPACTANTE! Colectivos armados golpean y desnudan a estudiantes en la UCV + Fotos + Video<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * '''4 April''' - In the early morning, about 70 protesters gathered discussing problems in Plaza Candelaria and were assaulted by colectivos with violent insults, threats with firearms and some pushing while neighbors retaliated with fireworks and throwing objects.<ref>{{cite news|title="Colectivos de paz" golpean y agreden vecinos en la Candelaria (Fotos y Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/04/colectivos-golpean-y-agreden-vecinos-en-candelaria-fotos-y-video/|accessdate=4 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=4 April 2014}}</ref> Leopoldo Lopez was formally indicted of "arson in degree of determiner, public incitement, damage to public property and grade determiner conspiracy" and could face more than 13 years in prison if convicted.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiscalía acusa formalmente a Leopoldo López|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/04/luisa-ortega-diaz-ofrece-balance-de-los-hechos-violentos-de-los-ultimos-dias/|accessdate=5 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=4 April 2014}}</ref> In [[Barquisimeto, Venezuela|Barquisimeto]], a tank belonging to the National Guard ran over a fleeing 18-year-old protester.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tanqueta de la GNB arrolló a joven en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/78770/tanqueta-de-la-gnb-arroll-a-joven-en-barquisimeto|accessdate=5 April 2014|newspaper=El Carabobeno|date=4 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=El impactante momento en el que un joven fue atropellado presuntamente por una tanqueta de la GNB en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.ntn24.com/videos/joven-estudiante-fue-vilmente-atropellado-por-una-tanqueta-de-la-gnb-en-barquisimeto-127533|accessdate=5 April 2014|newspaper=NTN24|date=4 April 2014}}</ref> President of the faculty association of the Central University of Venezuela, Victor Marquez, called on President Maduro to protect students saying the problems at the university "stem from a government policy of not allowing peaceful public protests" after colectivos armed with wooden clubs, metal rods and guns attacked the university at least 10 times during the protests while government forces watched without intervening.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela university officials decry attacks on students|url=http://touch.latimes.com/#section/-1/article/p2p-79826120/|accessdate=5 April 2014|newspaper=The Los Angeles Times|date=4 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Entregarán a Fiscalía evidencias de paramilitares que atacaron a estudiantes en la UCV|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/04/exigen-a-fiscalia-investigar-hechos-violentos-en-la-ucv/|accessdate=5 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=4 April 2014}}</ref> President Maduro condemned the violent acts that occurred at the UCV and claimed that the students were beaten by "fascists".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://multimedia.telesurtv.net/web/telesur/#!es/video/maduro-condena-brutal-agresion-de-fascistas-a-universitarios |title=Archived copy |accessdate=June 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140618230146/http://multimedia.telesurtv.net/web/telesur/ |archivedate=June 18, 2014 }}</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MRKfYCVfztM Maduro condena brutal agresión de fascistas a universitarios - YouTube<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://albaciudad.org/wp/index.php/2014/04/dos-estudiantes-revolucionarios-heridos-tras-ataque-a-la-escuela-de-trabajo-social-de-la-ucv/ Dos estudiantes revolucionarios heridos tras ataque a la Escuela de Trabajo Social de la UCV | Alba Ciudad 96.3 FM<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/caracas/reportan-2-estudiantes-gravemente-heridos-manifestacion-opositora-ucv/ Reportan 2 estudiantes gravemente heridos por ataque violento de opositores en la UCV (+Videos) | Correo del Orinoco<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.elpropio.com/actualidad/Reportan-presencia-colectivos-dentro-UCV_0_493750643.html "Colectivo infiltrado" resultó ser estudiante de derecho de la UCV<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/04/asi-rescataron-a-estudiante-infiltrado-en-protesta-opositora-video-presentado-por-maduro/ Así rescataron a estudiante infiltrado en protesta opositora (video presentado por Maduro)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * '''5 April''' - María Corina Machado visited student protesting in front of the UN headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=María Corina acompaña a los estudiantes que protestan frente a la ONU (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/05/maria-corina-llega-a-maiquetia-tras-viaje-a-brasil/|accessdate=6 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=5 April 2014}}</ref> President Maduro said he would not have dialogue with "fascists" and said the MUD does not want dialogue because they are "betting on a meltdown".<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro asegura que no dialogará con "fascistas"|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/maduro-encabeza-reinauguracion-de-aeropuerto-de-coche|accessdate=6 April 2014|newspaper=Globovision|date=5 April 2014}}</ref> * '''6 April''' - The Student Movement called on Venezuelans to place Venezuelan flags and other objects containing the Venezuelan flag's tricolor on cars, homes and clothing.<ref>{{cite news|title=Realizan protesta tricolor este domingo #6A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/06/estudiantes-convocan-a-protesta-tricolor-este-domingo/|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=6 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=En imágenes: Así fue la protesta tricolor convocada por estudiantes|url=http://www.venezuelaaldia.com/2014/04/en-imagenes-asi-fue-la-protesta-tricolor-convocada-por-estudiantes/|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=Venezuela Al Dia|date=6 April 2014}}</ref> Nairobi Pinto, chief editor for Globovision was kidnapped by two hooded men.<ref>{{cite news|title=Secuestran a Nairobi Pinto, jefa de corresponsalía de Globovisión (+Tuits)|url=http://www.venezuelaaldia.com/2014/04/secuestran-a-nairobi-pinto-jefa-de-corresponsalia-de-globovision-tuits/|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=Venezuela Al Dia|date=6 April 2014}}</ref> Clashes between protesters and government forces occurred throughout the day in El Cafetal, [[Caracas]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Un domingo de terror y represión vivieron vecinos de El Cafetal (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/06/las-fotos-de-la-brutal-represion-en-el-cafetal-que-recorren-el-mundo/|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=6 April 2014}}</ref> The protesters reported the tear gas used during the clashes was expired.<ref>[http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/06/comprueban-que-bombas-lacrimogenas-arrojadas-en-el-cafetal-estaban-vencidas-foto/ Comprueban que bombas lacrimógenas arrojadas en El Cafetal estaban vencidas (Foto)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.venezuelaawareness.com/2014/04/6a-la-guerra-en-el-cafetal-caracas-empezo-a-las-533am-gas-detenciones-heridos/ 6A La guerra en el Cafetal, Caracas, empezó a las 5:33am gas, detenciones, heridos… » Venezuela Awareness Foundation<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * '''7 April''' - [[Physician]]s that were protesting blocked Urdaneta Avenue in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Médicos trancan la avenida Urdaneta (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/07/medicos-trancan-la-avenida-urdaneta-foto/|accessdate=7 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=7 April 2014}}</ref> Chavista workers from [[Sidor]] protested against the government explaining issues with benefits, agreements, investments, weak pay increases and the "abandonment" by the government.<ref>{{cite news|title=VIDEO: Trabajador chavista de Sidor rompe el silencio contra el Gobierno|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/07/video-trabajador-chavista-de-sidor-rompe-el-silencio-contra-el-gobierno/|accessdate=8 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=7 April 2014}}</ref> * '''8 April''' - Mothers and fathers in Chacao had a silent demonstration and dressed in black with blank signs to protest against those who lacked interest in Venezuela's current crisis.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta silenciosa de madres y padres en la avenida Francisco de Miranda (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/08/protesta-silenciosa-de-madres-y-padres-en-la-avenida-francisco-de-miranda-fotos/|accessdate=9 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=8 April 2014}}</ref> A meeting between MUD and the Venezuelan government was held at the Casa Amarilla after the government accepted conditions for dialogue.<ref>{{cite news|title=LA FOTO: Aveledo, Jaua, Falcón y Rodríguez se encuentran en la Casa Amarilla, Maduro también se une|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/08/la-foto-aveledo-jaua-falcon-y-rodiguez-se-encuentran-en-la-casa-amarilla/|accessdate=9 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=8 April 2014}}</ref> * '''9 April''' - Medical students form UCV had a "Health Day" and protested while seeing patients on the street.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de medicina de la UCV tomaron la Plaza Brión de Chacaíto (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/09/estudiantes-de-medicina-de-la-ucv-tomaron-la-plaza-brion-de-chacaito-fotos/|accessdate=9 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=9 April 2014}}</ref> Workers of the media demanded for the release of Nairobi Pinto, the chief editor for Globovision.<ref>{{cite news|title=Periodistas exigen la liberación de Nairobi Pinto (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/09/periodistas-promueve-campana-para-exigir-liberacion-de-nairoibi-pinto-fotos/|accessdate=9 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=9 April 2014}}</ref> * '''10 April''' - Bioanalysis students of the Central University of Venezuela held class at the Plaza de Los Palos Grandes while protesting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Dictan clase magistral de Bioanálisis en Los Palos Grandes (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/10/dictan-clase-magistral-de-bioanalisis-en-los-palos-grandes-foto/|accessdate=10 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=10 April 2014}}</ref> A small group of protesters traveled around Caracas dressed in [[army men]] costumes and holding signs saying, "As a child, they were my heroes, now the repress me".<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta creativa del día contra la brutal represión militar (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/10/protesta-creativa-del-dia-contra-la-brutal-represion-militar-fotos/|accessdate=11 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=10 April 2014}}</ref> At night, a large group of students and citizens protested against their "lost future" and in respect to for those who have died during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title="Marcha de la luz" toma la Av. Francisco de Miranda (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/10/hoy-sera-la-marcha-de-la-luz-de-los-estudiantes/|accessdate=11 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=10 April 2014}}</ref> Peace talks between Maduro and the opposition's Democratic Unity Round Table alliance, including Henry Capriles, are televised. Foreign ministers of Brazil, Colombia and Ecuador also partake, while a Vatican representative reads a letter from [[Pope Francis]] supporting national reconciliation. A follow-up meeting is announced for April 15.<ref name=Orozco>{{cite web|last=Orozco|first=Jose|title=Venezuela's Maduro Holds Televised Peace Talks With Opposition|url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2014-04-11/venezuela-s-maduro-holds-televised-peace-talks-with-opposition|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140411144739/http://www.businessweek.com/news/2014-04-11/venezuela-s-maduro-holds-televised-peace-talks-with-opposition|dead-url=yes|archive-date=11 April 2014|publisher=Business Week|accessdate=11 April 2014}}</ref> After the six hours of peace talks, skepticism was generated between conflicting parties and also among citizens in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=El diálogo de casi seis horas generó posiciones encontradas y escepticismo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/11/el-dialogo-de-casi-seis-horas-genero-posiciones-encontradas-y-escepticismo/|accessdate=11 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> * '''11 April''' - Members of the Movement of Young Venezuelans began a [[hunger strike]] while continuing to protest in tents in front of the UN headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes del campamento frente a la ONU inician huelga de hambre (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/11/jovenes-del-campamento-frente-a-la-onu-inician-huelga-de-hambre-foto/|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> Diosdado Cabello insulted opposition members who attended the peace talks a day before declaring, "''They sat a group of Venezuelans whose intention to sit and listen to what we were saying is recognized, but do not like to be told things''".<ref>{{cite news|title=Cabello ataca a la oposición un día después de la mesa de "diálogo" (Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/11/cabello-sobre-la-oposicion-ellos-con-su-cara-de-yo-no-fui-viven-llamando-a-la-violencia/|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> Leaders of Popular Will told Venezuelans to keep protesting until the Venezuelan government provided changes and said that the previous day peace talks had taken place in "unfair conditions", during which "a sole party acted as moderator".<ref>{{cite news|title=Rechazan desempeño inconstitucional de Maduro frente a represión, muertes y torturas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/11/smolansky-machado-y-ledezma-afirman-que-jamas-legitimaran-desempeno-inconstitucional-de-maduro-frente-a-represion-muertes-y-torturas/|accessdate=12 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> A group on motorcycles protested in Sucre causing blockages of traffic.<ref>{{cite news|title=Motorizados trancan la entrada y salida de Palo Verde este #11A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/11/motorizados-trancan-la-entra-y-salida-de-palo-verde-este-11a-fotos/|accessdate=11 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=11 April 2014}}</ref> * '''12 April''' - Thousands of opposition protesters in separate groups each wore a different color of red, yellow and blue and began to demonstrate in Caracas after Maria Corina Machado called on them to protest.<ref>{{cite news|title=La oposición marchó este sábado en Caracas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/12/estudiantes-marcharan-por-el-futuro-este-12a/|accessdate=13 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=12 April 2014}}</ref> * '''13 April''' - President Maduro announced plans of a new "ministry of international communication" due to an alleged "communications war unleashed against the country, the revolution and especially against me as president".<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro creará un ministerio para la "defensa mundial de Venezuela"|url=http://www.infobae.com/2014/04/13/1557026-maduro-creara-un-ministerio-la-defensa-mundial-venezuela|accessdate=14 April 2014|newspaper=Infobae|date=13 April 2014}}</ref> Athletes gathered in Miranda and protested against the violence present in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Deportistas corren en contra de la violencia desde Parque Miranda #13A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/13/deportistas-corren-en-contra-de-la-violencia-desde-parque-miranda-13a-foto/|accessdate=13 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=13 April 2014}}</ref> * '''14 April''' - Nairobi Pinto was released from her captors after over a week of being held and said she could not explain the situation due to" safety reasons".<ref>{{cite news|title=Nairobi Pinto: Siempre estuve vendada, nunca me maltrataron (Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/14/aparecio-nairobi-pinto-viva-en-cua/|accessdate=14 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=14 April 2014}}</ref> Students from the University of Oriente (UDO), Universidad Santa María (USM), the Universidad Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho (UGMA) and other citizens pitched tents to stay in the streets of Anzoategui while protesting against the crisis claiming that protesting in the streets is "the only way".<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes pernoctarán durante Semana Santa en el Distribuidor Fabricio Ojeda de Lechería|url=http://alternoriente.com/estudiantes-pernoctaran-durante-semana-santa-en-el-distribuidor-fabricio-ojeda-de-lecheria/|accessdate=15 April 2014|newspaper=Alternoriente|date=14 April 2014}}</ref> The government and some opposition leaders had a second dialogue meeting.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/mundo/ultimas_noticias/2014/04/140416_ultnot_dialogo_venezuela_ronda2_lav.shtml Oposición y gobierno reportan avances en segunda jornada de diálogo en Venezuela - BBC Mundo<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> * '''15 April''' - Metrobuses in Caracas begin to run with banners on their windows against "fascism" accompanied with pictures of Hugo Chávez and Simon Bolivar.<ref>{{cite news|title=Propaganda fascista en Metrobus (foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/15/propaganda-fascista-en-metrobus-foto/|accessdate=15 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 April 2014}}</ref> * '''16 April''' - Colectivos in several trucks allegedly attacked an apartment complex known for protesting damaging 5 vehicles, leaving 2 burnt, and fired several shots into the apartments leaving one person injured from a gunshot wound.<ref name= IMPULSOcolectivo>{{cite news|title=#16A Una persona herida y dos vehículos quemados fue el saldo de ataque de colectivos en urbanización Río Lama|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/16a-queman-dos-carros-esta-madrugada-en-urbanizacion-rio-lama#|accessdate=16 April 2014|newspaper=El Impulso|date=16 April 2014}}</ref> Large groups of students in Caracas conducted a protest while barefoot mimicking the [[Stations of the Cross]], with each "station" representing a problem Venezuela was facing.<ref name=barefoot>{{cite news|title=Barefoot in Venezuela|url=http://www.newsweek.com/barefoot-venezuela-246637|accessdate=17 April 2014|newspaper=Reuters/Newsweek|date=17 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes marcharon con los #PiesDescalzos en Caracas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/16/la-marcha-de-los-pies-descalzos/|accessdate=17 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=16 April 2014}}</ref> * '''17 April''' - Clashes between protesters and police occurred in Chacao.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan fuertes enfrentamientos entre manifestantes y PNB en Chacao (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/17/cerrada-avenida-uslar-pietri-de-chacao-por-barricada-foto/|accessdate=18 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=17 April 2014}}</ref> Crowds held a vigil for those who died during the protests near the Prados del Este highway.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vigilia en el Distribuidor Santa Fe: Una luz para el descanso de los caídos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/17/vigilia-en-el-distribuidor-santa-fe-una-luz-para-el-descanso-de-los-caidos-fotos/|accessdate=18 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=17 April 2014}}</ref> * '''18 April''' - A student in Valencia was killed after being shot at least seven times.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Daza fue asesinado en La Isabelica mientras organizaba quema de Judas |url=http://www.elperiodiquito.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=149426 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140419025506/http://www.elperiodiquito.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=149426 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 April 2014 |accessdate=18 April 2014 |newspaper=El Periodiquito |date=18 April 2014 }}</ref> Maria Corina Machado returned to Venezuela after meeting with members of the European Union.<ref>{{cite news|title=María Corina llegó a Maiquetía y fue recibida con mucha alegría (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/18/maria-corina-llego-a-maiquetia-y-fue-recibida-con-mucho-carino-foto/|accessdate=19 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=18 April 2014}}</ref> Citizens in Zulia protested for the release of Leopoldo Lopez two months after he was arrested and for the release of those allegedly detained unjustly.<ref>{{cite news|title=Zulianos envían mensajes de solidaridad y apoyo a Leopoldo López|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/18/zulianos-envian-mensajes-de-solidaridad-y-apoyo-a-leopoldo-lopez/|accessdate=19 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=18 April 2014}}</ref> * '''19 April''' - President Nicolas Maduro made statements about Venezuela's independence saying "Long has been our way as a people to achieve true and lasting independence, 204 years of the 19th of April and the struggle continues" and that his previous year in office was "[a] year of unity and battle, exercising with the People's Power for Socialist Chavez and the Bolivarian Revolution".<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro reafirma juramento de "hacer la Revolución Socialista y Bolivariana de Chávez"|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/19/maduro-reafirma-juramento-de-hacer-la-revolucion-socialista-y-bolivariana-de-chavez/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=19 April 2014}}</ref> The Metropolitan Mayor of Caracas, Antonio Ledezma, announced a march for the following day of Easter called "The Pilgrimage of Resistance" which would be attended by members of the National Assembly and various mayors from different municipalities.<ref>{{cite news|title=Convocan marcha "La Peregrinación de la Resistencia" para este domingo #20A|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/19/convocan-marcha-la-peregrinacion-de-la-resistencia-para-este-domingo-20a/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=19 April 2014}}</ref> The National Guard and armed groups attacked residents in Barquisimeto firing gas, lead pellets and rubber pellets into homes resulting in several injuries, damaged vehicles and left the area without power after shooting an electrical transformer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Disturbios en Barquisimeto dejan heridos y apagones|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140420/disturbios-en-barquisimeto-dejan-heridos-y-apagones|accessdate=21 April 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=20 April 2014}}</ref> * '''20 April''' - During some traditional [[Easter]] celebrations of the [[Burning of Judas]], some anti-government protesters burned effigies of President Maduro and other government officials saying they betrayed the Venezuelan people just as [[Judas Iscariot]] had betrayed [[Jesus]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Caraqueños y estudiantes quemaron a Judas Maduro, Cabello, Rodríguez y Rodríguez Torres|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/Caraquenos-Maduro-Cabello-Rodriguez-Torres_0_394760638.html|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=20 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Estos son algunos Judas que arderán este domingo (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/estos-son-algunos-judas-que-arderan-hoy-fotos/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref> Protesters marched to the headquarters of the United Nations Program for Development called the "Resurrection of Democracy" where Maria Corina Machado explained that "The whole world understands that we are now fighting for democracy and giving freedom. The whole world condemns the blow given to parliament in these times when it prevents me from entering" and Antonio Ledezma said that, "It's not enough to pray, you have to go out and fight to achieve the resurrection of democracy. The historic alliance of workers and students is at the forefront of this struggle for a better country".<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes y sociedad civil marchan hasta la sede de la ONU|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/estudiantes-y-sociedad-civil-marchan-hoy-por-la-resurreccion-de-la-democracia/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=María Corina: El Gobierno le tiene miedo a la gente en la calle|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/maria-corina-el-gobierno-le-tiene-miedo-a-la-gente-en-la-calle-asi-sea-rezando/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ledezma: Hay que luchar para lograr la resurreción de la Democracia|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/ledezma-la-resurreccion-de-la-democracia-depende-de-salir-a-luchar/|accessdate=20 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref> Residents of Carabobo protested with banners and flags for social improvements and denounced shortages effecting them.<ref>{{cite news|title=Carabobo protesta en este Domingo de Resurrección|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/carabobo-protesta-en-este-domingo-de-resurreccion/|accessdate=21 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref> Clashes occurred between protesters and the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chacao en llamas este Domingo de Resurrección (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/20/reportan-gases-lacrimogenos-en-chacao-foto/|accessdate=21 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 April 2014}}</ref> * '''21 April''' - In the early morning, protesters blocked traffic on the Prados del Este highway in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tranca en la autopista Prados del Este por protesta #21A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/21/trancada-la-autopista-prados-del-este-por-protesta-21a-foto/|accessdate=21 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=21 April 2014}}</ref> The highway remained closed for ten hours while clashes between the National Guard and protesters left one water vehicle inoperable.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caracas colapsó tras horas de enfrentamientos entre la PNB y manifestantes en la Prados del Este (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/21/caos-en-caracas-por-protesta-en-la-prados-del-este-fotos/|accessdate=22 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=21 April 2014}}</ref> * '''22 April''' - Movimiento Estudiantil held a press conference at the Central University of Venezuela denouncing "repressive acts and prohibition" of protests by the government, explained that political parties involved in dialogue with the government "do not represent the Student Movement of Venezuela" and announced that they would continue to protest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Movimiento Estudiantil asegura no sentirse representado por quienes participan en el diálogo |url=http://actualidadvenezuela.org/2014/04/22/movimiento-estudiantil-asegura-no-sentirse-representado-por-quienes-participan-en-el-dialogo/ |accessdate=22 April 2014 |newspaper=Actualidad Venezuela |date=22 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140426232751/http://actualidadvenezuela.org/2014/04/22/movimiento-estudiantil-asegura-no-sentirse-representado-por-quienes-participan-en-el-dialogo/ |archivedate=April 26, 2014 }}</ref> Students of the [[National Experimental Polytechnic University]] (Unexpo) protested against insecurities after frequent robberies and a recent incident where a student was shot.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de Unexpo protestaron en vía El Junquito por inseguridad|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/estudiantes-de-unexpo-cierran-via-el-junquito|accessdate=23 April 2014|newspaper=Globovison|date=22 April 2014}}</ref> Four people; a taxi driver, a police officer of Mérida, and two other men, were shot in Mérida while trying to remove barricades.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cuatro heridos de bala por retiro de barricadas en Mérida|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/22/cuatro-heridos-de-bala-por-retiro-de-barricadas-en-merida/|accessdate=23 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 April 2014}}</ref> In Santa Fe, fires were reported after tear gas was used.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan incendio en Santa Fe Sur tras ataque con bombas lacrimógenas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/22/reportan-incendio-en-santa-fe-sur-tras-ataque-con-gases-lacrimogenos/|accessdate=23 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 April 2014}}</ref> * '''23 April''' - Protesters in Maracaibo blocked traffic with trucks, garbage and tires. They were later dispersed by the National Guard with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes toman camiones y una gandola para cerrar paso por Urbe|url=http://www.laverdad.com/zulia/50822-estudiantes-con-camiones-y-una-gandola-cierran-el-paso-por-urbe.html|accessdate=24 April 2014|newspaper=El Verdad|date=23 April 2014}}</ref> Antonio Ledezma traveled to San Cristobal to show his support for Patricia Ceballos, wife of jailed leader Daniel Ceballos, who is running in the elections to take his lost position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ledezma: La gente de San Cristóbal votará masivamente para protestar|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/23/ledezma-la-gente-de-san-cristobal-votara-masivamente-para-protestar/|accessdate=25 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla}}</ref> * '''24 April''' - The Constitutional Chamber of the Venezuelan Supreme Tribunal of Justice ruled that protests could not be held without permission from the state saying, "Any concentration, demonstration or meeting that does not have the prior endorsement by the respective competent authority to do so may result in the police ... dispersing with the use of the most appropriate mechanisms for this".<ref>{{cite news|title=TSJ prohíbe manifestaciones pacíficas sin permiso|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/24/tsj-prohibe-manifestaciones-pacificas/|accessdate=25 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=24 April 2014}}</ref> President Maduro also announced that the government had "defeated guarimbas" and showed his concern for authorities that were injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro asegura haber derrotado a las guarimbas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/24/maduro-en-mi-ultimo-ano-de-gobierno-habra-habra-miseria-cero/|accessdate=25 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=24 April 2014}}</ref> In Barquisimeto, parents protested against resolution 058 saying that it would have an "alleged socialist influence" in schools.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padres marchan en rechazo a la resolución 058 en Barquisimeto |url=http://notihoy.com/padres-marchan-en-rechazo-la-resolucion-058-en-barquisimeto/ |accessdate=25 April 2014 |newspaper=Notihoy |date=24 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140426201305/http://notihoy.com/padres-marchan-en-rechazo-la-resolucion-058-en-barquisimeto/ |archivedate=April 26, 2014 }}</ref> * '''25 April''' - A group of bioanalysts protested against shortages of medical supplies with the President of the College of Bioanalysts, Judith Leon, saying that "60% of people who come to hospitals will not be addressed because lack of supplies".<ref>{{cite news|title=Bioanalistas protestaron en Caracas para exigir dotación de insumos|url=http://globovision.com/articulo/bioanalistas-marcharan-hasta-la-defensoria-del-pueblo|accessdate=26 April 2014|newspaper=Globovision|date=25 April 2014}}</ref> Protesters demonstrated in front of the UN headquarters on social and economic problems and also warned about the proposed educational reform by the government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Las protestas continúan: Estudiantes cerraron la avenida Francisco de Miranda (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/25/las-protestas-continuan-estudiantes-cerraron-la-avenida-francisco-de-miranda-fotos/|accessdate=27 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=25 April 2014}}</ref> * '''26 April''' - Thousands of protesters demonstrated throughout Venezuela with many protesters denouncing the Venezuelan government's education reform that allegedly indoctrinates socialist models among young students.<ref name=LPtsj>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes desafiaron al TSJ y lograron marchar contra el adoctrinamiento (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/26/movimiento-estudiantil-marchara-contra-el-adoctrinamiento-desde-la-ubv/|accessdate=27 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=26 April 2014}}</ref> The father of Robert Redman, a student that was allegedly killed by government authorities on 12 February, participated in marches with Maria Corina Machado and Lilian Tintori.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padre de Robert Redman marchó junto a Machado y Tintori (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/26/padre-de-robert-redman-junto-a-maria-corina-y-lilian-tintori-en-marcha-de-estudiantes-foto/|accessdate=27 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=26 April 2014}}</ref> * '''27 April''' - Protests occurred inside the Centro Comercial El Recreo mall in Caracas with demonstrators using signs, banners and flags in the mall's corridors.<ref>{{cite news|title=Se inicia protesta dentro del Centro Comercial El Recreo (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/27/se-inicia-protesta-dentro-del-centro-comercial-el-recreo-fotos/|accessdate=28 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=27 April 2014}}</ref> * '''28 April''' - Parents and representatives in Carabobo marched to Ombudsman to deliver a letter to them, protesting against resolution 058 and "ideology in schools".<ref>{{cite news|title=Marcharon hasta la Defensoría del Pueblo por un educación plural (Fotos)|url=http://www.notitarde.com/Valencia/Marcharon-hasta-la-Defensoria-del-Pueblo-por-un-educacion-plural-Fotos/2014/04/28/323605|accessdate=28 April 2014|newspaper=Notitarde|date=28 April 2014}}</ref> Students at the Central University of Venezuela demonstrated outside of the chancellor of the university's office protesting against insecurity.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes protestan frente a la Plaza del Rectorado de la UCV (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/28/estudiantes-protestan-frente-a-la-plaza-del-rectorado-de-la-ucv-fotos/|accessdate=29 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 April 2014}}</ref> Groups of teachers, Movimiento Estudiantil, press workers with SNTP and the Medical Federation of Venezuela (FMV) announced that they will all take part in protests on 1 May.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gremios se suman a gran marcha por Venezuela este #1M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/28/gremios-se-suman-a-gran-marcha-por-venezuela-este-1m/|accessdate=29 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 April 2014}}</ref> * '''29 April''' - Workers of government-run Corpoelec protested asking for raises in pay, collective bargaining and demanded improvements on working conditions.<ref>{{cite news|last=Argüelles|first=Yaileth|title=Trabajadores de Corpoelec marchan para exigir aumento de salarios|url=http://www.laverdad.com/economia/51210-trabajadores-de-corpoelec-marchan-para-exigir-aumento-de-salarios.html|accessdate=30 April 2014|newspaper=La Verdad|date=29 April 2014}}</ref> A man was arrested for attempting to construct barricades on Francisco de Miranda Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detienen a una persona por armar "barricadas" en la Francisco de Miranda este #29A|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/29/barricadas-en-la-av-francisco-de-miranda-a-la-altura-de-la-california-este-29a-fotos/|accessdate=30 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 April 2014}}</ref> Law students of the University of Central Venezuela made statements about the court's decision on protests saying "[t]he Judgment of the Constitutional Court was not given to protect the right to life and freedom" and said that they would not recognize the court's decision.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de Derecho de la UCV repudian sentencia del TSJ (Comunicado)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/29/estudiantes-de-derecho-de-la-ucv-repudian-sentencia-del-tsj-comunicado/|accessdate=30 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 April 2014}}</ref> Friends and family sang Happy Birthday to Leopoldo Lopez outside of the prison he was being held at.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así le cantaron cumpleaños a Leopoldo López desde las afueras de Ramo Verde (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/29/la-foto-lilian-tintori-intenta-entregar-torta-de-cumpleanos-a-leopoldo/|accessdate=30 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 April 2014}}</ref> * '''30 April''' - Students protested at Simon Bolivar University (USB), blocking its entrance while denouncing the Venezuelan Supreme Court's decision on protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes trancan la entrada a la USB (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/04/30/estudiantes-trancan-la-entrada-a-la-usb-foto/|accessdate=30 April 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=30 April 2014}}</ref> Students at University of Santa María (USM) protested against the arrests of their fellow students and blocked access to the House of Studies on the campus.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en la USB y la USM por estudiantes encarcelados en Yare III|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140430/protestan-en-la-usb-y-la-usm-por-estudiantes-encarcelados-en-yare-iii|accessdate=1 May 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=April 30, 2014}}</ref>
==May== [[File:Libertad Protester.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protester with ''Libertad'' written on his fingers.]] [[File:Child protester in Venezuela.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|A child protester asking for the freedom of her mother.]] [[File:MCM Lilian 10 May.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|María Corina Machado and Lilian Tintori leading a march on 10 May.]] [[File:10 May protesters.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Group of protesters during 10 May protests.]] [[File:Protesters Bolivar Statue.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protesters perched on a statue of [[Simón Bolívar]].]] * '''1 May''' - To commemorate Labor Day, thousands of Venezuelans participated in two major rallies in Caracas. In east Caracas, worker unions, student organizations, opposition leaders, physicians, and journalists demonstrated against the Venezuelan government.<ref name=LPMay>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores y estudiantes marcharon hasta El Marqués #1M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/01/oposicion-marcha-este-1m-para-rechazar-el-paquete-economico-de-maduro/|accessdate=1 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=LPmay1>{{cite news|title=Oficialistas y opositores divididos una vez más este #1M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/01/oficialistas-y-opositores-marcharon-este-1-de-mayo/|accessdate=1 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=1 May 2014}}</ref> The groups said the minimum wage increase was not enough due to the country's official rate being so high, denouncing shortages and police shortages while holding banners.<ref name=LPmay1/> In west Caracas, worker unions, government ministers, and pro-government demonstrators,<ref name="correodelorinoco.gob.ve">[http://www.correodelorinoco.gob.ve/politica/pueblo-trabajador-se-moviliza-para-construir-junto-al-presidente-maduro-patria-grande/ Pueblo trabajador se moviliza para construir junto al presidente Maduro la Patria grande | Correo del Orinoco<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> many wearing red,<ref name=LPMay/> gathered to show support for the government's "economic offensive and in defense of (late) President Hugo Chávez's legacy."<ref>{{cite web|title=Caracas is the epicenter of two rallies on Labor Day|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140430/caracas-is-the-epicenter-of-two-rallies-on-labor-day|publisher=El Universal|accessdate=6 May 2014}}</ref> Maduro said the minimum wage increase was a "necessary defense" against inflation,<ref name=LPMay/> while Vice President Jorge Arreaza announced that the unemployment rate in Venezuela is at a record low of 7.2%.<ref name=LPmay1/> Protesters gathered at Altamira Square and were dispersed by authorities leaving some injured from pellets.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes trancan la Francisco de Miranda: cientos de funcionarios de la PNB en la zona|url=http://www.canalntn24.com/noticias/manifestantes-trancan-la-av-francisco-de-miranda-en-altamira-y-funcionarios-de-la-pnb-se-ubican-en|accessdate=1 May 2014|newspaper=NTN24|date=1 May 2014}}</ref> * '''2 May''' - Melvin Collazo, the private SEBIN officer who shot at students on 12 February was released.<ref>{{cite news|title=Nelson Bocaranda lanza un polémico "runrun": habrían dado libertad al Comisario del Sebin, Melvin Collazo |url=http://www.canalntn24.com/node/130855 |accessdate=2 May 2014 |newspaper=NTN24 |date=2 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140502212342/http://www.canalntn24.com/node/130855 |archivedate=May 2, 2014 }}</ref> Interior Minister Miguel Rodriguez Torres accused 58 foreigners of inciting violent protests and stated that the United States was involved.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela: Alleged plan to provoke protests|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/venezuela-alleged-plan-to-provoke-protests/2014/05/02/94869950-d26b-11e3-a714-be7e7f142085_story.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140504092904/http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/venezuela-alleged-plan-to-provoke-protests/2014/05/02/94869950-d26b-11e3-a714-be7e7f142085_story.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=4 May 2014|accessdate=3 May 2014|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=2 May 2014}}</ref> * '''3 May''' - A group of 30 students from the Polytechnic University Institute joined protesters that were camped outside of the UN headquarters on Francisco de Miranda Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes de Santiago Mariño se unieron a campamento de Maracay|url=http://www.elperiodiquito.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=151671|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140504071445/http://www.elperiodiquito.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=151671|dead-url=yes|archive-date=4 May 2014|accessdate=4 May 2014|newspaper=El Periodiquito|date=3 May 2014}}</ref> * '''4 May''' - In Maracay, groups of people protested for the release of Leopoldo Lopez and others who were imprisoned during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maracay salió a la calle este #4M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/04/maracay-salio-a-la-calle-este-4m/|accessdate=4 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=4 May 2014}}</ref> In Carabobo near the Eastern Freeway, neighbors from Mañongo protested with flags and slogans against policies made by President Maduro.<ref>{{cite news|last=Bravo|first=Nathalie|title=Manifestantes en las calles : Protesta en la Autopista del Este|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/80537/manifestantes-en-las-calles-protesta-en-la-autopista-del-este|accessdate=4 May 2014|newspaper=El Carabobeno|date=4 May 2014}}</ref> * '''5 May''' - At least 7 people were injured and 18 arrested in Carabobo during clashes between protesters and the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Siete personas heridas y 18 detenidas dejan enfrentamientos en Carabobo (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/05/entrada-de-tazajal-en-valencia-amanecio-cerrada-con-barricas-este-5m-fotos/|accessdate=6 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=5 May 2014}}</ref> 6 people were injured and classes were cancelled after students at the Catholic University Andrés Bello (UCAB) held protests that resulted in clashes with the National Guard who dispersed protesters with tear gas and buckshot.<ref>{{cite news|title=Al menos seis heridos dejan disturbios en la Ucab-Guayana |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/al-menos-seis-heridos-dejan-disturbios-en-la-ucab-.aspx |accessdate=6 May 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=5 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140506104414/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/al-menos-seis-heridos-dejan-disturbios-en-la-ucab-.aspx |archivedate=May 6, 2014 }}</ref> Classes at the University of the Andes were empty due to students protesting in honor for those who were injured or killed during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pupitres vacíos en honor a los caídos en la ULA Táchira (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/05/pupitres-vacios-en-honor-a-los-caidos-en-la-ula-tachira-fotos/|accessdate=6 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=5 May 2014}}</ref> Armed colectivos allegedly attacked and burnt down Fermín Toro University after intimidating student protesters and shooting one.<ref name=NTN24UFT>{{cite news|title=La Universidad Fermín Toro de Barquisimeto fue incendiada por supuestos colectivos este lunes|url=http://www.ntn24.com/noticias/la-universidad-fermin-toro-de-barquisimeto-fue-incendiada-por-supuestos-colectivos-este-lunes-131297|accessdate=6 May 2014|newspaper=NTN24|date=5 May 2014}}</ref><ref name=ENUFT>{{cite news|title=Denuncian que incendio en la Universidad Fermín Toro fue causado por colectivos armados|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/regiones/Denuncian-Universidad-Fermin-Toro-colectivos_0_403759884.html|accessdate=6 May 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=5 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140506094812/http://www.el-nacional.com/regiones/Denuncian-Universidad-Fermin-Toro-colectivos_0_403759884.html|archivedate=6 May 2014|df=}}</ref> * '''6 May''' - A group of individuals that took place in the [[1992 Venezuelan coup d'état attempts|1992 coup attempt]] led by Hugo Chávez protested against the government demanding more rights.<ref>{{cite news|title=INSÓLITO: Rebeldes del 4F prenden "candelita" en la Urdaneta (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/05/insolito-rebeldes-del-4f-prenden-candelita-en-la-urdaneta-fotos/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=6 May 2014}}</ref> Peaceful student demonstrations were attacked by pro-government armed groups that were assisted by government forces at the Catholic University Andrés Bello.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ucabistas bajo el brutal ataque de grupos armados (incluye PNB)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/06/ucabistas-protestan-en-la-autopista-por-estudiantes-detenidos-fotos/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=6 May 2014}}</ref> Hundreds of student protesters that were denouncing the burning of Fermín Toro University were dispersed by government forces with buckshot and tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|last=Prato|first=Marla|title=Fuertes protestas entre estudiantes y policías ocurren en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140506/fuertes-protestas-entre-estudiantes-y-policias-ocurren-en-barquisimeto|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=6 May 2014}}</ref> A Metrobus driver was injured after being hit with a fire bomb.<ref>{{cite news|title=Conductor de Metrobús sufrió quemaduras tras ataque a unidad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/06/conductor-de-metrobus-sufrio-quemaduras-tras-ataque-a-unidad/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=6 May 2014}}</ref> * '''7 May''' - Citizens in Tucacas in Falcon state protested because they were left without electricity for three days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Tucacas este #7M (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/07/protestan-en-tucacas-este-7m-foto/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=7 May 2014}}</ref> Students from the Metropolitan University in Caracas blocked Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho Highway while protesting against social, economic and political problems.<ref>{{cite news|title=Restringido el paso en el Distribuidor Metropolitano por protesta de universitarios (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/07/restringido-el-paso-en-el-distribuidor-metropolitano-por-protesta-de-universitarios-fotos/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=7 May 2014}}</ref> The National Police then dispersed the university students with tear gas which caused a fire that was controlled hours later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bombas lacrimógenas provocaron incendio en el Distribuidor Metropolitano (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/07/restringido-el-paso-en-el-distribuidor-metropolitano-por-protesta-de-universitarios-fotos/|accessdate=7 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=7 May 2014}}</ref> * '''8 May''' - The protester camps in front of the UN headquarters in Caracas and in other locations were dismantled by hundreds of National Guardsmen who then arrested 243 people at the camps where authorities allegedly found weapons and drugs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así desmanteló la GNB el campamento de los estudiantes #8M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/08/asi-desmantelo-la-gnb-el-campamento-de-los-estudiantes-8m-fotos/|accessdate=8 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=8 May 2014}}</ref> Students of Universidad Santa María responded to the dismantling of camps by protesting and blocking access to the university, which caused heavy congestion on the roadway.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la Universidad Santa María cierran acceso a Mariches|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/caracas/Estudiantes-Universidad-Santa-Maria-Mariches_0_405559537.html|accessdate=8 May 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=8 May 2014}}</ref> Later that day in Caracas, a police officer from the National Police was fatally shot in the neck with three others being injured after clashes with protesters who did not agree with the dismantling of camps.<ref name=YHcasualty>{{cite news|title=Policeman shot dead in Venezuela protests |url=https://news.yahoo.com/venezuela-police-detain-243-dismantle-protest-camps-171202452.html |accessdate=9 May 2014 |newspaper=Yahoo News |date=9 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512232451/http://news.yahoo.com/venezuela-police-detain-243-dismantle-protest-camps-171202452.html |archivedate=May 12, 2014 }}</ref> * '''9 May''' - Tupamaros protested against the proposed sanctions by the United States against Venezuelan officials who allegedly violated human rights, denouncing the "interference in the internal affairs of our country".<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancada la Av. Universidad por manifestación de Tupamaros (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/09/trancada-la-av-universidad-por-manifestacion-del-movimiento-tupamaros-foto/|accessdate=10 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=9 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ley de sanciones para funcionarios venezolanos pasó primera ronda en Congreso de EEUU|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/09/ley-para-sancionar-a-funcionarios-venezolanos-pasa-hoy-primera-ronda-legislativa-en-eeuu/|accessdate=10 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=9 May 2014}}</ref> Student protesters at a camp in Maracay were attacked by armed motorcyclists that fired shots, threw Molotov cocktails and destroyed 30 tents at the camp leaving 5 students injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cinco jóvenes lesionados en ataque a campamento en Maracay|url=http://www.unionradio.net/actualidadur/nota/visornota.aspx?id=172415&tpCont=1&idSec=3|accessdate=10 May 2014|newspaper=Union Radio|date=9 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140510075742/http://www.unionradio.net/actualidadur/nota/visornota.aspx?id=172415&tpCont=1&idSec=3|archivedate=10 May 2014|df=}}</ref> During a protest in Lecheria, a student of Santa Maria University was shot near her head by police.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan que estudiante resultó herida de bala en Lechería|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/regiones/Reportan-estudiante-herida-bala-Lecheria_0_406159656.html|accessdate=11 May 2014|newspaper=El Nacional|date=9 May 2014}}</ref> President Maduro responded to the United States' intention of enforcing sanctions against Venezuelan officials, deeming them "stupid". Maduro stated: "''They say ''[the US]'' they will punish us. Draw your sanctions, Simón Bolívar's people won't be hindered by any sanction from any empire''".<ref>http://www.infonews.com/2014/05/09/mundo-143245-maduro-a-eeuu-a-venezuela-no-lo-para-la-sancion-de-ningun-imperio-venezuela.php</ref> * '''10 May''' - Protesters marched from Chacao to the UNDP headquarters in Altamira, denouncing the "aggressions" against protester camps.<ref>{{cite news|title=Marcha contra la represión llegó hasta la sede del Pnud en Altamira (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/10/estudiantes-marcharan-desde-la-plaza-alfredo-sadel-en-contra-de-la-represion/|accessdate=10 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=10 May 2014}}</ref> Some young protesters in Altamira began to set up barricades with public furnishings in the area and were then quickly dispersed by the National Police with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan bombas lacrimógenas en Altamira (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/10/colocan-barricadas-frente-al-centro-plaza-en-altamira-fotos/|accessdate=10 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=10 May 2014}}</ref> Students, mothers and political leaders peacefully protested on the streets of Caracas saying that there was nothing to celebrate on [[Mother's Day]] because mothers had lost their children during the protests from both murder and arrests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes marcharon en apoyo a madres de jóvenes detenidos|url=http://eltiempo.com.ve/venezuela/protesta/estudiantes-marcharon-en-apoyo-a-madres-de-jovenes-detenidos/138354|accessdate=12 May 2014|newspaper=El Tiempo|date=11 May 2014}}</ref> * '''11 May''' - Hundreds of protesters peacefully marched in east Caracas denouncing the dismantling of camps by the government.<ref name= ET11>{{cite news|title=Oposición marcha por Caracas en apoyo a estudiantes y a la protesta pacífica|url=http://www.eltiempo.com.ec/noticias-cuenca/142420-oposicia-n-marcha-por-caracas-en-apoyo-a-estudiantes-y-a-la-protesta-paca-fica/|accessdate=12 May 2014|newspaper=El Tiempo (Ecuador)|date=11 May 2014}}</ref> The march concluded with the singing of the [[Venezuelan national anthem]] with some groups leaving the march to block roads near Altamira Square.<ref name= ET11/> The protesters tried to block traffic near the plaza for about an hour and were then dispersed by the National Police with tear gas.<ref name= ET11/> * '''12 May''' - Groups of workers of the Caracas Metro marched to the Supreme Court denouncing attacks on infrastructure and asking for an investigation of the governor of Miranda, Henrique Capriles, due to damages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Escueta marcha oficialista llegó al TSJ (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/12/trabajadores-del-metro-marcharan-hasta-fiscalia-para-solicitar-investigacion-contra-capriles/|accessdate=13 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=12 May 2014}}</ref> In the Las Mercedes municipality of Caracas, protesters and government authorities clashed.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fuerte represión y detenidos en Las Mercedes (fotos exclusivas)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/12/fuerte-represion-y-detenidos-en-las-mercedes-fotos-exclusivas/|accessdate=13 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=12 May 2014}}</ref> It was estimated that 8 students were arrested during the clashes including the son of the pro-government governor [[Ramón Rodríguez Chacín]], who was freed minutes later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detenido en protestas de Las Mercedes hijo del gobernador de Guárico |url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/detenido-en-protestas-de-las-mercedes-hijo-del-gob.aspx |accessdate=13 May 2014 |newspaper=Ultimas Noticias |date=12 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140513184055/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/detenido-en-protestas-de-las-mercedes-hijo-del-gob.aspx |archivedate=May 13, 2014 }}</ref> * '''13 May''' - There were several demonstrations in at least three different colleges, including the University of Santa Maria in Mariches that was closed due to protests, the National Experimental University of Táchira and the Pedagogical University Experimental Libertador Rubio where tear gas was reportedly used.<ref>{{cite news|title=Persisten protestas de estudiantes|url=http://www.elperiodiquito.com/article/153343/Persisten-protestas-de-estudiantes|accessdate=13 May 2014|newspaper=El Periodiquito|date=13 May 2014}}</ref> * '''14 May''' - Hundreds of students marched in Caracas peacefully asking for the release of students and denouncing the disassembly of camps.<ref name=Milenio14MAY>{{cite news|title=Decenas de detenciones tras protesta estudiantil en Venezuela|url=http://www.milenio.com/internacional/Decenas-detenciones-protesta-estudiantil-Venezuela_0_298770379.html|accessdate=15 May 2014|newspaper=Milenio|date=14 May 2014}}</ref> However, some protesters left the march creating clashes with security forces that resulted in approximately 80 arrests.<ref name=Milenio14MAY/><ref name=LP14MAY>{{cite news|title=Al menos 80 jóvenes detenidos por la GNB en la Av. Francisco de Miranda (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/14/gnb-detiene-a-jovenes-que-manifestaban-en-la-avenida-francisco-de-miranda-foto/|accessdate=15 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=14 May 2014}}</ref> A group of reporters covering the incident said they were assaulted by the National Guard after Guardsmen fired at them and attempted to arrest a reporter.<ref name=reporters14may>{{cite news|title=Múltiples agresiones contra reporteros: Tres heridas por perdigón y un intento de detención (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/14/tres-periodistas-heridas-de-perdigones-por-la-gnb-fotos/|accessdate=15 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=14 May 2014}}</ref> One National Guardsmen was injured after he was hit by a bus carrying arrested protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB herido fue pisado por camión de la GNB (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/14/gnb-resulta-herido-durante-represion-en-los-palos-grandes-fotos/|accessdate=15 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=14 May 2014}}</ref> * '''15 May''' - Protests occurred at Terrazas del Avila in Sucre.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en Terrazas del Ávila este #15M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/protesta-en-terrazas-del-avila-este-15m/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref> Several boxes were placed outside of the Justice of Carabobo and the prosecutors office in Margarita in protest against unresolved court cases.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta contra la impunidad en la fiscalía de Valencia (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/protesta-contra-la-impunidad-en-la-fiscalia-de-valencia-fotos/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=También protestan contra la impunidad en la fiscalía de Margarita (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/tambien-protestan-contra-la-impunidad-en-la-fiscalia-de-margarita-fotos/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref> At the Central University of Venezuela, the schools of Mechanical Engineering, Law, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Pharmacy and Bioanalysis were closed after students refused to attend classes in protest against the arrest of demonstrators the previous day.<ref>{{cite news|title=El "Pupitrazo" se apoderó de la UCV (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/el-pupitrazo-se-apodero-de-la-ucv-fotos/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref> Students also protested against the arrests of students at the University of Los Andes in Tachira, Simon Bolivar University and the Metropolitan University in Chacao.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta de estudiantes en la ULA de Táchira (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/protesta-de-estudiantes-en-la-ula-de-tachira-fotos/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta a las afueras de la USB, piden liberación de estudiantes #15M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/reportan-protesta-a-las-afueras-de-la-usb/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Pupitrazo en la Unimet como protesta por estudiantes detenidos #15M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/pupitrazo-en-la-unimet-como-protesta-por-estudiantes-detenidos-15m-foto/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref> A bridge was closed by groups that were protesting against the lack of water and food.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerrado el paso en puente que comunica Barinas con Táchira (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/15/cerrado-el-paso-en-puente-que-comunica-barinas-con-tachira-foto/|accessdate=16 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=15 May 2014}}</ref> * '''16 May''' - Some classes at Central University of Venezuela remained empty as students denounced the arrests of hundreds of protesters from the previous day.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pancartas en la UCV: Los salones están vacíos porque los estudiantes están presos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/16/pancartas-en-la-ucv-los-salones-estan-vacios-porque-los-estudiantes-estan-presos-fotos/|accessdate=17 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=16 May 2014}}</ref> In Isabelica, citizens protested against the lack of water, no electricity and due to trash being left in the streets for several days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en la Isabelica por falta de agua (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/16/protesta-en-la-isabelica-por-falta-de-agua-fotos/|accessdate=17 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=16 May 2014}}</ref> Students gathered at the plaza of University Rafael Belloso Chacin after four days of cancelled classes due to protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes se concentran en la plazoleta de la Urbe este #16M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/16/estudiantes-se-concentran-en-la-plazoleta-de-la-urbe-este-16m-fotos/|accessdate=17 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=16 May 2014}}</ref> Groups of hooded individuals also attacked a bus at the University Rafael Belloso Chacin.<ref>{{cite news|title=Encapuchados toman autobús frente a Urbe este #16M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/16/encapuchados-toman-autobus-frente-a-urbe-este-16m-fotos/|accessdate=17 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=16 May 2014}}</ref> * '''17 May''' - The Federation of Associations of Venezuela (FAPUV) called on all teachers to hold a national strike on 22 May with the president of the Association of Teachers of the Central University of Venezuela, Victor Marquez, saying "While the boys are in the streets protesting and arrested, the university seems pretending to operate as if absolutely nothing happening".<ref>{{cite news|title=Profesores convocan a paro nacional de universidades|url=http://www.laverdad.com/zulia/52449-profesores-convocan-a-paro-nacional-de-universidades.html|accessdate=18 May 2014|newspaper=La Verdad|date=17 May 2014}}</ref> A group of more than 220 former officers of the Institutional Military Front criticized the MUD for having dialogue with the government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Militares retirados instan a MUD a respaldar la protesta en Venezuela|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/81371/militares-retirados-instan-a-mud-a-respaldar-la-protesta-en-venezuela|accessdate=18 May 2014|newspaper=El Carabobeno|date=17 May 2014}}</ref> * '''18 May''' - Residents of Petare protested against the lack of water.<ref>{{cite news|title=Petare protestó este #18M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/18/petare-protesto-este-18m/|accessdate=19 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=18 May 2014}}</ref> In Caracas, a march was held in support of the Venezuelan LGBT communities.<ref>{{cite news|title=La marcha contra la homofobia llenó de color a Caracas (Video exclusivo)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/18/la-marcha-contra-la-homofobia-lleno-de-color-a-caracas-video-exclusivo/|accessdate=19 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=18 May 2014}}</ref> * '''19 May''' - Prados del Este highway was congested for hours until the National Guard removed protesters and a barricade.<ref>{{cite news|title=Autopista Prados del Este fue trancada con barricadas este #19M(Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/19/barricadas-en-la-autopista-prados-del-este-fotos/|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> A group of mothers effected from the protests created a group called the ''Venezuelan Mothers Front''.<ref>{{cite news|title=Crean el Frente de Madres Venezolanas para exigir respeto a los DDHH|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/19/frente-de-madres-venezolanas-seguira-luchando-para-exigir-respeto-a-los-ddhh-manifiesto/|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> Protests returned to Lara state where demonstrators blocked streets and had clashes with the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=En fotos: GNB y manifestantes protagonizaron fuerte enfrentamiento en Valle Hondo|url=http://yoyopress.com/2014/05/19/en-fotos-gnb-y-manifestantes-protagonizaron-fuerte-enfrentamiento-en-valle-hondo/|accessdate=21 May 2014|newspaper=YoYo Press|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> A group of protesters blocked roads in Anzoategui state and burned a PDVSA truck.<ref>{{cite news|title=En Lechería los manifestantes trancaron las calles: denunciaron que una camioneta fue quemada|url=http://www.canalntn24.com/noticias/manifestantes-incendian-una-camioneta-de-pdvsa-en-lecheria-y-trancan-las-calles-132937|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=NTN24|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> Clashes occurred between protesters and the National Police in the Las Minitas neighborhood of Baruta.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arremetida de la PNB contra habitantes de Las Minitas en Baruta se intensifica (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/19/reportan-enfrentamientos-en-las-minitas-de-baruta-foto/|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> Neighbors of Las Minitas reported tear gas was fired near the position of children in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Denuncian que GNB arremete contra barrio Las Minitas y arrojan bombas lacrimógenas|url=http://www.ntn24.com/noticias/denuncian-que-gnb-arremete-contra-barrio-las-minitas-y-arrojan-bombas-lacrimogeno-132866|accessdate=20 May 2014|newspaper=NTN24|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> * '''20 May''' - Clashes occurred throughout the early morning in Pueblo Nuevo between citizens and soldiers with some fighting lasting for several hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hasta la madrugada de hoy la GNB lanzó bombas lacrimógenas en Pueblo Nuevo (Fotos) #20M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/20/hasta-la-madrugada-de-hoy-la-gnb-lanzo-bombas-lacrimogenas-en-pueblo-nuevo-fotos/|accessdate=21 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Militarizado Pueblo Nuevo tras enfrentamientos en la madrugada de este #20M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/20/militarizado-pueblo-nuevo-tras-enfrentamientos-en-la-madrugada-de-este-20m/|accessdate=21 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=20 May 2014}}</ref> * '''21 May''' - Coordinators of Movimiento Estudiantil denounced recent attacks on students with firearms saying that the only thing students are armed with are "notebooks and pencils".<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la UDO Bolívar condenan agresiones de la policía|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/21/movimiento-100-udistas-de-la-udo-bolivar-condenan-agresiones-de-la-policia/|accessdate=22 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=21 May 2014}}</ref> Families in the city of Barquisimeto in Lara state blocked roads while demanding water.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancan vías en Barquisimeto para exigir agua (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/21/trancan-vias-en-barquisimeto-para-exigir-agua-foto/|accessdate=22 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=21 May 2014}}</ref> Students of the University of Simor Bolivar blocked hallways by piling several desks and chairs at their entrances.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así amanecieron los salones en la USB #21M (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/21/asi-amanecieron-los-salones-en-la-usb-21m-foto/|accessdate=22 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=21 May 2014}}</ref> * '''22 May''' - Several universities held strikes due to the arrests of their students.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paro nacional de universidades fue acatado entre 85 y 90%|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/22/profesores-iniciaran-este-jueves-paro-nacional-de-universidades-de-24-horas/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 May 2014}}</ref> Citizens in multiple cities protested due to a lack of water or for having dirty water.<ref>{{cite news|title=#22M Por tercer día consecutivo comunidades de Barquisimeto protestan por falta de agua|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/22m-por-tercer-dia-consecutivo-comunidades-de-barquisimeto-protestan-por-falta-de-agua|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=El Impulso|date=22 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=En Valencia protestan por la escasez de agua|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/22/en-valencia-protestan-por-la-escasez-de-agua/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 May 2014}}</ref> Students protested in Maracaibo against the arrests of fellow students, insecurity and other problems the country was facing.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes tomaron las calles de Maracaibo pacíficamente (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/22/jovenes-toman-las-calles-de-maracaibo-pacificamente-fotos/|accessdate=25 May y lacrimógenas vs barricadas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/22/chacao-vuelve-a-despertar-perdigones-y-lacrimogenas-vs-barricadas/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 May
