Students of multiple universities marched to the public prosecutor in Tachira demanding the release of fellow students.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes marcharon hasta la Fiscalía exigiendo la libertad plena de sus compañeros |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/regional/estudiantes-marcharon-hasta-la-fiscalia-exigiendo-la-libertad-plena-de-sus-companeros/ |accessdate=25 May 2014 |newspaper=La videos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/23/trabajadores-de-agencias-de-viaje-protestaran-este-viernes/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=22 May 2014}}</ref> Employees of the #23M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/23/empleados-de-la-mision-vivienda-protestan-por-falta-de-pagos-en-las-mayas-23m/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=23 May 2014}}</ref> Traders in San Pedro protested against the insecurity in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comerciantes de San Pedro de los Altos manifiestan contra la inseguridad #23M|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/23/comerciantes-de-san-pedro-de-los-altos-protestan-contra-la-inseguridad-24m/|accessdate=25 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=23 May 2014}}</ref> * husbands.<ref>{{cite news|title=Esposas de los dos alcaldes presos por protestas en Venezuela ganan Iutirla #26M (Foto)|last = |first = |date = 26 May 2014|work = |accessdate = |publisher = La Patilla}}</ref> Students of UNIMET blocked traffic on Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho Highway while protesting.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/26/protestantes-cierran-distribuidor-metropolitano-26m-fotos/|title = Manifestantes cierran el Distribuidor Metropolitano #26M (Fotos)|last = |first = |date = 26 May 2014|work = |accessdate = |publisher = La Patilla}}</ref> * '''27 May''' - Citizens who bought subsidized food from a Mercal store in Barquisimeto protested after they were locked out of the store due to shortages.<ref>{{cite news|title=#27M Protestan frente a Mercal de Patarata (Fotos)|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/27m-protestan-frente-a-mercal-de-patarata-fotos#|accessdate=28 May 2014|newspaper=El Impulso|date=27 May 2014}}</ref> 11 former military members were arrested in front of Miraflores Palace.<ref>{{cite news|title=11 exmilitares detenidos tras protesta frente a Miraflores|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/82029/11-exmilitares-detenidos-tras-protesta-frente-a-miraflores-|accessdate=28 May 2014|newspaper=El Carabobeno|date=27 May 2014}}</ref> Protests occurred in Altamira where demonstrators blocked traffic on Luis Roche Avenue with barricades.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reaparecen las barricadas en Altamira #27M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/27/reaparecen-las-barricadas-en-altamira-27m-fotos/|accessdate=28 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=27 May 2014}}</ref> * '''28 May''' - Students of the Catholic University of Táchira (UCAT) held early morning protests against various issues the country was facing which then led to clashes with the police and the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fuerte represión en la Ucat dejó jóvenes heridos y detenciones #28M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/28/reportan-enfrentamientos-entre-la-pnb-y-estudiantes-de-la-ucat-fotos/|accessdate=29 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 May 2014}}</ref> Citizens of Barquisimeto held a peaceful march titled "Lara in the street" while protesting against repression, arrests and other problems in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Larenses tomaron las calles este #28M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/28/larenses-tomaron-las-calles-este-28m-fotos/|accessdate=29 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=28 May 2014}}</ref> * '''29 May''' - Motorists protested in Los Teques against the insecurities they faced, blocking the Panamerican pass.<ref>{{cite news|title=Motorizados protestan por la inseguridad en la Panamericana|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/29/motorizados-trancan-el-paso-en-la-panamericana/|accessdate=30 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 May 2014}}</ref> Students from University College of Los Teques Cecilio Acosta (CULTCA) protested due to the poor quality of food being served to them rotten or had worms and cockroaches in it.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes protestaron porque les sirven comida con cucarachas #29M (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/29/estudiantes-protestaron-en-las-aceras-de-la-panamericana-29m-foto/|accessdate=30 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=29 May 2014}}</ref> Four people were arrested in Santa Fe after police dispersed a protest and removed debris blocking a road.<ref name=VAD3100>{{cite news|title=Al menos cuatro detenidos en protesta en Santa Fe (+Tuits +Fotos)|url=http://www.venezuelaaldia.com/2014/05/manifestantes-trancan-la-autopista-de-prados-del-este-tuits-fotos/|accessdate=30 May 2014|newspaper=Venezuela Al Dia|date=29 May 2014}}</ref> Protests occurred at the Catholic University of Táchira which led to clashes that injured 5 after high school students stole a bus.<ref name=EU29May>{{cite news|last=Evellyn Arráiz|first=Lorena|title=Protestas encienden a San Cristóbal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140529/protestas-encienden-a-san-cristobal|accessdate=30 May 2014|newspaper=El Universal|date=29 May 2014}}</ref> Protest leaders later denounced the theft saying the act "should not distort and the protest should be peaceful".<ref name=EU29May/> * '''30 May''' - In the morning hours, three buses blocked traffic outside of the University of Carabobo while protesting against insecurities in the country.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancan con autobuses la Universidad de Carabobo por inseguridad (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/30/autobuses-trancan-la-universidad-de-carabobo-por-inseguridad-fotos/|accessdate=31 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=30 May 2014}}</ref> Citizens in Valencia near the Camoruco mall protested against Resolution 058.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pancartazo y volanteo en la avenida Bolívar de Valencia (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/30/pancartazo-y-volanteo-en-la-avenida-bolivar-de-valencia-fotos/|accessdate=31 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=30 May 2014}}</ref> Students at National Experimental University of Tachira (UNET) and police clashed which resulted in the students creating a large barricade to defend themselves.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la Unet arman mega barricada ante incesante ataque (FOTO)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/30/estudiantes-de-la-unet-arman-mega-barricada-ante-incesante-ataque-foto/|accessdate=31 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=30 May 2014}}</ref> * '''31 May''' - Various universities in Venezuela rescheduled academic events in order to help students that were affected by the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Universidades reprograman lapsos académicos tras meses de protestas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/05/31/universidades-reprograman-lapsos-academicos-tras-meses-de-protestas/|accessdate=31 May 2014|newspaper=La Patilla|date=31 May 2014}}</ref>
==June== [[File:1 June 2014 Venezuelan protests.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protesters painted black and chained while demonstrating during the "March of the Brave" on 1 June.]] [[File:June 2014 Venezuelan protests.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Protesters denouncing the arrests of fellow protesters and Leopoldo Lopez.]] [[File:24 June 2014 Venezuelan protest.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Groups of protesters during the "March for Independence" on 24 June.]] [[File:24 June 2014 Maria Corina Machado Movimiento Estudiantil shirt.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Maria Corina Machado putting on a [[Movimiento Estudiantil (Venezuela)|Movimiento Estudiantil]] shirt during the 24 June rally.]] [[File:24 June 2014 Venezuelan protests Mavinia Jiménez.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|[[Marvinia Jiménez]], a woman who was beaten by Venezuelan police officers, speaks at the 24 June rally.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fotos: así reprime la policía de Venezuela|url=http://www.infobae.com/2014/03/15/1550321-fotos-asi-reprime-la-policia-venezuela|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=Infobae|date=15 March 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Unarmed woman beaten by National Guard in Venezuela|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/video/unarmed-woman-beaten-by-national-guard-in-venezuela/3265806198001|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=USA Today}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=GNB que golpeó brutalmente a Marvinia Jiménez sigue libre|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/03/14/gnb-que-golpeo-brutalmente-a-marvinia-jimenez-se-encuentra-libre/|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 March 2014}}</ref>]] [[File:24 June 2014 Venezuelan protests GNB.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Venezuelan National Guard mobilizing to disperse the 24 June "March for Independence" rally.]] * '''1 June''' - The ''March of the Brave'', a march organized by Movimiento Estudiantil, occurred in Caracas where Venezuelans denounced insecurity, shortages and demanded the release of political prisoners.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes encabezan marcha en Caracas|url=http://www.voanoticias.com/content/venezuela_estudiante_marcha/1926971.html|accessdate=1 June 2014|agency=Voz de America|date=1 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes marchan y exigen liberar a Simonovis y a jóvenes detenidos|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140601/estudiantes-marchan-y-exigen-liberar-a-simonovis-y-a-jovenes-detenidos|accessdate=1 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=1 June 2014}}</ref> Protesters then marched to Alfredo Sadel Square in Las Mercedes announcing they would stay in the square for 12 hours and said they would be [[fasting]] for another 15 hours.<ref>{{cite news|last1=VÁSQUEZ S.|first1=ALEX|title=Estudiantes se mantendrán en resistencia en la plaza Alfredo Sadel|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Estudiantes-mantendran-resistencia-Alfredo-Sadel_0_419958059.html#.U4uWwtGwqYk.twitter|accessdate=2 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=1 June 2014}}</ref> * '''2 June''' - Residents in Baruta protested against dirty drinking water and demanded Hidrocapital to come fix it.<ref>{{cite news|title=No hay paso en El Peñón por protesta|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/02/no-hay-paso-en-el-penon-por-protesta/|accessdate=3 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 June 2014}}</ref> Students from the Catholic University of Táchira (UCAT) and National Experimental University of Táchira protested against the arrests of protesters and made two dump trucks spill their contents in the road in order to block traffic.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Evelyn Arráiz|first1=Lorraine|title=Estudiantes de la UCAT y la UNET protestan en San Cristóbal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140602/estudiantes-de-la-ucat-y-la-unet-protestan-en-san-cristobal|accessdate=3 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=2 June 2014}}</ref> Several of the students from UCAT were injured after clashes with security forces that used tear gas and buckshot to disperse protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Interminable enfrentamiento en la Ucat deja varios heridos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/02/fuertes-enfrentamientos-en-la-ucat-este-2j-fotos/|accessdate=3 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 June 2014}}</ref> Students from the University of Fermín Toro Barquisimeto protested against attacks that burned the school on 5 May by blocking nearby traffic.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la UFT toman las calles de Barquisimeto para protestar contra las agresiones a su institución|url=http://www.canalntn24.com/noticias/estudiantes-de-la-uft-toman-las-calles-de-barquisimeto-para-protestar-contra-las-agresiones-su-134588|accessdate=3 June 2014|agency=NTN24|date=2 June 2014}}</ref> In Lara, three were injured and several were arrested after clashes between citizens and security forces occurred from the afternoon of 2 June to the early morning hours of 3 June.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Prato|first1=Marla|title=Tres heridos y un detenido durante manifestaciones en Lara|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140603/tres-heridos-y-un-detenido-durante-manifestaciones-en-lara|accessdate=3 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=3 June 2014}}</ref> * '''3 June''' - In Valencia, protesters blocked a freeway with burning tires due to high levels of insecurity and because of the recent lack of water in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestas por agua e inseguridad trancan autopista del este en Valencia|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140603/protestas-por-agua-e-inseguridad-trancan-autopista-del-este-en-valenci|accessdate=4 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=3 June 2014}}</ref> Clashes between the Metropolitan University and the National Police closed the Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho Highway and resulted in some fires from the use of tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerrada la autopista GMA tras represión de la PNB contra estudiantes de la Unimet (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/03/cerrada-la-autopista-gma-tras-represion-de-la-pnb-contra-estudiantes-de-la-unimet-fotos/|accessdate=4 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 June 2014}}</ref> President Nicolas Maduro said on his talk show that the MUD had ceased dialogue concerning the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro: La MUD acabó con el diálogo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/03/maduro-la-mud-acabo-con-el-dialogo/|accessdate=4 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 June 2014}}</ref> President Maduro also made claims that the United States and the Venezuelan opposition had plans to assassinate him saying Maria Corina Machado was involved, called her a "killer", and said that there was evidence from emails that he "did not want to publicly display".<ref name=EUassassination>{{cite news|title=Maduro ofrece entregar pruebas a EEUU sobre supuesto plan magnicida|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140603/maduro-ofrece-entregar-pruebas-a-eeuu-sobre-supuesto-plan-magnicida|accessdate=4 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=3 June 2014}}</ref> * '''4 June''' - Students from Metropolitan University and Santa María University held protests that resulted in clashes with the government that left 2 arrested and 5 injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Dos detenidos y cinco heridos por protesta en Terrazas del Ávila|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140604/dos-detenidos-y-cinco-heridos-por-protesta-en-terrazas-del-avila|accessdate=5 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=4 June 2014}}</ref> Protesters near the National Experimental University of Tachira burned a bus during demonstrations and were later dispersed by the National Guard with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Quemaron autobús cerca de la Unet este #4J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/04/quemaron-autobus-cerca-de-la-unet-como-medida-de-protesta-4j-fotos/|accessdate=5 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=4 June 2014}}</ref> * '''5 June''' - Judge Adriana Lopez decided that Leopoldo Lopez would face trial in August after being convicted of causing violence on 12 February 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela: Leopoldo Lopez must stand trial, judge rules|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-27715622|accessdate=6 June 2014|agency=BBC|date=5 June 2014}}</ref> Residents of Tocuyo protested due to the lack of domestic gas and because of bad tasting water.<ref>{{cite news|title=En El Tocuyo protestaron por falta de gas doméstico|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/5j-cierran-via-a-el-tocuyo-por-falta-de-gas-domestico|accessdate=6 June 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=5 June 2014}}</ref> * '''6 June''' - Protests due to complications with utilities occurred in Maracay due to blackouts and in Caracas against the state-run water company, Hidrocapital, because residents had no water.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta por falta de luz genera fuerte cola en Turmero (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/06/protesta-por-falta-de-luz-genera-fuerte-cola-en-turmero-foto/|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan frente a Hidrocapital en la carretera Petare-Santa Lucía (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/06/protestan-frente-a-hidrocapital-en-la-carretera-petare-santa-lucia-fotos/|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 June 2014}}</ref> Residents of Caracas protested against the Ministry of Tourism (MINTUR) due to the costs of air fare.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan frente a Mintur este #6J (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/06/protestan-frente-a-mintur-este-6j-foto/|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 June 2014}}</ref> At a gathering titled ''Media Conspiracy Against Venezuela'', Vice President Jorge Arreaza said the Venezuelan government beat a "media coup", accusing the media of plans "to launch a coup" saying that it was "very well orchestrated" and that it was to be followed by an "invasion and imperialist armed intervention in Venezuela".<ref name=WeBeatTheMediaCoup>{{cite news|title=Arreaza: Vencimos el golpe de Estado mediático contra Venezuela|url=http://www.avn.info.ve/contenido/arreaza-vencimos-golpe-estado-medi%C3%A1tico-contra-venezuela|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=AVN|date=6 June 2014}}</ref><ref name=INFOBAEmediacoup>{{cite news|title=Insólita denuncia chavista: "Orquestaron un golpe desde los Oscar"|url=http://www.infobae.com/2014/06/07/1570949-insolita-denuncia-chavista-orquestaron-un-golpe-los-oscar|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=Infobae|date=7 June 2014}}</ref> * '''7 June''' - A leader from Popular Will, Freddy Guevara, asked Venezuelans across the country to protest for the release of Leopoldo Lopez, saying "Sunday will draw a new stage of the struggle of resistance, a path that has always been democratic."<ref name=VDAjune7/> [[COPEI]] announced that they were seeking in every state of Venezuela, in various places in the United States, Colombia, Panama and Spain, to collect 1 million signatures to send to Pope Francis in petition to release political prisoners and to stop student repression.<ref name=VDAjune7>{{cite news|last1=Alcalde|first1=Carolina|title=Marchas el domingo por la liberación de López|url=http://www.voanoticias.com/content/convocatoria-marchas-liberaci%C3%B3n-leopoldo-l%C3%B3pez-venezuela/1930991.html|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=Voz de America|date=7 June 2014}}</ref> María Corina Machado also asked for protests for the following day saying it was time to enter a "second stage in the path of freedom".<ref>{{cite news|title=María Corina Machado llama a definir este domingo "la ruta a la liberación de Venezuela"|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/07/maria-corina-machado-llama-a-definir-este-domingo-la-ruta-a-la-liberacion-de-venezuela/|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 June 2014}}</ref> * '''8 June''' - Thousands of Venezuelans led by Popular Will peacefully gathered at Brión Plaza in Caracas protesting against Leopoldo Lopez's detention along with student arrests, demanded President Maduro's resignation and called for an early presidential election.<ref>{{cite news|title=Concentración opositora en Plaza Brión de Chacaíto|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140608/concentracion-opositora-en-plaza-brion-de-chacaito|accessdate=9 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=8 June 2014}}</ref><ref name=ABC8june/> Leaders of the student movement also announced that they would hold a demonstration on 24 June.<ref name=ABC8june>{{cite news|title=9 June 2014|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/venezuela-rally-supports-jailed-opposition-leader-24049731|accessdate=9 June 2014|agency=ABC News|date=8 June 2014}}</ref> * '''9 June''' - Multiple protests occurred due to the lack of water, with places like Saint Mary University, Caracas and Sucre all having demonstrations.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes trancan la entrada de la USM por falta de agua #9J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/09/estudiantes-trancan-la-entrada-de-la-usm-por-falta-de-agua-9j-fotos/|accessdate=10 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Motorizados protestan en Mariches por la escasez de agua|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/09/motorizados-protestan-en-mariches-por-la-escasez-de-agua/|accessdate=10 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Trujillo por falta de agua #9J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/09/protestan-en-trujillo-por-falta-de-agua-9j-fotos/|accessdate=10 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 June 2014}}</ref> Clashes between security forces and protesters in Maracaibo by a nearby school created anxiety among children and left several injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fuerte represión en Maracaibo este #9J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/09/fuerte-represion-en-maracaibo-este-9j-fotos/|accessdate=10 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 June 2014}}</ref> * '''10 June''' - Several individuals in a vehicle traveling past Fermín Toro University fired a tear gas canister into the campus causing panic which was then followed by students blocking the streets in protest and clashes with police that lasted for hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lanzaron bomba lacrimógena en la Universidad Fermín Toro|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140610/lanzaron-bomba-lacrimogena-en-la-universidad-fermin-toro|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=10 June 2014}}</ref> President Maduro stated that MUD did not respect the dialogue provided by UNASUR and the Catholic church.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro asegura que la Mesa de la Unidad se retiró del diálogo|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140610/maduro-asegura-que-la-mesa-de-la-unidad-se-retiro-del-dialogo|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=10 June 2014}}</ref> * '''11 June''' - Government workers at the Carabobo health ministry building protested near the facility demanding more benefits.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Insalud protesta por reivindicaciones laborales #11J (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/11/trabajadores-de-insalud-protesta-por-reivindicaciones-laborales-11j-foto/|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=11 June 2014}}</ref> Residents in Maturin protested for the improvement of public services; including better sewage, electricity and security services.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Maturín #11J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/11/protestan-en-maturin-11j-fotos/|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=11 June 2014}}</ref> * '''12 June''' - 12 were injured and classes were cancelled after a tear gas canister was placed into the university's air conditioning system which affected the entire facility.<ref>{{cite news|title=14 perjudicados por lacrimógenas en la Universidad Fermín Toro|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140612/14-perjudicados-por-lacrimogenas-en-la-universidad-fermin-toro|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=12 June 2014}}</ref> Students in Valencia blocked a highway while protesting and playing [[Football (soccer)|football]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta creativa: Trancan la autopista y se ponen a jugar fútbol #12J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/12/protesta-creativa-trancan-la-autopista-y-se-ponen-a-jugar-futbol-12j-fotos/|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 June 2014}}</ref> Students at Saint Mary University protested after the robbery and shooting of two of their fellow schoolmates.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en la USM tras tiroteo a dos estudiantes (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/12/protestas-en-la-usm-tras-tiroteo-a-dos-estudiantes-para-robarlos-fotos/|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 June 2014}}</ref> * '''13 June''' - Saint Mary University students continued protesting after the shooting of students there and placed desks facing the university's rectory demanding solutions to insecurity.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la USM protestan contra la inseguridad (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/13/estudiantes-de-la-usm-protestan-contra-la-inseguridad-fotos/|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=13 June 2014}}</ref> Students in Lagunillas began protests once more and blocked several streets in the area while demonstrating against government abuses.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes reactivan las protestas en Lagunillas|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140613/estudiantes-reactivan-las-protestas-en-lagunillas|accessdate=14 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=13 June 2014}}</ref> * '''14 June''' - Clashes occurred between students and security forces in [[Bolívar, Venezuela]] which resulted in the use of tear gas near a residential center.<ref>{{cite news|title=Con tanquetas y bombas lacrimógenas reprimen a estudiantes en Ciudad Bolívar (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/14/con-tanquetas-y-bombas-lacrimogenas-reprimen-a-estudiantes-en-ciudad-bolivar-fotos/|accessdate=15 June 2014|date=14 June 2014}}</ref> Groups of cyclists, some nude, rode the streets in Caracas in protest and resulted in one cyclist being arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB detuvo a una ciclista nudista que estaba en la plaza La Concordia|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/14/pnb-detuvo-a-una-ciclista-nudista-que-estaba-en-la-plaza-la-concordia/|accessdate=15 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 June 2014}}</ref> * '''15 June''' - More than 100 representatives from various social groups signed a manifest saying "yes there is a way out of the crisis" and demanded the resignation of President Nicolas Maduro saying, "only the people on the streets, exercising their legitimate right to peaceful protest will force those who now support the regime to accept a process truly democratic transition".<ref>{{cite news|title=Sectores sociales firman manifiesto para buscar salidas a crisis del país|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140615/sectores-sociales-firman-manifiesto-para-buscar-salidas-a-crisis-del-p|accessdate=17 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=15 June 2014}}</ref> * '''16 June''' - Students at St. Mary's University protested against insecurity due to the constant thefts occurring on their campus.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pupitrazo por la inseguridad toma las facultades de la USM #16J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/16/usm-protesta-con-pupitrazo-16j-fotos/|accessdate=17 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=16 June 2014}}</ref> In Valencia, parents protested against the education Resolution 058.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padres protestan: No a la colección Bicentenaria #16J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/16/padres-protestan-no-a-la-coleccion-bicentenaria/|accessdate=17 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=16 June 2014}}</ref> Students from the Catholic University of Tachira gathered outside of the Governor of Tachira's home.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la Ucat a las afueras de la casa del gobernador (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/16/estudiantes-de-la-ucat-a-las-afueras-de-la-casa-del-gobernador-foto/|accessdate=17 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=16 June 2014}}</ref> * '''17 June''' - President Maduro confirmed his willingness to resume dialogue with the opposition.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.noticias24.com/venezuela/noticia/243541/ratifica-su-disposicion-al-dialogo-con-la-mud-ahi-esta-su-sillita-vacia-para-que-se-sienten/ | title=Ratifica su disposición al diálogo con la MUD: "Ahí está su sillita vacía para que se sienten" | publisher=Noticias24.com | date=17 June 2014 | accessdate=19 June 2014}}</ref> * '''18 June''' - María Corina Machado was prohibited from leaving the country due to investigations being performed by the government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tribunal dicta prohibición de salida del país a María Corina Machado|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140618/tribunal-dicta-prohibicion-de-salida-del-pais-a-maria-corina-machado|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=18 June 2014}}</ref> President of the Student Center of Santa Rosa Catholic University, Eusebio Costa, sent a request to the United Nations in Switzerland, stating that the students were "confident" that their rights were violated and asked the United Nations "not be indifferent to what is happening in Venezuela".<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes piden a la ONU una misión de investigación|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140618/estudiantes-piden-a-la-onu-una-mision-de-investigacion|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=18 June 2014}}</ref> At [[Maiquetia Airport]], workers protested, demanding a new collective agreement after alleged harassments and threats.<ref>{{cite news|title=Por acoso laboral trabajadores aeroportuarios suspenden protesta|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140618/por-acoso-laboral-trabajadores-aeroportuarios-suspenden-protesta|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=18 June 2014}}</ref> * '''19 June''' - Students gathered outside of the Venezuelan headquarters of United Nations Program for Development demanding a copy of security footage of the dismantling of the protester camp that was in front of the headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes exigen videos de desmontaje de campamento en Chacao|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140619/estudiantes-exigen-videos-de-desmontaje-de-campamento-en-chacao|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=19 June 2014}}</ref> Students announced a march scheduled for 24 June in order to demand "freedom" for Venezuelans.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes marcharán el 24 de junio|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140619/estudiantes-marcharan-el-24-de-junio|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=19 June 2014}}</ref> * '''20 June''' - 5 protesters were arrested by the National Guard while demonstrating outside of the Catholic University of Táchira.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detuvieron a cinco jóvenes por protestar en Táchira|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140620/detuvieron-a-cinco-jovenes-por-protestar-en-tachira|accessdate=20 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=19 June 2014}}</ref> National Guardsmen dispersed students who gathered in front of the United Nations Program for Development headquarters the previous day.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB desaloja a estudiantes que protestaban frente al PNUD|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140620/gnb-desaloja-a-estudiantes-que-protestaban-frente-al-pnud|accessdate=22 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=20 June 2014}}</ref> Corpoelec workers of Puerto Ordaz in Bolívar state protested on Guayana Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta de trabajadores en Puerto Ordaz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/20/protesta-de-trabajadores-en-cvg-guayana/|accessdate=22 June 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 June 2014}}</ref> * '''21 June''' - Josué Farías, an accounting student from University Rafael Belloso Chacin, died of respiratory failure from injuries he sustained on 29 May during a protest in Zulia.<ref>{{cite news|title=Falleció estudiante Josué Farías herido durante protestas en el Zulia|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140621/fallecio-estudiante-josue-farias-herido-durante-protestas-en-el-zulia|accessdate=22 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=21 June 2014}}</ref> 15 Youth National Organization members began their "permanent fasting" after rejecting the position of the United Nations in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes se declaran en "ayuno permanente" en la iglesia La Chiquinquirá|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140621/jovenes-se-declaran-en-ayuno-permanente-en-la-iglesia-la-chiquinquira|accessdate=22 June 2014|agency=El Universal|date=21 June 2014}}</ref> * '''22 June''' - Hacker group Anonymous Venezuela hacked CANTV's website after several cities could not receive telephone and internet service.<ref>{{cite news|title=Grupos ANONYMOUS de Venezuela se adjudican bloqueo a la fibra principal y Hackeo de la pagina web de CANTV |url=http://infovzla.net/2014/06/22/grupos-anonymous-de-venezuela-se-adjudican-bloqueo-a-la-fibra-principal-y-hackeo-de-la-pagina-web-de-cantv/ |accessdate=1 July 2014 |agency=Infovzla |date=22 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140625092113/http://infovzla.net/2014/06/22/grupos-anonymous-de-venezuela-se-adjudican-bloqueo-a-la-fibra-principal-y-hackeo-de-la-pagina-web-de-cantv/ |archivedate=June 25, 2014 }}</ref> Coordinator of Popular Will, [[Carlos Vecchio]], said that he had shown evidence to the United Nations alleged human rights violations, saying that "there must be a support of the international community, especially when violations occur human rights. No country can be oblivious to what is happening there".<ref>{{cite news|title=Vecchio presentó pruebas de violación de los derechos humanos ante la ONU |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/vecchio-presento-pruebas-de-violacion-de-los-derechos-humanos-ante-la-onu/ |accessdate=1 July 2014 |agency=La Nacion |date=22 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714180115/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/vecchio-presento-pruebas-de-violacion-de-los-derechos-humanos-ante-la-onu/ |archivedate=July 14, 2014 }}</ref> Opposition leaders were allegedly banned from flying on [[Conviasa]] flights in Venezuela due to "orders from Caracas".<ref>{{cite news|title=Al diputado Andrés Velásquez no lo dejaron viajar en Conviasa|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/politica/al-diputado-andres-velasquez-no-lo-dejaron-viajar-.aspx|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=Ultimas Noticias|date=22 June 2014}}</ref> * '''23 June''' - Lilian Tintori stated in an interview with Chilean newspaper ''[[La Tercera]]'' that there is a struggle between good and evil in Venezuela, and that she thinks her husband Leopoldo Lopez will be released "soon" because there is not proof he had done nothing wrong.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lilian Tintori: En Venezuela hay una lucha entre el bien y el mal|url=http://informe21.com/politica/lilian-tintori-en-venezuela-hay-una-lucha-entre-el-bien-y-el-mal|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=Informe 21|date=23 June 2014}}</ref> * '''24 June''' - Students from 14 states in Venezuela protested simultaneously on the 193rd anniversary of the [[Battle of Carabobo]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de 14 estados marcharán por la unidad nacional|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140623/estudiantes-de-14-estados-marcharan-por-la-unidad-nacional|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=23 June 2014}}</ref> In Valencia, 20 people were injured by the Carabobo police and the National Guard who were firing pellets and tear gas at peaceful protesters which resulted in some individuals retaliating by placing garbage into the streets in order to block them.<ref>{{cite news|title=Represión a protestas pacíficas deja más de 20 heridos en Venezuela|url=http://www.elnuevoherald.com/2014/06/25/1782777/represion-de-protestas-pacificas.html|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Nuevo Herald|date=25 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Rodriguez|first1=Marianela|title=20 heridos deja represión de marcha en Valencia|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140624/20-heridos-deja-represion-de-marcha-en-valencia|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=24 June 2014}}</ref> In Anzoategui, more than 25 peaceful protesters were arrested while returning home.<ref>{{cite news|title=En Anzoátegui fueron detenidas más de 25 manifestantes|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140624/en-anzoategui-fueron-detenidas-mas-de-25-manifestantes|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=24 June 2014}}</ref> In Mérida, University of Los Andes students protested against what they called a Cuban "colonization" saying "Venezuela is still a colony of the Cuban government, we are slaves of insecurity, scarcity of inflation and all the problems that beset us every day to all Venezuelans".<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de ULA protestaron contra la "colonización" cubana|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140624/estudiantes-de-ula-protestaron-contra-la-colonizacion-cubana|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=24 June 2014}}</ref> Students of the Catholic University of Tachira began a hunger strike asking for freedom of students who were arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes en Táchira realizan huelga de hambre por libertad de compañeros|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140624/estudiantes-en-tachira-realizan-huelga-de-hambre-por-libertad-de-compa|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=24 June 2014}}</ref> * '''25 June''' - Students [[Lip sewing|sewed their mouths shut in protest]] due to student being arrested for protesting and to show the Venezuelan government that their "fasting is permanent, prolonged and serious".<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes se cosen la boca en protesta por el silencio de la justicia|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140625/jovenes-se-cosen-la-boca-en-protesta-por-el-silencio-de-la-justicia|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=25 June 2014}}</ref> * '''26 June''' - Movimiento Estudiantil of the Central University of Venezuela announced the movement titled ''Signatures for Freedom'' which would collect signatures to release hundreds of those in custody for protesting and to cease precautionary measures against another 2000 protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Movimiento Estudiantil UCV inicia el proyecto "Firmas por la Libertad"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/protestas-en-venezuela/140626/movimiento-estudiantil-ucv-inicia-el-proyecto-firmas-por-la-libertad|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=26 June 2014}}</ref> Neighborhood protests occurred in Barquisimeto due to a lack of water in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan por falta de agua en la vía Barquisimeto – Duaca #26J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/26/protestan-por-falta-de-agua-en-la-via-barquisimeto-duaca-26j-fotos/|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 June 2014}}</ref> * '''27 June''' - The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, [[Navi Pillay]], said she was concerned about the violation of rights and abuses in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=La ONU inquieta ante las denuncias de abusos en las protestas de Venezuela |url=http://www.elnuevoherald.com/2014/06/27/1785446/la-onu-inquieta-ante-las-denuncias.html |accessdate=1 July 2014 |agency=El Nuevo Herald |issue=27 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140630185229/http://www.elnuevoherald.com/2014/06/27/1785446/la-onu-inquieta-ante-las-denuncias.html |archivedate=June 30, 2014 }}</ref> * '''28 June''' - Executive Secretary of MUD, [[Ramon Guillermo Aveledo]], said that dialogue has not permanently ceased with the Venezuelan government, saying "We have frozen the dialogue because it has not produced the expected results".<ref>{{cite news|title=La oposición mantiene congelado y no clausurado diálogo con Maduro |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/la-oposicion-mantiene-congelado-y-no-clausurado-dialogo-con-maduro/ |accessdate=1 July 2014 |agency=Diario La Nacion |date=28 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714162542/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/la-oposicion-mantiene-congelado-y-no-clausurado-dialogo-con-maduro/ |archivedate=July 14, 2014 }}</ref> At Plaza Bolivar of San Cristóbal, the state governor, [[José Gregorio Vielma Mora]], held a meeting with the Battle Units Hugo Chávez, saying "we have to maintain the strength of the revolution, without allowing any internal division, especially in militancy of Tachira, where no one is disobedient, because the opposition is coming for us, because while the government builds, they destroy".<ref>{{cite news|title=No podemos permitir que le hagan daño a la revolución |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/politica/no-podemos-permitir-que-le-hagan-dano-a-la-revolucion/ |accessdate=1 July 2014 |agency=Diario La Nacion |date=28 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714221651/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/politica/no-podemos-permitir-que-le-hagan-dano-a-la-revolucion/ |archivedate=July 14, 2014 }}</ref> * '''29 June''' - Students at the Chiquinquirá Church continued their hunger strike after nine days of fasting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes se mantienen en huelga de hambre en la Iglesia Chiquinquirá (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/06/29/estudiantes-se-mantienen-en-en-huelga-de-hambre-en-la-iglesia-chiquinquira-foto/|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=29 June 2014}}</ref> * '''30 June''' - Students who continued to hunger strike in front of the Consulate of Colombia in San Cristobal asked the Congress of Colombian "not be complicit in the repression and violation of human rights in Venezuela".<ref>{{cite news|title=Exhortan al congreso colombiano a no "ser cómplice de la represión"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140630/exhortan-al-congreso-colombiano-a-no-ser-complice-de-la-represion|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=30 June 2014}}</ref>
==July== [[File:Ramo Verde Caravan 26 July 2014.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Caravan of citizens traveling to Ramo Verde on 26 July.]] [[File:26 July 2014 VP and supporters.jpg|250px|right|thumb|David Smolansky and Lilian Tintori, along with other supporters gathered at Ramo Verde.]] [[File:Protester 26 July 2014.jpg|250px|right|thumb|Protester at Ramo Verde on 26 July.]] [[File:Leopoldo Lopez father GNB.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Father of Leopoldo Lopez speaking with a member of the Bolivarian National Guard.]] * '''1 July''' - Protests near the former headquarters of Catholic University of Táchira resulted in the several students being injured and one being arrested by the National Police.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB reprime con lacrimógenas y perdigones a estudiantes de la Ucat #1Jul (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/01/pnb-reprime-con-lacrimogenas-y-perdigones-a-estudiantes-de-la-ucat-1jul-fotos/|accessdate=1 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 July 2014}}</ref> * '''2 July''' - A large group of merchants in Candelaria protested after a 77-year-old baker was killed after the community paid their 500 bolivar [[protection fees]] to the People's Guard for security.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comerciantes protestan nuevamente en Candelaria ante la falta de seguridad|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140702/comerciantes-protestan-nuevamente-en-candelaria-ante-la-falta-de-segur|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=2 July 2014}}</ref> Judicial sources announced that Leopoldo Lopez will face trial on 23 July.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fijan para el 23 de julio inicio del juicio contra Leopoldo López|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140702/fijan-para-el-23-de-julio-inicio-del-juicio-contra-leopoldo-lopez|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=2 July 2014}}</ref> Heavy clashes occurred between protesters and security forces in Tachira after protesters demonstrated against the murder and kidnapping of a young woman the previous night.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fuertes enfrentamientos en Ucat por joven brutalmente asesinada|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/02/fuertes-enfrentamientos-en-ucat-por-joven-brutalmente-asesinada/|accessdate=3 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 July 2014}}</ref> * '''3 July''' - Students of the Catholic University of Táchira and the Santiago Mariño Polytechnic Institute continued to protest after the kidnapping and murder that occurred the previous Sunday. Near Santiago Mariño Polytechnic Institute, students blocked roads with garbage which resulted with no escalation after police and protesters reached an agreement of a short protest that would not block roads. However near the Catholic University of Táchira, National Police forcibly repressed protesters there launching tear gas without notice in the streets and through windows which resulted in students retaliating with stone and Molotov cocktails. Between 20 and 30 injuries were reported and an NTN24 reporter was temporarily detained and allegedly beaten.<ref>{{cite news|title=Represión y heridos en la Ucat este #3Jul (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/03/estudiantes-de-la-ucat-protestan-por-el-brutal-asesinato-de-la-joven-barbara-vivas-fotos/|accessdate=4 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Bustos |first1=Miriam |title=Por el crimen de Bárbara Vivas estudiantes protestaron en el Santiago Mariño y la Ucat |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/sucesos/por-el-crimen-de-barbara-vivas-estudiantes-protestaron-en-el-santiago-marino-y-la-ucat/ |accessdate=4 July 2014 |agency=Diario La Nacion |date=4 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714144124/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/sucesos/por-el-crimen-de-barbara-vivas-estudiantes-protestaron-en-el-santiago-marino-y-la-ucat/ |archivedate=July 14, 2014 }}</ref> * '''4 July''' - Workers of the state-run Corpoelec protested due to collective agreement issues saying they are still owed pay from 2011 and demanded the Minister for Electricity, [[Jesse Chacón]], to deny that blackouts were due to sabotage.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Corpoelec a Chacón: "Ponga su cargo a la orden"|url=http://globovision.com/trabajadores-de-corpoelec-comienzan-a-concentrarse-en-la-andres-bello/|accessdate=4 July 2014|agency=Globovision|date=4 July 2014}}</ref> Protests occurred at the University of Carabobo where an entrance was closed in protest of the arrest of a student that was allegedly robbed and then arrested after he was robbed.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cierran entrada de Ingeniería UC: Exigen liberación de estudiante|url=http://el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/84752/cierran-entrada-de-ingeniera-uc-exigen-liberacin-de-estudiante|accessdate=4 July 2014|agency=El Carabobeno|date=4 July 2014}}</ref> * '''5 July''' - Student movements and the public commemorated 203 years since [[Venezuelan Declaration of Independence|Venezuela's independence]]. During a demonstration at the Plaza de la República, protesters symbolically washed a Venezuelan flag to represent a "renewal of the nation" and made statements about independence from Cuba. Following the demonstration, members of SEBIN arrested 17 protesters who complied with their orders due to "public offense to patriotic symbols".<ref>{{cite news|title=Sebin detiene a 17 jóvenes por lavar una bandera|url=http://www.laverdad.com/politica/55705-sebin-detiene-a-17-jovenes-por-lavar-una-bandera.html|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Verdad|date=6 July 2014}}</ref> Protesters near Terrazas del Avila blocked access to a road, preventing a PDVSA oil truck and resulted with the National Guard dispersing the protesters with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes trancaron acceso a Terrazas del Avila con gandola de Pdvsa (Fotos + Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/05/protesta-en-terrazas-del-avila-secuestran-gandola-de-pdvsa-fotos/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=5 July 2014}}</ref> * '''6 July''' - On the corner where Bassil Da Costa was shot, a memorial plaque was placed to remember Bassil Da Costa and Juancho Montoya, two of the first victims killed during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Colocaron placas en Tracabordo en honor a los caídos en Candelaria|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140706/colocaron-placas-en-tracabordo-en-honor-a-los-caidos-en-candelaria|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=6 July 2014}}</ref> 12 of the students arrested the previous day for washing a Venezuelan flag were released while 4 still remained in custody.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Albarran|first1=Veronica|title=Califican de "arbitrarias" las detenciones a jóvenes zulianos|url=http://www.laverdad.com/politica/55771-califican-de-arbitrarias-las-detenciones-a-jovenes-zulianos.html|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Verdad|date=7 July 2014}}</ref> * '''7 July''' - A large number of over a dozen students of the Venezuelan National Youth Organization who were having a [[hunger strike]] in a Chiquinquirá Catholic church stopped their fasting after 17 days, saying that intimidation from the National Guard and SEBIN, along with a siege of the church by paramilitary groups permitted by Venezuelan state authorities caused them to conclude their strike. However a few students continued their fasting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes levantan ayuno por "amedrentamiento" de funcionarios y colectivos|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140708/jovenes-levantan-ayuno-por-amedrentamiento-de-funcionarios-y-colectivo|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=8 July 2014}}</ref> Parents protested in Valencia against Resolution 058 calling it the "plan of the Fatherland".<ref>{{cite news|title=Padres volvieron a tomar las calles en rechazo al 058 #7Jul (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/07/padres-volvieron-a-tomar-la-calle-en-rechazo-del-058/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 July 2014}}</ref> Citizens of Simón Planas in Lara state protested against insecurity, saying that they had talked to government officials about the issue but the situation did not improve.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta por inseguridad en vía Barquisimeto-Acarigua|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/07/protesta-por-inseguridad-en-via-via-barquisimeto-acarigua/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 July 2014}}</ref> * '''8 July''' - A steel worker union involving workers of [[Sidor]] protested in Guyana due to the worst operating inefficiencies in its history. Workers blocked roads with buses with some catching accidentally catching on fire. The workers later apologized to the citizens in the area for any inconveniences during their protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=La protesta de los sidoristas madrugó a los guayaneses|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/08/la-protesta-de-los-sidoristas-madrugo-a-los-guayaneses/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=8 July 2014}}</ref> In Baruta, protesters barricaded Bello Monte Avenue while denouncing shortages and insecurity in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Barricadas en Colinas de Bello Monte obstruyen avenida principal de la zona|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140708/barricadas-en-colinas-de-bello-monte-obstruyen-avenida-principal-de-la|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=8 July 2014}}</ref> * '''9 July''' - Students in Mérida protested against insecurity, blocking Tulio Febres Cordero Avenue. This resulted in clashes with police using tear gas and rubber bullets near the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Los Andes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes protestaron en Mérida en contra de la inseguridad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/09/estudiantes-protestaron-en-merida-en-contra-de-la-inseguridad/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patlla|date=9 July 2014}}</ref> Andrés Bello Catholic University asked authorities to release students, saying that the demonstrations should not be punished since students should have freedom of expression and asked authorities to investigate allegations of torture and degradation.<ref>{{cite news|title=UCAB exige a las autoridades la liberación de los estudiantes detenidos|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140709/ucab-exige-a-las-autoridades-la-liberacion-de-los-estudiantes-detenido|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=9 July 2014}}</ref> * '''10 July''' - Protesters demonstrated in the Santa Fe neighborhood of Caracas, partially blocking the Prados del Este highway, placing trash and debris in three of the four lanes of the roadway. President Maduro stated that in east Caracas, makeshift weapons were found belonging to some protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes intentan retomar protestas en el este de Caracas|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140710/manifestantes-intentan-retomar-protestas-en-el-este-de-caracas|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=10 July 2014}}</ref> Residents of La Guaira in Vargas state protested against the lack of water in the area by blocking roads.<ref>{{cite news|title=La Guaira en la calle protestando por falta de agua (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/10/la-guaira-en-la-calle-protestando-por-falta-de-agua-fotos/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=10 July 2014}}</ref> [[Cacerolazo|Pot banging in protest]] could be heard from the poor, "pro-Chavez" barrio of 23 de Enero, denouncing more than 24 hours without electricity.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cacerolas retumban en el 23 de enero contra la falta de electricidad (dosis de patria)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/10/cacerolas-retumban-en-el-23-de-enero-contra-la-falta-de-electricidad-dosis-de-patria/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=10 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Así se ve el 23 de Enero recibiendo dosis de patria: 24 horas sin luz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/10/asi-se-ve-el-23-de-enero-recibiendo-dosis-de-patria-24-horas-sin-luz/|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=10 July 2014}}</ref> * '''11 July''' - Militant members of PSUV made statements demanding " radical change" from the Venezuelan government and criticized President Maduro, saying that it seems like he is "running out of answers" and is sometimes going "the wrong way".<ref>{{cite news|title=Rebelión en la militancia chavista: acusa a Maduro de "olvidar los problemas del pueblo"|url=http://www.infobae.com/2014/07/11/1579933-rebelion-la-militancia-chavista-acusa-maduro-olvidar-los-problemas-del-pueblo|accessdate=12 July 2014|agency=Infobae|date=11 July 2014}}</ref> * '''12 July''' - Residents of Barcelona in Anzoategui state protested by burning tires in roads, explaining that they were angry for not having electricity for at least 4 days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cerrada entrada y salida de Barcelona por quema de cauchos #12Jul (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/12/cerrada-entrada-y-salida-de-barcelona-por-quema-de-cauchos-12jul-fotos/|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 July 2014}}</ref> * '''13 July''' - Former Vice President of Venezuela and journalist for the Venezuelan government's news agency AVN, [[José Vicente Rangel]], warned government supporters of "terrorist attacks" occurring in mid-July, saying that the protests had left 42 dead, over 300 injured and 10 billion bolivares of damages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Los protestas regresarán a mediados de julio, según JVR|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/13/los-protestas-regresaran-a-mediados-de-julio-segun-jvr/|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=13 July 2014}}</ref> * '''14 July''' - Leader of MUD said that dialogue with the government would continue after the release of what he called were "political prisoners".<ref>{{cite news|title=Capriles: Liberar a los presos políticos es una condición para que se reanude el diálogo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/14/capriles-liberar-a-los-presos-politicos-es-una-condicion-para-que-se-reanude-el-dialogo/|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 July 2014}}</ref> María Corina Machado said that criminal proceedings were initiated against her by the government without her knowledge; with Machado being accused of public incitement during violent occurrences in February.<ref>{{cite news|title=Imputan delito de "instigación pública" a María Corina Machado por llamado a protesta|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/14/maria-corina-machado-imputada-de-instigacion-publica-por-llamado-a-protesta/|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 July 2014}}</ref> * '''15 July''' - On their 22nd consecutive day of fasting, Venezuelan National Youth Organization members continued their hunger strike still denouncing the arrests of fellow students, hoping they could conclude their protest on 12 August.<ref>{{cite news|title=Universitarios del Táchira levantaron la huelga de hambre|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140715/universitarios-del-tachira-levantaron-la-huelga-de-hambre|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=15 July 2014}}</ref> Clashes between students and authorities occurred in Mérida after protests against insecurity, economic problems and the name change of the state of Mérida to the "Bolivarian State of Merida". A student of medicine at the University of Los Andes was arrested after the protests and was allegedly "brutally beaten and badly wounded".<ref>{{cite news|title=Detenido estudiante en Mérida mientras protestaba|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140715/detenido-estudiante-en-merida-mientras-protestaba|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=15 July 2014}}</ref> * '''16 July''' - Trauma patients in Barcelona protested outside of a hospital saying their operations had been delayed for months after medical residents began a strike.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pacientes de traumatología protestan en la entrada del Razetti|url=http://eltiempo.com.ve/locales/barcelona/protesta/pacientes-de-traumatologia-protestan-en-la-entrada-del-razetti/147024|accessdate=16 July 2014|agency=El Tiempo|date=16 July 2014}}</ref> * '''17 July''' - After National Police tried to disperse a peaceful protest, clashes were generated between students of the National Experimental Universidad of Tachira and the police.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan enfrentamientos entre estudiantes de la Unet y PNB #17J (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/17/reportan-5-heridos-tras-enfrentamientos-entre-estudiantes-de-la-unet-y-pnb-17j/|accessdate=17 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=17 July 2014}}</ref> * '''18 July''' - In the early hours of the night, clashes occurred in Táchira between police and protesters which resulted in damages to nearby businesses, and dozens of burnt vehicles in a parking lot belonging to the police.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Evelyn Arráiz|first1=Lorraine|title=Disturbios e incendios durante la noche del jueves en el estado Táchira|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140718/disturbios-e-incendios-durante-la-noche-del-jueves-en-el-estado-tachir|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=18 July 2014}}</ref> Residents of Libertador protested on Antímano Avenue due to a lack of gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=En Antímano protestan por la falta de gas (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/18/en-antimano-protestan-por-la-falta-de-gas-foto/|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 July 2014}}</ref> Former workers of Sabenpe protested for the payment of their salaries on Petare-Santa Lucia Road, closing more than 1 km of road.<ref>{{cite news|title=Extrabajadores de Sabenpe cierran la Petare- Santa Lucía|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/18/extrabajadores-de-sabenpe-cierran-la-petare-santa-lucia/|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 July 2014}}</ref> Workers of the state-run steel produce Sidor protested for a second time against the president of the Venezuelan Guayana Corporation, Justo Noguera Pietri, over collective agreement issues. The workers blocked traffic in and out of Ciudad Guayana for 4 hours.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sidoristas trancaron vías para exigir discusión de nuevo contrato colectivo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/19/sidoristas-trancaron-vias-para-exigir-discusion-de-nuevo-contrato-colectivo/|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> * '''19 July''' - Ombudswoman Gabriela Ramirez reported that her office studied the arrests of Leopoldo López, Commissioner Ivan Simonovis, and Marco Coello and that the Venezuelan government is attempting to protect their rights<ref>{{cite news|title=Defensoría del Pueblo estudió el caso de Leopoldo López|url=http://www.laverdad.com/politica/56629-defensoria-del-pueblo-estudio-el-caso-de-leopoldo-lopez.html|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Verdad|date=19 July 2014}}</ref> * '''20 July''' - Former mayor who was arrested, Daniel Ceballos, called on the people of Táchira to continue protesting.<ref>{{cite news|title=Daniel Ceballos llamó "a seguir luchando por la libertad de Venezuela"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140720/daniel-ceballos-llamo-a-seguir-luchando-por-la-libertad-de-venezuela|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=20 July 2014}}</ref> * '''21 July''' - In Puerto Ordaz, Bolivar, workers of Sidor protested and created barricades.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Sidor trancan redoma La Piña (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/21/trabajadores-de-sidor-trancan-redoma-la-pina-fotos/|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=21 July 2014}}</ref> In Boconó, residents protested and blocked access to Zumbador due to the poor conditions of roads in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=En Boconó se alzaron y salieron a protestar (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/21/en-bocono-se-alzaron-y-salieron-a-protestar-foto/|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=21 July 2014}}</ref> * '''22 July''' - Protesters in Valencia placed banners throughout the city criticizing the quality of water, electricity, security, health and education.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta creativa: En Valencia decoraron las calles con pancartas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/22/protesta-creativa-en-valencia-decoraron-las-calles-con-pancartas-fotos/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=22 July 2014}}</ref> Sidor workers demanding a collective agreement protested once again closing multiple roads in Guyana.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Suniaga|first1=Carlos|title=Protesta de sidoristas colapsa estaciones de servicio en Guayana|url=http://globovision.com/trabajadores-de-sidor-trancan-el-paso-en-el-puente-caroni-por-protesta/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=Globovision|date=22 July 2014}}</ref> Parents of those arrested for protesting outside of the UNDP building in Caracas protested outside of the building asking for the UN to make statements and denounced alleged human rights violations of their children.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padres de estudiantes detenidos protestan en el Pnud por retardo procesal (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/23/padres-de-jovenes-detenidos-en-el-sebin-amanecieron-en-el-pnud-foto/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 July 2014}}</ref> * '''23 July''' - In Boconó, several barricades were placed by residents protesting against failures in water services, municipal cleaning and electrical faults to which they are subjected.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tres días de protesta en Boconó (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/23/habitantes-de-bocono-volvieron-a-las-calles-a-protestar-fotos/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 July 2014}}</ref> In Ciudad Bolívar, clashes between the National Guard and protesters occurred.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB agrede brutalmente a estudiantes en Ciudad Bolívar (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/23/gnb-agrede-brutalmente-a-estudiantes-en-ciudad-bolivar-fotos/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 July 2014}}</ref> Parents that were protesting outside of the UNDP building were asked to leave by Polichacao officers and were told that the National Guard would remove them if they did not comply.<ref>{{cite news|title=Polichacao pide a padres de estudiantes detenidos en el Pnud desalojar el área|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/23/polichacao-pide-a-padres-de-estudiantes-detenidos-en-el-pnud-desalojar-el-area/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 July 2014}}</ref> * '''24 July''' - Residents in Lara and Mérida marched from Ayacucho de Barquisimeto Square to Bolivar Plaza to commemorate Bolivar's birthday and denounce. After the march, clashes occurred in Barquisimeto and Mérida between protesters who set up barricades and the National Guard who proceeded to disperse them. In Barquisimeto, 13 were arrested and 2 were injured.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en Lara y Mérida en la celebración del natalicio de Bolívar|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/portada/articulo/86002/protesta-en-lara-y-mrida-en-la-celebracin-del-natalicio-de-bolvar|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=El Carabobeno|date=25 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=13 detenidos y 2 lesionados deja protesta en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140725/13-detenidos-y-2-lesionados-deja-protesta-en-barquisimeto|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=25 July 2014}}</ref> * '''25 July''' - Wives of opposition leaders who were arrested said that President Maduro would be responsible for their husbands wellbeing after Scarano and Lucchese were allegedly beaten. The wives also accused the government of lying about Leopoldo Lopez's freedom, saying that photos released showing him in church were from a different period of time.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Manuel Trujillo|first1=Ruben|title=Responsabilizan a Maduro por salud de López, Scarano, Ceballos y Lucchese|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140725/responsabilizan-a-maduro-por-salud-de-lopez-scarano-ceballos-y-lucches|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=25 July 2014}}</ref> * '''26 July''' - A caravan of supporters drove to Ramo Verde prison demanding to visit opposition leaders imprisoned there.<ref>{{cite news|last1=de la Rosa|first1=Alicia|title=Caravana en apoyo a López, Scarano, Lucchese y Ceballos llegó a Ramo Verde|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140726/caravana-en-apoyo-a-lopez-scarano-lucchese-y-ceballos-llego-a-ramo-ver|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=El Universal|date=26 July 2014}}</ref> Parents of students that were arrested protested outside of the HP Tower in Los Palos Grandes, Chacao municipality.<ref>{{cite news|title=Padres de los @JovenesVzlanos presos siguen frente a la Torre HP (Foto) #26J|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/26/padres-de-los-jovenesvzlanos-presos-siguen-frente-a-la-torre-hp-foto-26j/|accessdate=27 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 July 2014}}</ref> * '''27 July''' - The Venezuelan Armed Forces warned the workers of Sidor who were protesting in Ciudad Guyana that they would be patrolling the area and would take action against the workers if necessary.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alto mando militar lanza advertencias a los sidoristas: No vinimos a reprimir a nadie|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/27/alto-mando-militar-lanza-advertencias-a-los-sidoristas-no-vinimos-a-reprimir-a-nadie/|accessdate=28 July 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=27 July 2014}}</ref> * '''28 July''' - 83 people were arrested in Cumana after 27 separate pockets of protests denouncing alleged human rights violations broke out near the police headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=83 detenidos por protestas en Cumaná|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140728/83-detenidos-por-protestas-en-cumana|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=28 July 2014}}</ref> * '''29 July''' - Mother of Geraldine Moreno, a woman killed while protesting, demanded through social media that the 8 students detained after the dismantling of the camp near the UNDP headquarters be released.<ref>{{cite news|title=Madre de Geraldine Moreno exigió libertad para estudiantes del Pnud (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/29/madre-de-geraldine-moreno-exigio-libertad-para-estudiantes-del-pnud-foto/|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=29 July 2014}}</ref> * '''30 July''' - Members of National Front gathered in front of the [[SEBIN]] headquarters denouncing abuses that protesters faced and demanded the release of political prisoners.<ref>{{cite news|title=Exigen a Maduro libertad de estudiantes presos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/30/exigen-a-maduro-libertad-de-estudiantes-presos/|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 July 2014}}</ref> While María Corina Machado was participating in a town meeting in Caricuao, Caracas, over 30 people belonging to colectivos attacked her vehicle leaving it heavily damaged. Machado escaped and was then moved to the assembly place while colectivos followed breaking down the door where they then left the scene after confrontations with residents protecting Machado.<ref>{{cite news|title=María Corina Machado fue atacada durante una asamblea en Caricuao|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/31/maria-corina-machado-fue-atacada-durante-una-asamblea-en-caricuao/|accessdate=1 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 July 2014}}</ref> * '''31 July''' - Auto workers in Caracas protested at Plaza Caracas denouncing the country's situation in the automotive sector and stated that the allocation of currency is under their control.<ref>{{cite news|title=En fotos: Protesta de los trabajadores del sector automotriz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/07/31/en-fotos-protesta-de-los-trabajadores-del-sector-automotriz/|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=31 July 2014}}</ref>
==August== * '''1 August''' - The National Union of Court Employees (SINTRAT) marched from the Caracas Courthouse to the headquarters of the Vice President demanding a wage increase.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Francisco Alonso|first1=Juan|title=Trabajadores judiciales marcharon por Caracas para exigir aumento salarial|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140801/trabajadores-judiciales-marcharon-por-caracas-para-exigir-aumento-sala|accessdate=2 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=1 August 2014}}</ref> * '''2 August''' - Multiple government officials held demonstrations in support of the Palestinian people with a large protest held by pro-government protesters at Plaza Morelos de Caracas in Caracas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Realizan manifestaciones es el país en apoyo a Palestina|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Realizan-manifestacion-pais-apoyo-Palestina_0_457154356.html|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=2 August 2014}}</ref> * '''3 August''' - Residents of Candelaria threatened to restart protests in the neighborhood following the murder of a woman, saying that though there were some minor improvements after an earlier murder, they still demand to meet with Minister Miguel Rodriguez Torres.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Matamoros|first1=Natalia|title=Comerciantes y vecinos de Candelaria amenazan con reactivar protestas|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/sucesos/140803/comerciantes-y-vecinos-de-candelaria-amenazan-con-reactivar-protestas|accessdate=4 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=3 August 2014}}</ref> * '''4 August''' - On Henry Ford Avenue in Valencia, a transport vehicle was burnt in protest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en La Isabelica este #4A|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/04/protesta-en-la-isabelica-este-4a/|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=4 August 2014}}</ref> In Baruta, protesters burned tires and created road blockages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancan paso por Baruta a la altura de La Limonera|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/04/trancan-paso-por-baruta-a-la-altura-de-la-limonera/|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=4 August 2014}}</ref> Near the Catholic University of Táchira, clashes between protesters and security forces left 10 people injured with one hit by a tear gas canister.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan heridos tras enfrentamiento en la Ucat (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/04/reportan-heridos-tras-enfrentamiento-en-la-ucat-fotos/|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=4 August 2014}}</ref> * '''5 August''' - In Barquisimeto, protesters closed Lara Avenue for 5 hours while burning tires and were later dispersed by security forces with rubber pellets and tear gas resulting in one arrest.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Prato|first1=Marla|title=Un detenido durante manifestaciones en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140805/un-detenido-durante-manifestaciones-en-barquisimeto|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=5 August 2014}}</ref> In Choroní, residents protested for a second day denouncing the poor public services and overflowing sewers in the area with the protesters being dispersed later in the night.<ref>{{cite news|title=Envían grupos policiales antimotines para aplacar protesta en Choroní|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140805/envian-grupos-policiales-antimotines-para-aplacar-protesta-en-choroni|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=5 August 2014}}</ref> * '''6 August''' - In Salamanca, protesters blocked the Charallave-Ocumare highway due to having no drinking water and violence in the area that left 6 people dead.<ref>{{cite news|title=Por falta de agua e inseguridad trancan la vía Charallave-Ocumare del Tuy|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140806/por-falta-de-agua-e-inseguridad-trancan-la-via-charallave-ocumare-del-|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=6 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Manifestantes trancan la autopista Charallave-Ocumare (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/06/trancan-la-autopista-charallave-ocumare-por-protesta-foto/|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 August 2014}}</ref> Sidor workers held another protest, closing Guayana Avenue with buses resulting in one worker being arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sidoristas vuelven a trancar Guayana (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/06/sidoristas-vuelven-a-trancar-guayana-fotos/|accessdate=7 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 August 2014}}</ref> * '''7 August''' - A caravan of taxi drivers caused blockages of traffic in Los Teques protested against insecurity in the area after a 71-year-old partner of a taxi driver was killed by a bullet wound to the neck.<ref>{{cite news|title=Caravana de taxistas en Los Teques en protesta por la inseguridad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/07/caravana-de-taxistas-en-los-teques-en-protesta-por-la-inseguridad/|accessdate=8 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 August 2014}}</ref> * '''8 August''' - Deputy Chairman of the Federation of Student Center at UCV, the youth leader of Aragua, the president of the UDI Youth and a Chilean student among two others were arrested by [[SEBIN]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Detienen en el Helicoide a presidente adjunto de la FCU|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140808/detienen-en-el-helicoide-a-presidente-adjunto-de-la-fcu|accessdate=8 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=8 August 2014}}</ref> The [[Independent Democratic Union| Independent Democratic Union party (UDI)]] of Chile promptly responded to the arrest of its leader, Felipe Cuevas, demanding an "immediate release". The Chilean ambassador in Venezuela explained that the Chilean student politician may be released soon saying he was arrested for taking photographs in an unauthorized area and not having his passport upon him.<ref>{{cite news|title=Partido político chileno solicita liberación de militante en Venezuela|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140808/partido-politico-chileno-solicita-liberacion-de-militante-en-venezuela|accessdate=8 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=8 August 2014}}</ref> * '''9 August''' - Students leaders and a Chilean politician that were arrested the previous days were released.<ref>{{cite news|title=Liberan a los dos líderes estudiantiles detenidos con el dirigente chileno|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140809/liberan-a-los-dos-lideres-estudiantiles-detenidos-con-el-dirigente-chi|accessdate=12 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=9 August 2014}}</ref> * '''10 August''' - The Ecological Movement of Venezuela, along with other social groups announced that they would hold a protest in Ciudad Guayana on 13 August due to insecurity, the disposal of garbage and food shortages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Realizarán protesta "Cumbre contra la inseguridad" en Ciudad Guayana|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140810/realizaran-protesta-cumbre-contra-la-inseguridad-en-ciudad-guayana|accessdate=12 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=10 August 2014}}</ref> * '''11 August''' - After weeks of protesting, Sidor workers protested once again on Guayana Avenue resulting in one worker injured after he was hit by two shotgun pellets while the National Guard dispersed them.<ref>{{cite news|title=Un herido por perdigón deja protesta de SIDOR (Fotos y video)|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/un-herido-por-perdigon-deja-protesta-de-sidor-fotos|accessdate=12 August 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=11 August 2014}}</ref> * '''12 August''' - Sidor workers protested against the arrest of 19 workers the previous day and were dispersed by the National Guard who were using tear gas and buckshot, resulting in two individuals, a Sidor worker and a bystander, being injured from shotgun the pellets.<ref>{{cite news|title=GNB reprime protesta de trabajadores de Sidor frente al Core 8 (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/12/gnb-reprime-protesta-de-trabajadores-de-sidor-frente-al-core-8-12ago/|accessdate=19 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 August 2014}}</ref> * '''13 August''' - Groups gathered outside of the courthouse with signs and shouting slogans, demanding the release of Leopoldo Lopez.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sociedad civil exige liberación de Leopoldo López en el Palacio de Justicia|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Sociedad-Leopoldo-Lopez-Palacio-Justicia_0_463753674.html|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=13 August 2014}}</ref> * '''14 August''' - 112 of 120 protesters arrested outside of the UNDP headquarters in Caracas on 8 May received full freedom, with the remaining 8 protesters remaining detained due to alleged greater crimes.<ref>{{cite news|title=En libertad plena 112 de los jóvenes detenidos en el campamento del PNUD|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140814/en-libertad-plena-112-de-los-jovenes-detenidos-en-el-campamento-del-pn|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=14 August 2014}}</ref> * '''15 August''' - In Tucacas, Falcon State, residents protested against the rate increase from 5 bolívares for entrance to the park, to between 80 and 150 bolívares to enter Morrocoy National Park, with the protests resulting in 3 people injured and 7 arrested by the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Siete detenidos y tres heridos dejaron fuertes protestas en Tucacas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/15/siete-detenidos-y-tres-heridos-dejaron-fuertes-protestas-en-tucacas-fotos/|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 August 2014}}</ref> * '''16 August''' - In Vargas state, resident of Montesano protested over the lack of water in their neighborhoods.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Vargas por la falta de agua (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/16/protestan-en-vargas-por-la-falta-de-agua-fotos/|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=16 August 2014}}</ref> * '''17 August''' -
