In San Cristóbal, public transport drivers protested against outside of a government-run PDV gas station due to the poor quality of service of the gas station.<ref>{{cite news|title=Transportistas trancaron la avenida Marginal |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/regional/transportistas-trancaron-la-avenida-marginal/ |accessdate=20 August 2014 |agency=La Nacion (Venezuela) |date=17 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140820233348/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/regional/transportistas-trancaron-la-avenida-marginal/ |archivedate=August 20, 2014 }}</ref> * '''18 August''' - During a visit in Valencia, Cardinal Jorge Urosa Savino called for justice for the murder cases of Geraldin Moreno and Genesis Carmona, and walso made statements denouncing the "injustice" being committed against arrested opposition leaders.<ref>{{cite news|title=Urosa pidió que se haga justicia en casos de Génesis y Geraldín|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/18/urosa-pidio-que-se-haga-justicia-en-casos-de-genesis-y-geraldin/|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 August 2014}}</ref> * '''19 August''' - A protest over the poor condition of roads in the area occurred on Petare-Santa Lucia road at La Dolorita in Sucre municipality caused heavy traffic on roads nearby.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancan por segundo día la Petare-Santa Lucía (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/19/trancan-por-segundo-dia-la-petare-santa-lucia-fotos/|accessdate=20 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> * '''20 August''' - In La Dolorita on Petare-Santa Lucia road, residents caused back ups in traffic while protesting once again while protesting against the bad conditions of roads nearby.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trancan el paso en La Dolorita (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/20/trancan-el-paso-en-la-dolorita-fotos/|accessdate=21 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 August 2014}}</ref> In San Cristóbal, residents protested against the lack of gas in the area by blocking roads.<ref>{{cite news|title=En San Cristóbal protestan por la falta de gas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/20/en-san-cristobal-protestan-por-la-falta-de-gas/|accessdate=21 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 August 2014}}</ref> Residents of multiple municipalities in Caracas protested outside of the Corpoelec headquarters denouncing the daily blackouts that occurred in their neighborhoods.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vecinos protestan contra los apagones en Caracas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/20/vecinos-protestan-contra-los-apagones-en-caracas/|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 August 2014}}</ref> In Lara state, residents along with members of Movimiento Esudantil protested outside of the University Central Hospital Antonio Maria Pineda de Barquisimeto and the poor condition of healthcare in the country.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Piscitelli|first1=Dani|title=#20A Larenses protestan ante grave situación del sector salud (Fotos)|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/20a-ciudadanos-de-lara-protestan-ante-grave-situacion-del-sector-salud|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=20 August 2014}}</ref> * '''21 August''' - Libertador municipality councilor, Jesus Armas along with residents and Primero Justicia supporters protested in El Paraíso Parish against the healthcare crisis in Venezuela while handing out flyers explaining the severity of the situation.<ref>{{cite news|title=Concejal Jesús Armas: La salud en Venezuela está en terapia intensiva|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/21/concejal-jesus-armas-la-salud-en-venezuela-esta-en-terapia-intensiva/|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=21 August 2014}}</ref> Popular Will leader Ismael León led a protest denouncing unpunished murders in Venezuela and criticized how minister Miguel Rodríguez Torres handled the situation.<ref>{{cite news|title=El Guaire es la morgue fluvial de Caracas por la incapacidad de Rodríguez Torres|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/21/el-guaire-es-la-morgue-fluvial-de-caracas-por-la-incapacidad-de-rodriguez-torres/|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=21 August 2014}}</ref> In Caracas, residents protested outside of the headquarters of the state water company Hidrocapital against discolored water and water rationing, with one community leader delivering a document to Hidrocapital from 22 parishes in Caracas explaining the situation residents were facing with their water.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Hidrocapital contra racionamiento y mala calidad del agua en Caracas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/21/protestan-en-hidrocapital-contra-racionamiento-y-mala-calidad-del-agua-en-caracas/|accessdate=22 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=21 August 2014}}</ref> * '''22 August''' - Gerardo Carrero, the National Coordinator of the Youth Organization Venezuelans who was arrested by SEBIN on 8 May, along with other prisoners declared a hunger strike demanding the release of other students who are detained in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiante detenido se declara en huelga de hambre|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140822/estudiante-detenido-se-declara-en-huelga-de-hambre|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=22 August 2014}}</ref> Carrero also shared a letter he wrote to President Maduro asking him to tolerate political opponents.<ref>{{cite news|title=Carta abierta de Gerardo Carrero a Nicolás Maduro|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140822/carta-abierta-de-gerardo-carrero-a-nicolas-maduro|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=22 August 2014}}</ref> * '''23 August''' - In Valencia, a protest occurred inside of a government-run Bicentenario supermarket on Boilvar Avenue due to the lack of goods inside of the store.<ref>{{cite news|title=LA FOTO: Pancartota y protesta por escasez ¡dentro del Bicentenario!|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/23/la-foto-pancartota-y-protesta-por-escasez-dentro-del-bicentenario-por-cierto-vacio/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 August 2014}}</ref> * '''24 August''' - Jesus Ramirez, student representative of the Venezuelan Youth Organization, stated that the hunger strike of Gerardo Carrero and other prisoners would not cease until full freedom of those arrested is met, also stating that student protests would occur again if demand were not met, asking for the UN commission and the Organization of American States come to check the alleged violation of human rights in Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Nederr|first1=Sofia|title=Organización Jóvenes Venezolanos pide libertad plena para todos los estudiantes|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Organizacion-Jovenes-Venezolanos-libertad-estudiantes_0_469753176.html|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=24 August 2014}}</ref> * '''25 August''' - Large protests reappeared in Caracas, the municipality of Chacao, San Cristóbal, and Tachira, mainly due to the redesigned proposal of food rationing by President Maduro and economic problems according to the ''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' and ''El Universal''. In Chacao, barricades of burning trash bags and tires appeared in the morning. Barricades also appeared in San Cristóbal during the early morning hours where the National Guard responded by trying to disperse protesters with tear gas and rubber bullets, and damaged a residential buildings gate after ramming it when pursuing protesters. Protesters then responded with Molotov cocktails, which injured one guardsman with burns. In Santa Fe, protesters demonstrated against President Maduro and his advisors, with the protest resulting with the National Guard dispersing individuals with tear gas and 6 protesters arrested.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reaparecen barricadas en Chacao (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/25/se-levantan-barricadas-en-chacao-fotos/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=25 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lacrimógenas y molotov: Volvieron las protestas callejeras a San Cristóbal y Caracas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/25/lacrimogenas-y-molotov-volvieron-las-protestas-callejeras-a-san-cristobal-y-caracas/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=25 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Enfrentamientos y barricadas nuevamente en San Cristóbal|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140825/enfrentamientos-y-barricadas-nuevamente-en-san-cristobal|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=25 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en San Cristóbal en rechazo al captahuellas|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140825/protestan-en-san-cristobal-en-rechazo-al-captahuellas|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=25 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Vuelven las lacrimógenas a Caracas: GNB reprime manifestación en Santa Fe (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/25/vuelven-las-lacrimogenas-a-caracas-gnb-reprime-manifestacion-en-santa-fe-fotos/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=25 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Seis detenidos tras protestas en Santa Fe|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/25/seis-detenidos-tras-protesta-en-santa-fe/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=25 August 2014}}</ref> * '''26 August''' - In Valencia, a group of protesters gathered in Bolivar Avenue to denounce the alleged indoctrination of children by the Venezuelan government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Salieron a protestar en Valencia contra adoctrinamiento de los niños (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/26/salieron-a-protestar-en-valencia-contra-adoctrinamiento-de-los-ninos-fotos/|accessdate=26 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> * '''27 August''' - Residents in Los Teques blocked a street while protesting to be relocated.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en Las Adjuntas mantiene cerrada la carretera vieja de Los Teques (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/27/protesta-en-las-adjuntas-mantiene-cerrada-la-carretera-vieja-de-los-teques-foto/|accessdate=27 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> Students of the Universidad Privada Dr. Rafael Belloso Chacín (URBE) protested against the proposed food rationing system, food shortages and asked for President Maduro to resign while demonstrating in northern Maracaibo. The Zulia State Police responded to the demonstrations, closing roads near the university and dispersed the protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Policía dispersa protesta contra el cazahuellas en Zulia #27A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/27/policia-dispersa-protesta-de-estudiantes-de-urbe-en-zulia-27a-fotos/|accessdate=27 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> * '''28 August''' - Multiple supporters of Leopoldo Lopez gather outside of the courthouse where his fourth trial was held 6 months after his imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news|title=Restringen acceso al Palacio de Justicia este #28Ago (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/28/asi-se-encuentra-el-palacio-de-justicia-este-28ago-fotos/|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> Numerous protests occurred denouncing the new fingerprint rationing system proposed by President Maduro. The MUD reactivated protests by calling on supporters to hold a nationwide Cacerolazo at 8:00 pm local time against the proposed system.<ref>{{cite news|title=MUD reactiva protestas en Venezuela: convoca a un cacerolazo nacional para rechazar sistema biométrico|url=http://www.ntn24.com/noticia/mud-reactiva-protestas-en-venezuela-convocan-a-un-cacerolazo-nacional-para-rechazar-sistema-23726|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=NTN24|date=28 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=La Mesa convoca a cacerolazo mañana a las 8:00 de la noche|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140827/la-mesa-convoca-a-cacerolazo-manana-a-las-800-de-la-noche|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=El Universal|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> The banging of pots from the Cacerolazo could be heard in several states.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela respondió al llamado de la MUD y caceroleó contra el sistema biométrico|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/28/venezuela-respondio-al-llamado-de-la-mud-y-caceroleo-contra-el-sistema-biometrico/|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> In the Libertador Municipality of Caracas, residents protested by blocking a road in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Colapsado el tráfico en la parroquia Altagracia por manifestación #28A (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/28/colapsado-el-trafico-en-la-parroquia-altagracia-por-manifestacion-28a-fotos/|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> In Santa Fe, protesters blocked multiple roads in the area which resulted in the arrest of two students following clashes with the National Guard, which launched tear gas at residents on the streets and in nearby buildings.<ref>{{cite news|title=Entre lacrimógenas y detenidos, continuaron las protestas en Santa Fe Sur (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/28/lluvia-de-lacrimogenas-contra-manifestantes-en-santa-fe-sur-fotos/|accessdate=29 August 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> * '''29 August''' - COPEI announced that demonstrations were organized for the next day, 30 August, in order to denounce the proposed fingerprint food system and that the march is to begin at the COPEI headquarters in El Bosque and end at the headquarters of the Superintendency of Fair Prices.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei marchará mañana contra sistema biométrico|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Copei-marchara-manana-sistema-biometrico_0_473352721.html|accessdate=30 August 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=29 August 2014}}</ref> Primero Justicia also held a meeting, calling on Venezuelans to reject the proposed system and called for peaceful protesting.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Nederr|first1=Sofia|title=PJ rechaza captahuellas para el control político|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/PJ-rechaza-captahuellas-control-politico_0_472752914.html|accessdate=30 August 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=29 August 2014}}</ref> * '''30 August''' - COPEI held their march to the headquarters of the Superintendency of Fair Prices, denouncing the proposed fingerprint system and stated that the Venezuelan government was responsible for food shortages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei marcha hasta la Sundecop en rechazo a la cazahuellas (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/30/copei-marcha-hasta-la-sundecop-en-rechazo-a-la-cazahuellas-fotos/|accessdate=1 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 August 2014}}</ref> In Chacao, barricades were placed in several streets with the protests ending due to the National Police dispersing them with tear gas.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chacao se enciende en protestas el sábado por la noche|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/30/chacao-se-enciende-en-protestas-el-sabado-por-la-noche/|accessdate=1 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 August 2014}}</ref> * '''31 August''' - Members of the Movimiento Estudiantil protested outside multiple Venezuelan churches asking for intervention of the Church with student arrests and alleged torturing by Venezuelan authorities.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes piden a la iglesia interceder por jóvenes detenidos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/08/31/estudiantes-piden-a-la-iglesia-interceder-por-jovenes-detenidos-fotos/|accessdate=1 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=31 August 2014}}</ref>
==September== * '''1 September''' - In Baruta, transportation workers caused heavy traffic backups while blocking roads in protest.<ref>{{cite news|title=No hay paso en la carretera Baruta-El Placer por protesta (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/01/no-hay-paso-en-carretera-baruta-el-placer-por-protesta-foto/|accessdate=5 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> In Los Alpes, residents protested by blocking the Pan American highway, demanding the state water company Hidrocapital finish projects in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cierran la Panamericana por protesta (Foto)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/01/cierran-la-panamericana-por-protesta-foto/|accessdate=5 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> In Tachira, residents protested against the proposed fingerprint system which resulted in 6 injured protesters following clashes with authorities who were trying to disperse them.<ref>{{cite news|title=Seis heridos, uno de bala, dejan las protestas contra cazahuellas en Táchira|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/01/seis-heridos-uno-de-bala-dejan-las-protestas-contra-cazahuellas-en-tachira/|accessdate=5 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> * '''2 September''' - Motorcyclists protested in Los Ruices by blocking roads and causing heavy congestion.<ref>{{cite news|title=Motorizados protestan en Los Ruices|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/02/motorizados-protestan-en-los-ruices/|accessdate=5 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 September 2014}}</ref> Outside of a Bicentennial Supermarket in Las Mercedes, Primero Justicia supporters protested against the proposed fingerprinting system for goods.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta frente al Bicentenario de Las Mercedes contra el "cazahuellas" #2S (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/02/protesta-frente-al-bicentenario-de-las-mercedes-contra-el-cazahuellas-2s-fotos/|accessdate=5 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 September 2014}}</ref> * '''3 September''' - COPEI assigned 5000 supporters to collect petitions against the proposed fingerprint purchasing system.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei activará 5 mil misioneros que buscarán apoyo para amparo contra la cazahuella|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/03/copei-activara-5-mil-misioneros-que-buscaran-apoyo-para-amparo-contra-la-cazahuella/|accessdate=6 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 September 2014}}</ref> * '''4 September''' - Dioris Albarrán, Anderson Briceño and Abril Tovar, the final students who were still arrested after the dismantling of a camp outside of the UN headquarters in Caracas on 8 May, were released.<ref>{{cite news|title=En libertad estudiantes Dioris Albarran, Anderson Briceño y Abril Tovar|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/04/en-libertad-estudiantes-dioris-albarran-anderson-briceno-y-abril-tovar/|accessdate=6 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=4 September 2014}}</ref> * '''5 September''' - The Bolivarian National Police evicted COPEI members collecting signatures denouncing a proposed fingerprint system in La Candelaria.<ref>{{cite news|title=PNB interrumpió recolección de firmas de Copei contra el cazahuellas en La Candelaria (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/05/pnb-interrumpio-recoleccion-de-firmas-de-copei-contra-el-cazahuellas-en-la-candelaria-fotos/|accessdate=6 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=5 September 2014}}</ref> Doctors, nurses and patients protested outside of the José Manuel de los Ríos Children's Hospital denouncing the condition of the hospital, which supposedly lacked resources, had falling ceilings and sewage leaks.<ref>{{cite news|title=Techos caídos, filtraciones y aguas negras denuncian en el Hospital de Niños|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/05/techos-caidos-filtraciones-y-aguas-negras-denuncian-en-el-hospital-de-ninos/|accessdate=6 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=5 September 2014}}</ref> * '''6 September''' - The NGO Venezuelan Penal Forum announced that it will continue to assist those detained in anti-government protests and that they may also expand their assistance.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rodríguez Álvarez|first1=Alejandra|title=Foro Penal prevé ampliar su campo de acción|url=http://eltiempo.com.ve/venezuela/derechos-humanos/foro-penal-preve-ampliar-su-campo-de-accion/153181|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=El Tiempo|date=7 September 2014}}</ref> * '''7 September''' - Lorent Saleh Gomez and Gabriel Valleys, members of the NGO Operation Freedom who organized protests, were expelled from Colombia allegedly "for violation of the immigration laws of the country" and were later detained by SEBIN.<ref>{{cite news|title=Colombia negó deportación de tercer venezolano|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140907/colombia-nego-deportacion-de-tercer-venezolano|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=El Universal|date=7 September 2014}}</ref> * '''8 September''' - In Miranda, protesters blocked traffic for 2 hours asking for improvements in education.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Leguía|first1=Fabiola|title=Restablecen paso en la Panamericana tras protesta|url=http://globovision.com/870275/|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=Globovision|date=8 September 2014}}</ref> * '''9 September''' - Students of the Catholic University Andres Bello (UCAB) called on Venezuelans to reject the proposed fingerprint food purchasing system and organized a gathering at Plaza Alfredo Sadel on 12 September.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes hacen un llamado a la población a no aceptar el cazahuellas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/09/estudiantes-hacen-un-llamado-a-la-poblacion-a-no-aceptar-el-cazahuellas/|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 September 2014}}</ref> * '''10 September''' - The fourth hearing of Leopoldo Lopez was held at the Palace of Justice.<ref>{{cite news|title=Se reanuda juicio de Leopoldo López sin aceptar pruebas de la defensa|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/10/leopoldo-lopez-fue-trasladado-al-palacio-de-justicia-2/|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=11 September 2014}}</ref> * '''11 September''' - President of COPEI, Roberto Enríquez, asked the Supreme Court to withdraw the proposed fingerprint purchasing system and presented 726,000 signatures from Venezuelans who denounced the proposed system.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei presentó amparo contra la captahuellas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Copei-presento-amparo-captahuellas_0_480552131.html|accessdate=14 September 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=11 September 2014}}</ref> * '''12 September''' - In Bellomonte, a group of students gathered in memorial of Bassil Da Costa near the place of his death and remembered 7 months since the protests began. Students began to block a street when authorities began to disperse protesters with tear gas and arrested more than 20.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes retomaron las calles pacíficamente en Bello Monte (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/12/estudiantes-retoman-las-calles-en-bello-monte-y-gnb-se-mantienen-en-alerta-fotos/|accessdate=13 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan protesta en Colinas de Bello Monte|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/caracas/140912/reportan-protesta-en-colinas-de-bello-monte|accessdate=13 September 2014|agency=El Universal|date=12 September 2014}}</ref> * '''13 September''' - After a morning of alleged Colectivo activity in Barquisimeto, student protesters began to block roads in the area which resulted in Venezuelan authorities raiding an apartment complex and arresting multiple individuals.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Parto|first1=Marla|title=44 detenidos y un herido dejaron manifestaciones en Barquisimeto|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140913/44-detenidos-y-un-herido-dejaron-manifestaciones-en-barquisimeto|accessdate=13 September 2014|agency=El Universal|date=13 September 2014}}</ref> Protests in Caracas also caused clashes between authorities and protesters that resulted in a total of 64 protesters arrested.<ref name="reuters.com">{{cite news|last1=Cawthorne|first1=Andrew|title=Venezuela arrests 64 for anti-Maduro protests: rights group|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/09/13/us-venezuela-protests-idUSKBN0H80N720140913|accessdate=16 September 2014|agency=Reuters|date=13 September 2014}}</ref> In San Cristobal, protests occurred denouncing the proposed fingerprint system.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Delgado|first1=Eleonora|title=Protestan contra cierre fronterizo y captahuellas|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Protestan-cierre-fronterizo-captahuellas_0_481752021.html|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=13 September 2014}}</ref> President Maduro made statements following the "flare ups" of protests in August and September, saying, "We are not going to have even a minimum of tolerance with the protests ... I will have no hesitation in ensuring peace and justice, which is what the people want".<ref name="reuters.com"/> * '''14 September''' - Law professionals and families of those arrested in Barquisimeto reported that the arrested individuals have been unable to communicate. Supporters for those arrested also gathered outside of the National Building in Lara.<ref>{{cite news|title=# 12S arrested in #Barquisimeto held incommunicado|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/detenidos-el-12s-en-barquisimeto-permanecen-incomunicados|accessdate=16 September 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=16 September 2014}}</ref> * '''15 September''' - Near the University of the Andes (ULA), clashes were reported between the National Guard and protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Represión y fuerte presencia policial en la ULA de Táchira|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/15/represion-y-fuerte-presencia-policial-en-la-ula-de-tachira/|accessdate=16 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 September 2014}}</ref> 6 arrested individuals involved in the 12 September Monte Bello protests were deprived of liberty along with other involved protesters who were prohibited from leaving the jurisdiction.<ref>{{cite news|title=Custodial six arrested in protests # 12S in Monte Bello|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/15/privativa-de-libertad-para-seis-detenidos-en-protestas-del-12s-en-bello-monte/|accessdate=16 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 September 2014}}</ref> Workers of Bolivarian Airports protested due to collective bargaining issues.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Anais Peña|first1=Rebeca|title=Trabajadores de Bolivariana de Aeropuertos protestaron|url=http://www.notitarde.com/Valencia/Trabajadores-de-Bolivariana-de-Aeropuertos-protestaron/2014/09/15/353248|accessdate=24 September 2014|agency=NotiTarde|date=15 September 2014}}</ref> * '''16 September''' - Students arrested for peacefully protesting in Anzoategui were released.<ref>{{cite news|title=En libertad estudiantes detenidos por protestar en Anzoátegui|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140916/en-libertad-estudiantes-detenidos-por-protestar-en-anzoategui|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=El Universal|date=16 September 2014}}</ref> * '''17 September''' - In the Píritu barrio of Petare, residents protested due to not having water for up to 6 months and denounced the inaction by both the Venezuelan government and its water company, Hidrocapital.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hasta seis meses sin agua han padecido vecinos del barrio Píritu de Petare (Video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/17/hasta-seis-meses-sin-agua-han-padecido-vecinos-del-barrio-piritu-de-petare-video/|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=17 September 2014}}</ref> * '''18 September''' - The trial for former Mayor of San Cristóbal, Daniel Ceballos, has its first hearing.<ref>{{cite news|title=El juicio a Ceballos no tiene ningún tipo de soporte ni pruebas, dice Patricia de Ceballos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/18/el-juicio-a-ceballos-no-tiene-ningun-tipo-de-soporte-ni-pruebas-dice-patricia-de-ceballos/|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 September 2014}}</ref> * '''19 September''' - In Sucre, traders protested due to the lack of being able to find work in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Buhoneros protestan en los alrededores del Unicentro El Marqués este #19S|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/19/buhoneros-protestan-en-los-alrededores-del-unicentro-el-marques-este-19s/|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=19 September 2014}}</ref> * '''20 September''' - COPEI organized protests in six municipalities of Barlovento, which each protested against various issues including power outages, insecurity, water shortages and rationing.<ref>{{cite news|title=Copei: El beneficio a Simonovis abre posibilidades al diálogo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/20/copei-el-beneficio-a-simonovis-abre-posibilidades-al-dialogo/|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 September 2014}}</ref> * '''21 September''' - The Venezuelan government's Public Prosecutors Office charged more students for being involved with Lorent Saleh Gomez and his alleged conspiracy of rebellion charges.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiscalía presentará a un estudiante tachirense por supuestos planes conspirativos|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Fiscalia-presentara-estudiante-Jhosman-Paredes_0_487151305.html|accessdate=23 September 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=21 September 2014}}</ref> * '''22 September''' - The government released a video showing Lorent Saleh Gomez, a student opposition activist involved in organizing the anti-government protests, discussing his plans to organize terrorist groups, in Colombia, and to return to Venezuela to carry out targeted assassinations and plant explosives in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/rodriguez-torres-presento-nuevo-video-de-lorent-sa.aspx |title=Rodríguez Torres presentó nuevo video de Lorent Saleh |publisher=Últimas Noticias |date=22 September 2014 |accessdate=23 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140923042317/http://www.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/sucesos/rodriguez-torres-presento-nuevo-video-de-lorent-sa.aspx |archivedate=September 23, 2014 }}</ref> * '''23 September''' - Traders between Colombia and Venezuela protested on the border blocking access on the Simon Bolivar bridge denouncing border closures.<ref>{{cite news|title=Informales bloquearon frontera entre Colombia y Venezuela|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Informales-bloquearon-frontera-Colombia-Venezuela_0_487751407.html|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=23 September 2014}}</ref> * '''24 September''' - Groups of drivers protested on the Colombia-Venezuela border, blocking passage due to the night time blockages the Venezuelan government had installed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Méndez Lárez|first1=Ingrid|title=Protesta de mototaxis en la frontera colombo-venezolana|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/protesta-de-mototaxis-en-la-frontera-colombo-venezolana#|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=24 September 2014}}</ref> * '''25 September''' - Pepsi workers in Valencia after 175 workers were sent home due to the lack of materials to produce Yukery juice and Lipton tea.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Pepsi Valencia protestaron por falta de materia prima|url=http://www.el-carabobeno.com/ciudad/articulo/89724/trabajadores-de-pepsi-valencia-protestaron-por-falta-de-materia-prima|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=El Carabobeno|date=25 September 2014}}</ref> * '''26 September''' - Lilian Tintori, along with deputy national coordinator of People's Will, Freddy Guevara, gathered with supporters outside of the UN headquarters in Caracas demanding the release of what they called political prisoners held by the Venezuelan government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Piden a la ONU que abogue por el respeto a los Derechos Humanos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/26/lilian-tintori-hoy-concentracion-pacifica-por-el-respeto-a-los-ddhh/|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 September 2014}}</ref> Several young supporters marched with Tintori to the UN building and then departed from her to demonstrate at Atamira Square.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes protestan en la avenida Francisco de Miranda|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Estudiantes-protestan-avenida-Francisco-Miranda_0_490151123.html|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=26 September 2014}}</ref> * '''27 September''' - Citizens in the Bolívar municipality protested over alleged abuses that they were suffering from military personnel in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Llano Jorge por detención arbitraria y malos tratos del Ejército hacia la población |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/regional/protestan-en-llano-jorge-por-detencion-arbitraria-y-malos-tratos-del-ejercito-hacia-la-poblacion/ |accessdate=3 October 2014 |agency=La Nacion |date=27 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006115413/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/regional/protestan-en-llano-jorge-por-detencion-arbitraria-y-malos-tratos-del-ejercito-hacia-la-poblacion/ |archivedate=October 6, 2014 }}</ref> * '''28 September''' - Popular Will began collecting signatures to create a Constituent Assembly calling for the resignation of President Maduro.<ref>{{cite news|title=Voluntad Popular recoge firmas para cambiar la Constitución |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/voluntad-popular-recoge-firmas-para-cambiar-la-constitucion/ |accessdate=3 October 2014 |agency=La Nacion |date=28 September 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006112358/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/nacional/voluntad-popular-recoge-firmas-para-cambiar-la-constitucion/ |archivedate=October 6, 2014 }}</ref> * '''29 September''' - At the University of Oriente, students closed gates to the campus to draw attention to their food, safety and other problems they were facing.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rivero|first1=Miriam|title=Cerraron portones de la Universidad de Oriente en Anzoátegui|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/140929/cerraron-portones-de-la-universidad-de-oriente-en-anzoategui|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=29 September 2014}}</ref> * '''30 September''' - Beginning at about noon, students at the Central University of Venezuela protested, closing Plaza Venezuela and caused the National Guard along with the National Police to respond.<ref>{{cite news|title=Detonaciones en la UCV contra protesta en la entrada Tamanaco (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/30/detonaciones-en-la-ucv-por-protesta-en-la-entrada-tamanaco-fotos/|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 September 2014}}</ref> In Miranda, traders protested in Francisco de Miranda Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta de buhoneros frente al Unicentro el Marqués #30S|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/09/30/protesta-de-buhoneros-frente-al-unicentro-el-marques-30s/|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=30 September 2014}}</ref>
==October== [[File:18 October 2014 Venezuela protest 1.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Individuals gathered holding a banner for the "Walk For Peace" march.]] [[File:18 October 2014 Venezuela protest 2 - MCM.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Maria Corina Machado attending the "Walk For Peace" march.]] [[File:18 October 2014 Venezuela protest 3.jpg|right|250px|thumb|An individual demonstrating, symbolically wearing chains.]] * '''1 October''' - Maria Corina Machado is awarded the 2014 Charles T. Manatt Democracy Award by the [[International Foundation for Electoral Systems]] following her actions calling on citizens to demonstrate and being a target for her work, with Vice Chairman William J. Hybl stating that "Machado's unwavering commitment to giving people a voice in the way they are governed speaks to IFES' core mission of advancing democratic rights and empowering those who have been marginalized from the political process".<ref>{{cite web|title=Venezuelan Opposition Leader to Receive 2014 IFES Democracy Award|url=http://www.ifes.org/Home/Content/Publications/Press%20Release/2014/IFES%20Press%20Release%20Venezuelan%20Opposition%20Leader%20to%20Receive%20IFES%20Democracy%20Award.aspx|website=International Foundation for Electoral Systems|accessdate=3 October 2014}}</ref> Machado's son traveled to Washington, D.C. to receive the award for his mother due to travel restrictions placed on Maria Corina Machado by the Venezuelan government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hijo de María Corina Machado, Henrique Sosa Machado, recibirá premio Ifes en nombre de su madre (ENTREVISTA)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/01/hijo-de-maria-corina-machado-henrique-sosa-machado-recibira-premio-ifes-en-nombre-de-su-madre-entrevista/|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 October 2014}}</ref> Construction workers in Tachira marched for higher wages.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de la construcción marcharon para exigir aumento salarial|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/01/trabajadores-de-la-construccion-marcharon-para-exigir-aumento-salarial/|accessdate=3 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 October 2014}}</ref> Pro-government [[deputy (legislator)|deputy]], [[Robert Serra]], and his companion María Herrera were found stabbed in their home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.de/chavista-legislator-robert-serra-murdered-in-venezuela/a-17969429|title=Chavista legislator Robert Serra murdered in Venezuela|work=DW.DE|accessdate=3 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-29455219|title=BBC News - Venezuelan lawmaker Robert Serra killed in Caracas|work=BBC News|accessdate=2 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/02/us-venezuela-crime-idUSKCN0HR0B420141002|title=Venezuelan 'Chavista' lawmaker Serra stabbed, killed at home|work=Reuters|accessdate=2 October 2014}}</ref> * '''2 October''' - Government officials lamented Serra's murder and started searching the ones that committed the crime. Some of them pointed blame towards the opposition movement.<ref>{{cite news|title=Asesinato de Robert Serra forma parte de una agenda política de la derecha|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/02/asesinato-de-robert-serra-forma-parte-de-una-agenda-politica-de-la-derecha/|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 October 2014}}</ref> The OAS condoned the act.<ref>{{cite news|title=Insulza: Asesinato de Robert Serra no debe quedar impune|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/03/insulza-asesinato-de-robert-serra-no-debe-quedar-impune/|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 October 2014}}</ref> * '''3 October''' - President Maduro blamed former Colombian President, [[Alvaro Uribe]], of being the mastermind behind Serra's murder.<ref>{{cite news|title=Maduro apunta a Alvaro Uribe como actor intelectual del asesinato de Robert Serra|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/03/maduro-apunta-a-alvaro-uribe-como-actor-intelectual-del-asesinato-de-robert-serra/|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 October 2014}}</ref> Uribe responded by calling President Maduro a ''coward''.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alvaro Uribe responde al "cobarde" Maduro|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/03/responde-alvaro-uribe/|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 October 2014}}</ref> * '''4 October''' - Members of Popular Will went to the streets to gather signatures demanding the gathering of a National Constituent Assembly.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hoy vuelve a recabar firmas Voluntad Popular para activar Asamblea Nacional Constituyente |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ve/politica/hoy-vuelve-a-recabar-firmas-voluntad-popular-para-activar-asamblea-nacional-constituyente/ |accessdate=18 October 2014 |agency=La Nación |date=4 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141022080202/http://www.lanacion.com.ve/politica/hoy-vuelve-a-recabar-firmas-voluntad-popular-para-activar-asamblea-nacional-constituyente/ |archivedate=October 22, 2014 }}</ref> * '''5 October''' -During the 2014 Caracas Rock 10K, citizens were seen holding banners demanding the release of Leopoldo López while also discussing other issues.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ausencia de Leopoldo López se notó en el Caracas Rock|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/05/ausencia-de-leopoldo-lopez-se-noto-en-el-caracas-rock/|accessdate=18 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=5 October 2014}}</ref> * '''6 October''' - Clashes occurred at a protest against the Venezuelan government between University of Tachira students and the National Police.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reportan enfrentamientos entre la PNB y estudiantes en Táchira|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/06/reportan-enfrentamientos-entre-la-pnb-y-estudiantes-en-tachira/|accessdate=14 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 October 2014}}</ref> * '''7 October''' - Protests occurred in Mérida following issues with the allocation of funds for University of Los Andes.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sanchez|first1=Nora|title=En Mérida marcharán contra "pírrica" asignación presupuestaria|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141007/en-merida-marcharan-contra-pirrica-asignacion-presupuestaria|accessdate=19 October 2014|agency=El Universal|date=7 October 2014}}</ref> * '''8 October''' - The [[United Nations]] [[Working Group on Arbitrary Detention]] ruled that López was detained arbitrarily and that the Venezuelan government "violated several of their civil, political and constitutional rights" while demanding his immediate release.<ref name=ENoct8>{{cite news|title=ONU insta a la inmediata liberación de Leopoldo López|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/ONU-inmediata-liberacion-Leopoldo-Lopez_0_497350352.html|accessdate=9 October 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=8 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141009044857/http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/ONU-inmediata-liberacion-Leopoldo-Lopez_0_497350352.html|archivedate=9 October 2014|df=}}</ref> Students near the Territorial Polytechnic University of Alonso Gamero protested in which resulted in clashes with police.<ref>{{cite news|title=Universitarios manifestaron por la mala educación que reciben|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/08/universitarios-manifestaron-por-la-mala-educacion-que-reciben/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=8 October 2014}}</ref> Motorcycle taxi drivers protested in Puerto Cabello against insecurity in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mototaxistas de Puerto Cabello protestaron en contra de la inseguridad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/08/mototaxistas-de-puerto-cabello-protestaron-en-contra-de-la-inseguridad/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=8 October 2014}}</ref> * '''9 October''' - Workers in Maracay protested blocking Bolivar Avenue after not having electricity for 20 days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta en el centro de Maracay por fallas del servicio eléctrico|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/09/protesta-en-el-centro-de-maracay-por-fallas-del-servicio-electrico/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=9 October 2014}}</ref> * '''11 October''' - The Venezuelan government condemned the statements by the United Nations demanding them to not interfere in Venezuelan affairs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Venezuela rechazó resolución ONU sobre López y pide no inmiscuirse|url=http://www.elmundo.com.ve/noticias/actualidad/noticias/venezuela-rechazo-resolucion-onu-sobre-lopez-y-pid.aspx|accessdate=12 October 2014|agency=El Mundo|date=10 October 2014}}</ref> * '''12 October''' - Three Sidor protesters who were arrested are transferred to the SEBIN headquarters.<ref>{{cite news|title=rasladan a sidoristas detenidos a la sede del Sebin en Maturín|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/12/trasladan-a-sidoristas-detenidos-a-la-sede-del-sebin-en-maturin/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=12 October 2014}}</ref> * '''13 October''' - Agroindustrial engineering student Carlos Alberto Villamizar Guerrero was reported to be in critical condition after allegedly being struck by a National Police motorcycle during the 6 October protests at the University of Tachira. * '''14 October''' - The hospital where Carlos Alberto Villamizar Guerrero was being treated at stated that he was not in critical condition.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aseguran que estudiante de la Unet no fue agredido por la PNB|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/14/aseguran-que-estudiante-de-la-unet-no-fue-agredido-por-la-pnb/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 October 2014}}</ref> * '''15 October''' - At the University of Rafael Belloso Chacín in Maracaibo, a demonstration occurred where in one location blocked a street which resulted in the National Guard responding with tear gas and rubber bullets possibly injuring several individuals.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lluvia de lacrimógenas y perdigones dispersaron manifestación en la Urbe (Fotos + Videos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/15/atraviesan-autobus-y-trancan-el-paso-hacia-la-urbe-fotos/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 October 2014}}</ref> Merchants in Maracay protested outside of the CORPOELEC after not having electricity for over 26 days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comerciantes del centro de Maracay llevan más de 26 días sin luz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/15/comerciantes-del-centro-de-maracay-llevan-mas-de-26-dias-sin-luz/|accessdate=16 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 October 2014}}</ref> * '''16 October''' - Photos of Leopoldo López and Daniel Ceballos are released showing them reaching out of their jail cell windows holding papers showing the approval of the United Nations resolution demanding their release.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Charaima Velandria|first1=Joanna|title=López y Ceballos piden la libertad de los presos políticos desde Ramo Verde|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/politica/Lopez-Ceballos-politicos-Ramo-Verde_0_502149923.html|accessdate=18 October 2014|agency=El Nacional|date=16 October 2014}}</ref> * '''17 October''' - In the Maracay neighborhood of Guasimal, residents protested due to the lack of public services.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestan en Maracay por falta de servicios públicos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/17/protestan-en-maracay-por-falta-de-servicios-publicos/|accessdate=18 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=17 October 2014}}</ref> Students and professors of dentistry protested at the Central University of Venezuela due to the lack of supplies saying that out of 200 items, only 10 are found on the market in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes y profesores de odontología UCV protestan por falta de materiales|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/17/estudiantes-y-profesores-de-odontologia-ucv-protestan-por-falta-de-materiales/|accessdate=18 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=17 October 2014}}</ref> * '''18 October''' - A march title "Walk For Peace" was held by the Venezuelan opposition at the Caracas slum area of [[Petare]] where the attendees denounced shortages of medicine and food, labor terrorism, political persecution and insecurity.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así transcurrió la "Caminata por la Paz" convocada por la MUD (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/18/asi-transcurrio-la-caminata-por-la-paz-convocada-por-la-mud-fotos/|accessdate=19 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Movilización convocada por la MUD inició su marcha hacia Petare|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/18/movilizacion-convocada-por-la-mud-se-prepara-para-marchar-hacia-petare/|accessdate=19 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 October 2014}}</ref> * '''20 October''' - Citizens of Los Valles del Tuy protested blocking a street while demanding housing.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vecinos de los Valles del Tuy protestaron en exigencia de viviendas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/20/vecinos-de-los-valles-del-tuy-protestaron-en-exigencia-de-viviendas/|accessdate=22 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 October 2014}}</ref> * '''22 October''' - In Barinas, merchants closed shops due to disagreements with the mayor of the city.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cierran comercios en Barinas por disturbios (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/22/cierran-comercios-en-barinas-por-disturbios-fotos/|accessdate=30 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=22 October 2014}}</ref> * '''23 October''' - One day after leading a protest on campus, Yeison Carrillo, president of the Student Federation of the National University of Experimental Romulo Gallegos, was shot in the forehead and killed.<ref>{{cite news|title=De un tiro en la cabeza asesinan a dirigente del Psuv que habría sido detenido por drogas|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/23/de-un-tiro-en-la-cabeza-asesinan-a-dirigente-del-psuv-que-habria-sido-detenido-por-drogas/|accessdate=30 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=23 October 2014}}</ref> * '''28 October''' - Leopoldo Lopez stated that he would not attend trial until the Venezuelan government made a decision on the Working Group on Arbitrary Detention of the UN's decision, which demanded Lopez's release.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leopoldo López no asistirá a juicio hasta que el Tribunal se pronuncie sobre resolución de la ONU|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/10/28/leopoldo-lopez-no-asistira-a-juicio-hasta-que-el-tribunal-se-pronuncie-sobre-resolucion-de-la-onu/|accessdate=30 October 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=28 October 2014}}</ref>
==November== [[File:23 November 2014 Venezuela protest 2.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Protesters gathered at Altamira Square on 23 November.]] [[File:23 November 2014 Venezuela protest 3.jpg|right|250px|thumb|A protester at a 23 November protests holding a sign saying "[[Petare]] dawned furious, they do not have light".]] * '''2 November''' - Hidrobolívar workers begin protesting after collective agreement issues.<ref name=LPnov6>{{cite news|title=Persisten las protestas de trabajadores de Hidrobolívar|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/06/persisten-las-protestas-de-trabajadores-de-hidrobolivar/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 November 2014}}</ref> * '''3 November''' - Students of the University of Oriente at San Felix protested days after they, along with university personnel, were robbed violently.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la UDO San Félix retienen dos gandolas en protesta contra la inseguridad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/03/estudiantes-de-la-udo-san-felix-retienen-dos-gandolas-en-protesta-contra-la-inseguridad/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=3 November 2014}}</ref> *'''6 November''' - Teachers and citizens protested near Miraflores who demanded a raise from President Maduro and the Venezuelan government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Profesores protestaron cerquita de Miraflores (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/06/profesores-protestaron-cerquita-de-miraflores-fotos/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 November 2014}}</ref> Hidrobolívar workers continue protesting, still demanding negotiations for their collective agreement.<ref name=LPnov6/> Students at the Technical School of Carafe in the Libertador municipality protested against the lack of resources supplied to the school by the Venezuelan government for 6 years.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la Escuela Técnica Cadafe protestaron por falta de recursos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/06/estudiantes-de-la-escuela-tecnica-cadafe-protestaron-por-falta-de-recursos/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=6 November 2014}}</ref> *'''7 November''' - Administrative workers of the Ministry of Popular Power for Education protested over collective agreement issues.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores del Ministerio de Educación exigen discusión del contrato colectivo|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/07/trabajadores-del-ministerio-de-educacion-exigen-discusion-del-contrato-colectivo/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 November 2014}}</ref> Workers of Friosa ceased work after they received delayed payments while also denouncing problems that were created since it was nationalized.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Friosa se declaran de brazos caídos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/07/trabajadores-de-friosa-se-declaran-de-brazos-caidos/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=7 November 2014}}</ref> *'''10 November''' - In San Diego, residents began protesting after two houses were robbed and a person died suspiciously in the area.<ref name=LPnov11>{{cite news|title=Vecinos de San Diego de los Altos trancan nuevamente las calles para exigir seguridad (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/11/vecinos-de-san-diego-de-los-altos-trancan-nuevamente-las-calles-para-exigir-seguridad-fotos/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=11 November 2014}}</ref> A group of 46 families, mainly supporters of the Venezuelan government, created an organization called the "Committee of Victims of the Guarimbas and Continuous Blow" to share experiences of barricades and protest methods that have affected their lives.<ref>{{cite news|title=Chavistas crean comité para 'víctimas' de las protestas en Venezuela|url=http://www.elnuevoherald.com/noticias/mundo/america-latina/venezuela-es/article3725866.html|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Nuevo Herald|date=10 November 2014}}</ref> *'''11 November''' - Citizens of San Diego blocked roads protested for a second consecutive day against insecurity in the area.<ref name=LPnov11/> *'''13 November''' - Workers of PDVSA blocked roads in La Piña for several hours protesting against the debts of PDVSA and the decay of PDVSA facilities.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Pdvsa Industrial exigen pago de pasivos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/13/trabajadores-de-pdvsa-industrial-exigen-pago-de-pasivos/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=13 November 2014}}</ref> *'''14 November''' - In northern Anzoategui, three separate protest events denouncing poor roads and poor sewers while also demanding fumigation and better electric services caused traffic backups after closing a national road in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protestas causaron caos en la zona norte de Anzoátegui|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/14/protestas-causaron-caos-en-la-zona-norte-de-anzoategui/|accessdate=17 November 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=14 November 2014}}</ref> The Committee of Victims of the Guarimbas and First Vice President of the National Assembly Dario Vivas announced plans to "rebut" ideas that Leopoldo Lopez and other prisoners were the victims during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vivas: Víctimas de la Guarimba desvirtuarán "campaña de víctima de López"|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141114/vivas-victimas-de-la-guarimba-desvirtuaran-campana-de-victima-de-lopez|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Universal|date=14 November 2014}}</ref> *'''17 November''' - Residents in Valencia protested, blocking streets following large power outages Venezuela faced.<ref>{{cite news|title=Reaparecen las barricadas en la Isabelica por falta de luz; reportan disparos (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/17/reaparecen-las-barricadas-en-la-isabelica-por-falta-de-luz-reportan-disparos-fotos/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=17 November 2014}}</ref> *'''18 November''' - In Naguanagua, residents protested against state electric company CORPOELEC after not having electricity for several days.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vecinos de Carialinda protestaron en Corpoelec|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/18/vecinos-de-carialinda-protestaron-en-corpoelec/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 November 2014}}</ref> Supporters of Leopoldo Lopez gathered outside of a courthouse, with some chaining themselves while demanding his release.<ref>{{cite news|title=Así se encadenaron a las afueras del Palacio de Justicia en apoyo a Leopoldo López (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/18/asi-se-encadenaron-a-las-afueras-del-palacio-de-justicia-en-apoyo-a-leopoldo-lopez-fotos/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=18 November 2014}}</ref> *'''19 November''' - In El Callao, millers and miners protested over contracts and demanded the government to change the legality of certain mining procedures.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mineros y molineros tomaron las calles de El Callao|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/19/mineros-y-molineros-tomaron-las-calles-de-el-callao/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=19 December 2014}}</ref> *'''20 November''' - Workers of Hidrobolívar continued to protest over collective agreements after three weeks, blocking commercial offices where revenues are collected.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Hidrobolívar cumplen tres semanas de protesta|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/20/trabajadores-de-hidrobolivar-cumplen-tres-semanas-de-protesta/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 November 2014}}</ref> Residents of Villas del Río blocked the entrance to an industrial complex protesting over not having adequate sewage utilities and for the shortages of electricity in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comunidad cerró entrada a la Zona Industrial de Valera en protesta por fallas de electricidad|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/20/comunidad-cerro-entrada-a-la-zona-industrial-de-valera-en-protesta-por-fallas-de-electricidad/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=20 November 2014}}</ref> *'''22 November''' - A young group of protesters gathered outside of the Public Ministry of the State of Nueva Esparta demanding the release of student protesters arrested during the protests.<ref>{{cite news|title=Exigen al MP la liberación de estudiantes detenidos por protestar|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/22/exigen-al-mp-la-liberacion-de-estudiantes-detenidos-por-protestar/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=22 November 2014}}</ref> *'''24 November''' - Hidrobolívar protested for the 22nd consecutive day with calls of dialogue with the Bolivar state governor.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de Hidrobolívar continúan esperando que la empresa "dé la cara"|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/24/trabajadores-de-hidrobolivar-continua-esperando-que-la-empresa-de-la-cara/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=24 November 2014}}</ref> North Barquisimeto underwent protests after enraged resident experienced the failing of sewers in the area and proceeded to block roads and burn tires in the street.<ref>{{cite news|title=#24Nov Zona norte de Barquisimeto colapsó por protesta (Fotos)|url=http://elimpulso.com/articulo/24nov-zona-norte-de-barquisimeto-colapsa-por-protesta#|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=El Impulso|date=24 November 2014}}</ref> *'''25 November''' - After issues of the sales of tires occurred due to shortages in El Tigre, buyers protested near the store blocking a street for about 30 minutes resulting with a response from the National Guard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Clientes cerraron la vía El Tigre-Pariaguán por retrasos en la venta de cauchos|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/25/clientes-cerraron-la-via-el-tigre-pariaguan-por-retrasos-en-la-venta-de-cauchos/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=25 November 2014}}</ref> *'''26 November''' - Large groups of workers of the state-owned Central Azucarera Venezuela sugar plant protested for several hours after the repeated dismissal of workers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Trabajadores de la Central Azucarera Venezuela protestaron por despidos injustificados|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/26/trabajadores-de-la-central-azucarera-venezuela-protestaron-por-despidos-injustificados/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=26 November 2014}}</ref> *'''27 November''' - A group of families protested outside of the National Housing Institute (Inavi) headquarters in Puerto Ordaz over issues with their housing with the Great Housing Mission Venezuela.<ref>{{cite news|title=Engañados por Inavi reclaman apartamentos en Puerto Ordaz|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/11/27/enganados-por-inavi-reclaman-apartamentos-en-puerto-ordaz/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=27 November 2014}}</ref>
== December == [[File:7 December 2014 Venezuela protest.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Marvinia Jiménez and others protesting during a march from Altamira Square to the [[United Nations Development Programme|UNDP]] headquarters.]] *'''1 December''' - Retired employees of CORPOELEC protested after inadequate pay and demanded to meet with Jesse Chacón, minister of the electricity sector.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jubilados se amarraron a las puertas del edificio de Corpoelec en Alta Vista|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/01/jubilados-se-amarraron-a-las-puertas-del-edificio-de-corpoelec-en-alta-vista/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=1 December 2014}}</ref> *'''2 December''' - Residents of Boca Grita commandeered two fuel trucks, blocked roads between Tachira and Zulia and threatened to burn the trucks if the governor did not make an appearance.<ref>{{cite news|title=Secuestran dos gandolas cargadas con combustible en Orope; bloquean paso entre Táchira y Zulia|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/02/secuestran-dos-gandolas-cargadas-con-combustible-en-orope-bloquean-paso-entre-tachira-y-zulia/|accessdate=9 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=2 December 2014}}</ref> A group of 20 member of The Committee of Victims of the Guarimbas demonstrated outside of the Spanish embassy in Venezuela, demanding Spanish prime minister, Mariano Rajoy, to "not encourage impunity" after he demanded the release of Leopoldo Lopez on 27 October.<ref>{{cite news|title=Víctimas de las Guarimba piden a Rajoy no alentar la impunidad en Venezuela |url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141202/victimas-de-las-guarimba-piden-a-rajoy-no-alentar-la-impunidad-en-vene |accessdate=6 January 2015 |agency=El Universal |date=2 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150106080620/http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141202/victimas-de-las-guarimba-piden-a-rajoy-no-alentar-la-impunidad-en-vene |archivedate=January 6, 2015 }}</ref> *'''9 December''' - The Committee of Victims of the Guarimbas denounced the introduction of possible US sanctions saying it promoted impunity to opposition leaders that they believed were responsible for violence and criticized the decisions by the UN Committee against Torture and the Group on Arbitrary Detention, and the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comité de Víctimas de las Guarimbas rechazan sanciones de Estados Unidos|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141209/comite-de-victimas-de-las-guarimbas-rechazan-sanciones-de-estados-unid|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Universal|date=9 December 2014}}</ref> *'''12 December''' - Popular Will youth leader Gaby Arellano was delivered a letter by SEBIN to be imputed by the Public Ministry.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiscalía cita a Gaby Arellano para ser imputada|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141212/fiscalia-cita-a-gaby-arellano-para-ser-imputada|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Universal|date=12 December 2014}}</ref> The Committee of Victims of the Guarimbas presented a letter to the mission EU in Caracas to tell their stories of the protests while denouncing the Spanish prime minister.<ref>{{cite news|title=Comité de Víctimas contra la Guarimba pide audiencia ante Eurocámara|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141212/comite-de-victimas-contra-la-guarimba-pide-audiencia-ante-eurocamara|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Universal|date=12 December 2014}}</ref> *'''15 December''' - Protests occurred at Colonia Tovar in Aragua state over insecurity in the area.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta contra la inseguridad colapso accesos a la Colonia Tovar|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/15/cerrado-acceso-a-la-colonia-tovar-por-protesta-contra-la-inseguridad/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 December 2014}}</ref> Students at UNET Táchira protested over the budget.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes de la Unet en Táchira protestaron en exigencia de presupuesto justo (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/15/estudiantes-de-la-unet-en-tachira-protestaron-en-exigencia-de-presupuesto-justo-fotos/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=15 December 2014}}</ref> *'''16 December''' - Students from the Catholic University of Táchira protested in support of students who had been arrested since February.<ref>{{cite news|title=Protesta de estudiantes en el Táchira (Fotos)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/16/protesta-de-estudiantes-en-el-tachira-fotos/|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=La Patilla|date=16 December 2014}}</ref> *'''17 December''' - Former Mayor of Carabobo, Enzo Scarano, who was arrested by Venezuelan authorities was reported to be tried in military court.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rodriguez|first1=Marianela|title=Enzo Scarano será juzgado en instancias militares|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141217/enzo-scarano-sera-juzgado-en-instancias-militares|accessdate=20 December 2014|agency=El Universal|date=17 December 2014}}</ref> *'''18 December''' - Students chained themselves together in Plaza Altamira demanding the release of imprisoned protesters by the Venezuelan government.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóvenes se encadenan en Altamira para exigir liberación de estudiantes (Fotos y video)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/20/jovenes-se-encadenan-en-altamira-para-exigir-liberacion-de-estudiantes-fotos/|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=La Patilla|date=20 December 2014}}</ref> *'''19 December''' -The chief diplomat of the European Union, [[Federica Mogherini]], said that she was "seriously concerned" about "continuous arbitrary arrests", with the EU resolution noting that Leopoldo Lopez "suffered physical and psychological torture" and also denounced the situations of opposition mayors Daniel Ceballos and Vicencio Scarano.<ref>{{cite news|title=UE "seriamente preocupada" por detenciones arbitrarias en Venezuela|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/nacional-y-politica/141219/ue-seriamente-preocupada-por-detenciones-arbitrarias-en-venezuela|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=El Universal|date=19 December 2014}}</ref> *'''21 December''' - Students chained in Plaza Altamira sent letters to imprisoned protesters and called for a cacerolazo at night.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes presos enviaron cartas a jóvenes encadenados en Altamira|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/21/estudiantes-presos-enviaron-cartas-a-jovenes-encadenados-en-altamira/|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=La Patilla|date=21 December 2014}}</ref> *'''23 December''' - In the cities of Lara and Trujillo, students performed similar protests as those in Plaza Altamira and chained themselves together saying they would remain there until the Venezuelan government released student protesters.<ref>{{cite news|title=Estudiantes se encadenan en Lara y Trujillo (FOTOS)|url=http://www.lapatilla.com/site/2014/12/23/estudiantes-se-encadenan-en-lara-y-trujillo-fotos/|accessdate=6 January 2015|agency=La Patilla|date=23 December 2014}}</ref>

[[File:Topographic isolation and prominence.svg|thumb|400px|Topographic isolation and prominence]] The '''topographic isolation''' of a [[summit]] is the minimum [[great-circle distance]] to a point of equal [[elevation]], representing a radius of dominance in which the peak is the highest point. It can be calculated for small [[hill]]s and [[islands]] as well as for major [[summit (topography)|mountain peaks]], and can even be calculated for submarine summits. ==Isolation table== The following sortable table lists the Earth's 40 most topographically isolated summits. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+The 40 most topographically isolated summits on Earth

|[[Yushan (mountain)|Yushan]] |[[Taiwan]] |{{TWN}} {{epi|3952|3952|1814.83}} |[[Peak 4030]] |} == Examples == *The nearest peak to Germany's highest mountain, the 2,962-metre-high [[Zugspitze]], that has a 2962-metre-contour is the [[Zwölferkogel (Stubai Alps)|Zwölferkogel]] ({{Höhe|2988}}) in Austria's [[Stubai Alps]]. The distance between the Zugspitze and this contour is 25.8 km; the Zugspitze is thus the highest peak for a radius of 25.8 km around. Its isolation is thus 25.8 km. *Because there are no higher mountains than [[Mount Everest]], it has no definitive isolation. Many sources list its isolation as the circumference of the earth over the poles or – questionably, because there is no agreed definition – as half the earth's circumference. *After Mount Everest, [[Aconcagua]], the highest mountain of the American continents, has the greatest isolation of all mountains. There is no higher land for 16,534 kilometres when its height is first exceeded by [[Tirich Mir]] in the [[Hindu Kush]]. *[[Mont Blanc]] is the highest mountain of the [[Alps]]. The geographically nearest higher mountains are all in the [[Caucasus]]. [[Kukurtlu]] (4,912 m), which rises near [[Mount Elbrus]] (5,633 m), is the reference peak for Mont Blanc. ==Gallery== Everest kalapatthar crop.jpg|1. [[Mount Everest]] is the highest mountain peak on Earth. Monte Aconcagua.jpg|2. [[Aconcagua]] is the highest peak in both the [[Southern Hemisphere]] and [[Western Hemisphere]]. Denali Mt McKinley.jpg|3. [[Denali]] is the highest peak of [[North America]]. Glacier at summit of Mt Kilimanjaro 001.JPG|4. [[Mount Kilimanjaro|Kilimanjaro]] is the highest peak of [[Africa]]. Puncakjaya.jpg|5. [[Puncak Jaya]] on [[New Guinea]] is the highest peak on any [[ocean]] [[island]]. Vinson-Massif.jpg|6. The [[Vinson Massif]] is the highest peak of [[Antarctica]]. Mont.Orohena.JPG|7. [[Mont Orohena]] on [[Tahiti]] is the highest peak of [[French Polynesia]]. KeckObservatory.jpg|8. [[Mauna Kea]] on the [[Island of Hawaiʻi]] is the tallest mountain on [[Earth]] as measured from base to summit. GunnbjornFromAboveABC.jpg|9. [[Gunnbjørn Fjeld]] on [[Greenland]] is the highest peak of the [[Arctic]]. Mt Cook LC0247.jpg|10. [[Aoraki / Mount Cook|Aoraki]], or [[Aoraki / Mount Cook|Mount Cook]], on the [[South Island]] is the highest peak in [[New Zealand]]. Monte Bianco dal Dome du Gouter.jpg|11.
